loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 36 years old. She is married with seven children, ages 9 and 12; 5 of them go to school. She has been selling in her shop for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, plates, and spoons for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more salt, rice, and sugar for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy improved cookstoves and biomass pellets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay her daughter's high school fees

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 22-year-old married mother of one from the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer in the local secondary school; she teaches children beneficial life skills. Additionally, Josephine operates a successful business selling broiler chickens to her community. She is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she will be able to grow her operation by purchasing more chicks, feed, and the supplies she needs to raise the chicks. Higher profits will help her provide for her family and increase their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be God-fearing. 

He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are individuals. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a spray-painting air compressor to paint vehicles. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children.

loans.use: buy a spray-painting air compressor

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is married, has three children and all of them go to school. She has additional family members. 

She operates a restaurant on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for 4 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy flour, beans, cooking oil, cassava and sweet potatoes. She works for seven days a week. 

Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to buy better serving dishes and a fridge to serve her customers better. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy flour, beans, cooking oil, sweet potatoes, cassava.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Harinas conservantes y refrescos, son los insumos de panadería que requiere Jesus para tener una variedad de panes, tortas y pudines, con lo que mejorará su negocio, el cual inició desde el año 2012, cuando regresó del exterior a Colombia y decidió emprender en un local, ubicado en su propia casa, su propia aventura microempresarial. En su proceso productivo, trabaja un panadero que se encarga de la producción, mientras Jesus de la comercialización en su punto de ventas, entre sus vecinos ubicados en sectores aledaños. Su meta es diversificarlo dando apertura a una nueva linea de comidas , para generar mas ingresos y poder en un futuro comprar su propia casa . En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará, los insumos que requiere y nuevos productos, como harina, refrescos, azucar y conservantes, con el fin de impactar sus ventas y responder a su mayor desafio que no es otro,que el de incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Jesus needs flour, preservatives and beverages in order to have a variety of breads, cakes and puddings in his bakery so that he can improve his business.  He started this business in 2012 when he returned to Colombia and decided to open the bakery in his home as his own adventure into small business ownership.  In the bakery there is a baker who is in charge of the production while Jesus handles the sales among his neighbors and others in neighboring areas.  

His goal is to diversify the bakery and start a new line of meals in order to generate greater earnings and be able to purchase his own home in the future.  Jesus is now applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to purchase the supplies that he needs and new products such as flour, beverages, sugar and preservatives.  He hopes that these will impact his sales as well as help increase his earnings.

loans.use: Flour, preservatives and beverages.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. 

She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a favourable location and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to hire farm labour.

loans.use: hire farm labour.

loans.name: Pricillah

texts.en:
Pricillah is a female Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, bread, washing soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive location and her primary customers are medium. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of soap, flour, bread, and other items. Her business goal is to own a wholesale within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will own a supermarket.

loans.use: buy more stock of soap, flour, bread, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 26 years old, married, and has two children. She resides in the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school where she teaches life skills to students. She also volunteers in her community by assisting the elderly. 

To support herself and her family, Winnie operates a poultry business from her home where she sells broiler chickens. She started the business from the small savings she collected after being trained as a Learner Guide. Originally, Winnie started her business by producing a batch of 50 chickens every six weeks. However, her business has grown to producing 100 broilers every six weeks. 

Winnie requested a loan, which she will use to increase the number of broilers she produces and buy vaccines for her chickens. The profits will support her family and allow her to help disadvantaged children in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
Jackline's group is comprised of three hard working women. Jackline is 18 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. For the past year, Jackline has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh and other foods for sale, and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young siblings. Jackline hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into wholesale. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh and other foods for sale

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en: Tecla is married and lives in Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. She is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide; she mentors young students at the local school. For work, Tecla runs a small poultry business supplying broiler chickens to her community. Tecla is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase more chicks, chicken feed, chemicals, and feeding troughs to meet the high demand in her area. The growth of her business will improve her quality of life and create employment opportunities for members of her community.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a pub at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 20 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy local brew, spirits, crates of beer and soda. She also generates additional income from selling Airtime. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include power shortages. She aspires to buy better serving utensils. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy local brew, spirits, crates of soda and beer.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es: Ignacia de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña como artesana del barro, elaborando artículos como: vasijas, floreros, platos, figuras, etc. Dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 11 años por lo que gracias a su experiencia sus productos son considerados de excelente calidad y cada día son más los clientes que los solicitan  y la recomiendan. Ignacia desea reparar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra en muy malas condiciones, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines, capotes y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ignacia is 24 years old and lives in her own home along with her family. She is an entrepreneurial woman who works as an artisan in clay pottery, producing items such as dishes, vases, plates, ornamental figures, etc. She has done this work for the last eleven years and, thanks to her experience, her products are considered to be of excellent quality. Every day she has more clients requesting her products and recommending her to others. 

Ignacia would like to repair the roof of her home since it is currently in very bad condition. For this reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: galvanized sheeting, roof supports, canopies and connectors to change the roof on her house.

loans.use: to invest in: galvanized sheeting, roof supports, canopies and connectors to change the roof on her house.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en: Nino is a 37-year-old married woman. She lives in Kaspi district with her husband and school-age daughter. Her husband works as a driver and earns a small monthly income. Nino is currently unemployed and wants to start her own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 400 USD to purchase materials to sew household linens. She will get orders and will sell different types and sizes of linens at a good price. Nino will generate income and will be able to improve the living conditions of her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase materials to sew household linens

loans.name: Connie

texts.en: Connie is a businesswoman from the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. Each week, she fulfills her duties as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide by teaching life skills at the local secondary school. Additionally, Connie rents a shop at the local school to sell groceries like sugar, cooking oil, flour, and soap. She dreams of seeing her small business expand, and knows that hard work and dedication will be necessary. Connie is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase groceries in bulk and add new products to her shop. With the additional products, Connie hopes to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of grocery products

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photograph is Monicah, a member of Women of Faith Victory Group. She is fifty-one years old, married and living with her husband and four of her children. She operates a kiosk where she sells items like sugar, salt, cooking fat, flour and other household items. She has applied for a loan to add more stock consisting sugar, salt, cooking fat and flour to her shop so that she can sell more to meet her customers' demand. She says that this loan will help her increase her income which will help her improve her living standards such as providing quality education for her children.

 Monicah is happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy kiosk stock such as sugar, salt, cooking fat and flour.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Greetings from Bulawayo, the second largest city in Zimbabwe. Virginia is 54 years old and married with one child who is attending school. She runs a retail shop selling clothing and footwear. This business has been operational for eighteen years now, with one employee to assist her. Her main challenge has been stiff competition from her peers. Virginia has requested a $750 loan to buy clothing and footwear for resale. She says the income generated as a result of this loan will improve the quality of living for her family. In the near future Virginia would like to run a clothing boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Snezhanna

texts.ru:
Снежанна замужем. У нее есть четырехлетняя дочь. Снежанна занимается продажей детской одежды на рынке. Она арендует магазин. 

Снежанна трудолюбивый и ответственный человек. В будущем она хочет развивать бизнес  и завести еще одного ребенка. Но на данный момент Снежанна хочет улучшить жилищные условия семьи.

Снежанна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 35 000 гривен на ремонт дома. Она хочет поменять входные и межкомнатные двери,   а также окна.
texts.en:
Snezhanna is married. She has a four-year-old daughter. Snezhanna sells children's clothes at the market. She rents a shop.

Snezhanna is a hardworking and responsible person. In the future, she wants to develop her business and have another child. But currently, Snezhanna wants to improver her family's living conditions.

Snezhanna is requesting a loan for 35,000 hryvnia (UAH) to make renovations on her home. She wants to replace the entrance and interior doors as well as the windows.

loans.use: to replace the entrance and interior doors as well as the windows.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is married and lives in the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. She is very enthusiastic about growing her grocery business where she sells soap, cooking oil, flour, and sugar to her community. She loves her business and is proud that it has succeeded thus far. Alice is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase products in large quantities to increase her profits. This will help elevate her quality of life and provide employment to others in her community. In her spare time, she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in a nearby school. She teaches cooperative learning to the students.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products in large quantities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her fowl run and increase production to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.name: Pamela Tears

texts.en: Pamela is a businesswoman from Gokwe South District, Zimbabwe. She makes a living by operating a poultry project, but she also makes time to volunteer as a Camfed Learner Guide. Pamela produces about 50 birds every 6 weeks, but she would like to produce even more. Pamela is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she can purchase even more chicks, chick feed, and vaccines. The profits from her business will help her provide for her family. Pamela will also put away some money for herself so that she can go back to school.

loans.use: purchase more chicks, chick feed and vaccines

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is an entrepreneur from the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She is in the poultry business and produces about 100 broiler birds every six weeks. Bridget started her business to increase finances for her family, and she was pleased to discover that it was easy to set up and manage. Bridget also has time to volunteer as a Camfed Learner Guide when she is not working; she teaches leadership skills to young students. 

She is interested in a Kiva loan because she sees potential in her business. She would like to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production and increase her sales volume. Bridget will be able to provide for her family and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks to sell.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a 19-year-old businesswoman from Gokwe North District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide who also disseminates health information to students at the local secondary school. 

Rachel operates a stall at the local flea market where she sells skirts, blouses, dresses, trousers, and shirts. She has been running this business for the past year, with the help of her family members. With the loan from Kiva, Rachel intends to increase her stock of clothing items. This will boost her sales and profits. An increase in profits will assist her in furthering her education.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing items.

loans.name: Lydis

texts.en:
Lydis is a 27-year-old businesswoman; she is married with two children. Lydis lives in Gokwe North District, Zimbabwe with her family and spends her time volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school. 

Lydis has been operating a poultry business since last year. She started the business when she finished school; she knew that she needed a stable source of income and that poultry was a lucrative business to start at that moment. The loan from Kiva will allow her to purchase chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production. An increase in sales and profits mean that she will be able to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production.

loans.name: Shamiso

texts.en:
Shamiso is a businesswoman from the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She has been buying and selling clothing and accessories for the past two years. When she is not operating her stall at the nearby flea market, Shamiso participates in community clean-up activities and volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local school. 

With the Kiva loan, Shamiso intends to purchase more items to increase sales and profits. With the additional profits, Shamiso would like to expand her business and create employment opportunities for the people of her community.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Laina

texts.en:
Laina is a 41-year-old married woman with 7 children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has a year of experience with this business. 

Laina needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education and help with the renovation of her home. Laina has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates.

loans.name: Tunuvalu

texts.en: Tunuvalu is a 19-year-old single woman with no children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience in this business. Tunuvalu needs a loan to buy a block of butter, bags of flour, a barrel of cooking oil, a large pot, a strainer and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tunuvalu became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a block of butter, bags of flour, a barrel of cooking oil, a large pot, a strainer and a large stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing products

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is 19 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past year, Faridah has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh food.

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more bunches of fresh bananas to sell, and will help Faridah to generate greater profits and take care of herself and save some of it. Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to start a shoe business.



Faridah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more bunches of fresh bananas to sell.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.en: Olinda is a businesswoman from Mudzi District, Zimbabwe. She has been selling clothing at a flea market for almost a year now. She is also a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers at the local secondary school. With the loan that she is requesting from Kiva, Olinda would like to purchase more clothes to sell, in bulk, so that her sales and profits will increase. With the additional profits, she would like to expand her business so that she will be able help more vulnerable children in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en: Fuatino is a 39-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Fuatino needs a loan to buy drinks, snacks, candy, chairs, tables, plates and a new stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Fuatino became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snacks, candy, chairs, tables, plates and a new stove

loans.name: Naume

texts.en:
Naume is a 21-year-old single businesswoman from Gokwe North District, Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches secondary school students cooperative learning techniques. 

When she is not volunteering, Naume operates a grocery shop. She has been running her shop for the past year, and it is the only source of income for her family. Naume sells sugar, rice, tea, stationary, sanitary wear, cooking oil, and potato chips. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Naume intends to increase her inventory to improve profits and sales.

loans.use: To increase her inventory to improve profits and sales.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 19-year-old entrepreneur from the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She operates a store where she sells sugar, washing soap, cotton wool, and body creams. Caroline cites her mother as the inspiration for her business because her mother supported all of the children in the family. Caroline also teaches life skills as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide. With the requested loan, she intends to purchase her grocery items in bulk from wholesalers in order to increase profits. With the additional profits, Caroline would like to pay school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ianeta

texts.en:
Ianeta is a 57-year-old married woman with 2 children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has a year of experience with this business. 

Ianeta needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits, flippers and a spear. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. Ianeta has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits, flippers and a spear.

loans.name: Leatalua

texts.en:
Leatalua is 46 years old and married with 6 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for a year. 

Leatalua needs a loan to buy a large chest freezer, snacks, canned food, tea bags, sugar, flour, onions and deodorants. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a large chest freezer, snacks, canned food, tea bags, sugar, flour, onions and deodorants.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 41 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Tina needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, bags of rice and flour, sack of onions and potatoes. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, bags of rice and flour, sack of onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Alaviga

texts.en:
Alaviga is a 39-year-old single woman with 2 children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 4 years of experience with this business. 

Alaviga needs a loan to buy pies, sandwiches, soft drinks, snacks, coffee, tea bags, a new chest freezer and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Alaviga has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy pies, sandwiches, soft drinks, snacks, coffee, tea bags, a new chest freezer and plastic bags.

loans.name: Totua

texts.en: Totua is 56 years old, married, and has three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Totua needs a loan to buy new boots, new overalls, chemicals, fertilizer, a spade, a crowbar, and a new tiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Totua will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy new boots, new overalls, chemicals, fertilizer, a spade, a crowbar, and a new tiller

loans.name: Elvia Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Elvia Maribel se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de peluches, la socia vende peluches, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y el va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de peluches. La socia solicita el  credito para comprar peluches.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elvia Maribel is dedicated to selling stuffed animals. She sells stuffed animals from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She has already worked for many years in this business, and it is going very well. Her dream is to grow her business selling stuffed animals. She requests the loan to buy stuffed animals. 

She is happy with the loan, and she promises to comply with the repayments for her loan.

loans.use: to buy stuffed animals.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia has been operating a general store for many years and has successfully repaid her previous loans used for the business. She earns well to sustain her living and the business is doing well. She saved a portion of her revenue for her future needs. 

To increase sales, she took a new loan recently to purchase more grocery goods and grains to sell in addition to her inventory capital. She really wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods and grains to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock-feed and chicks.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en: Artemio, a married man in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, has been managing his own farm for a living. He has been doing this for over ten years. He uses his farm produce for their consumption and some of it is sold in the market. His family helps him in working their farm. Currently, he has joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and planting materials for the second cropping season of the year. In the future, Artemio wants to ensure a better source of income for his family from his improved farm.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and planting materials for the second cropping season of the  year.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
"Eighty percent of Kenyans are farmers; and by that, I mean [those] people who make a living off of the land; and 80 percent of the food that people eat comes from people who sell in the rural marketplace,” says Catherine, a 34-year-old mixed farmer based in Mosoriot, a remote village in the lush Nandi Hills area of Kenya. Catherine has a husband, and at home they have 4 children.

For the last 5 years, Catherine has been actively engaged in mixed farming. She sells her farm’s produce at a local market near her home. Her main income sources include milk, eggs and tea. Her in-depth knowledge of her environment has enabled Catherine to get her hands on numerous small business opportunities.

Catherine is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. She is very passionate about poultry farming. The most enjoyable task to her is raising poultry. Ironically, she doesn't enjoy feeding cows. Having additional poultry on her farm will bring her untold joy. The hens will also increase the farm's egg production and thus increase sales volume. Catherine needs to increase her income to take care of her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin and his grandmother Marta are both originally from El Salvador. Marvin has been living in the U.S. for the past 5 years and his grandmother for 25 years. Marvin has worked for 5 years at a pizzeria in Washington DC. He oversees a kitchen staff of 12 people. Back in El Salvador, Marvin owned and operated a cafe serving Latin American cuisine for 4 years. Marta works as a cleaning lady at a hotel in D.C. 

For the past several years, they have been saving to open up their own family pizzeria. The idea behind a pizzeria is that they are looking to start a family business to create family wealth as well as have more flexibility and freedom as they'll be running their own business. Marvin would make the pizzas and run the business and his grandmother would be more customer service and operating the cash register. This job would be less stressful and demanding on Marvin’s grandmother than her current role as a cleaning lady and allow her to work for several more years. 

They saved a total of $20,000 and spent these funds on the project. They found a location in the vibrant neighborhood of Columbia Heights in Washington, D.C.  Marvin and Marta are requesting $10,000 to purchase kitchen equipment (ovens, stove, hood, etc.). Marvin hopes that this is the first pizzeria of many. His dream is to establish a family owned and operated business that will build wealth for their family in the short and long term.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen equipment to open his first pizzeria in Washington D.C.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир – из Виноградово. У него три своих теплицы, где он выращивает цветоы и помидоры. У него есть наемные рабочие, которые работают у него в теплицах в сезон посева и сбора урожая. В этом тепличном бизнесе задействована вся семья Владимира. 

Владимир просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 40 000 гривен на закупку семян, дров, пленки и удобрений.  Полученную прибыль Владимир надеется вложить в строительство собственного дома, в который семья сможет со временем переехать со своей семьей.
texts.en:
Vladimir is from Vinogradovo. He has three of his own greenhouses where he grows flowers and tomatoes. He has hired workers who work in his greenhouses and seasonally sow seeds and harvest the crops. Vladimir's entire family helps with this greenhouse business.

Vladimir is requesting a loan for 40,000 hryvnia (UAH) to buy seeds, lumber, plastic covering and fertilizer. Vladimir hopes to invest the gained profit in building his own home, where he can eventually move with his entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, plastic covering and lumber for his greenhouses.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Las Mariposas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal las Mariposas está conformada  por trece integran entes mujeres responsables con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son personas de condición muy humilde, de las misma comunidad, tiene diferentes actividades económicas, que el medio de vida que tiene para subsistir y mantener a sus familias, y que les ayuda a cumplir sueños y metas que han propuesto en la vida  como cualquier personas como es brindarles estudios a sus hijos, y terminar de construir su casas de habitación.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Lilliam y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería  que es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, aceite, jabón, jugos, galletas, café, pan. Queso. Fósforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. la asociación comunal Las Mariposas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países  pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Las Mariposas Communal Bank is made up of thirteen members who are responsible women with twenty children under their care. They are all people of very humble conditions from the same community who have different economic activities that are their means to survive and support their families, and which help them accomplish the dreams and goals they have set in their lives like any other person, such as giving their children an education and finishing to build their homes.

Thanks to her determination to succeed, Lilliam is the coordinator of the group and makes a living running a "pulpería", which is a small grocery store that sells food products in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, soap, juices, cookies, coffee, cheese and matches. She spends twelve hours a day running her business offering these products. The objective of the loan is to invest the working capital and supply her business in the buying and selling of food products so that in the not too far off future she will be able to earn a higher income. Las Mariposas Communal Bank is grateful for the help of the Kiva lenders who offer people of low income and from poor countries like Nicaragua the ability to have decent jobs.

loans.use: to supply her grocery store with food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, soap, juices, cookies, coffee, cheese and matches.

loans.name: Jaime Alfonso

texts.es: Jaime de 32 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo. Él es un hombre que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sacar adelante el solo a su pequeño hijo, apoyándose en su trabajo, en el cual presta sus servicios de seguridad. La vivienda de Jaime se encuentra cercana de un rió, por lo que él tiene el temor que su terreno se esté minando y en cualquier momento pueda caer, y es por ello que desea construir un muro de contención,  por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, bloques de cemento, grava y hierro además deberá pagar mano de obra para construir un muro de contención en su vivienda.
texts.en: Jaime is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his son. Thanks to his effort and tenacity, he has succeeded in bringing his son forward through his work offering security services. Jaime’s home is close to the river, so he fears that his land is eroding and at any moment could fall. It is for this reason that he wants to build a retaining wall. He requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, cement blocks, gravel, and iron and also to pay workers to build the retaining wall in his home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, cement blocks, gravel, and iron and also to pay workers to build the retaining wall in his home.

loans.name: Bernandita

texts.en: Bernandita settled for a living in Misamis Occidental with her family. For over seven years, she has earned more income from her transportation services and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for spare parts and accessories. Bernandita wants to improve the services and most of all the safety of her customers. For this reason, she took a new loan recently to repair the existing vehicle for better services. She wants to acquire an additional vehicle to expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for a better services.

loans.name: Romie

texts.en: Romie is married and has a child. He and his family live in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He operates a transportation services business in their community, which has helped him to earn a better income for his family's needs. He successfully repaid his previous loan, which was used to pay for maintenance expenses for his vehicle. He experienced some financial problems in the previous month due to health problems. Despite this, he continues striving for his family's stability and their future. He took a new loan recently to buy a new set of tires to replace the old and used tires. In the future, he plans to have more motorcycles to increase his income and to provide a better living for his family.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Delmer

texts.en: Delmer and his family live in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He has been a farmer since he was young. It is work that he learned from his father. Farming is their main source of income, and Delmer always finds better ways to expand and improve his farm for a better future for his family. He joined GDMPC recently and has borrowed a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients. He is hoping for a better harvest in the future that will help them prosper and improve their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Lat

texts.en:
Lat, 43 years old, is an active rice farmer in a small community of Kampong Speu Province. She has three dependent children who are currently in school. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a rice farming business in a small farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been a farmer for more than thirty years. 

Lat would like to improve her living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, she is asking for a Kiva loan to build a small biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnership with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she will not spend much money on fuel and will lessen the smoke produced from wood or charcoal. She is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate better than its general loans. Lat awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a small biogas digester.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is married with three children and lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She has sold snacks in their village for over ten years. She also accepts orders from her customers for any occasions. She earns sufficient income to sustain their needs and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying raw ingredients. Edith took a new loan recently to purchase raw ingredients to prepare snacks to sell. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her family's living situation and to support her children in their education.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to prepare snacks to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Masindi, Uganda. He sells farm inputs and produce. He started his business so as to support his family. He wishes to have his own permanent premises for his business so as to avoid high costs of renting business premises. Weather and seasonal changes affect his business.

He wants a loan to buy seeds to sell.

loans.use: to buy seeds to sell.

loans.name: Doratea

texts.en: Doratea lives in Oe-cusse. She is a businesswoman and she has a kiosk. She is requesting a loan of $800 USD to improve her business. She is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as shampoo, soaps, candies, biscuits, SGM milk, pop noodles, balm, glue, and other items to sell. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $3000 USD. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. She wants to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she will use the loan to improve her business and to increase her income in the future.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soaps, candies, biscuits,  SGM milk, pop noodles, balm, glue and other items to sell.

loans.name: Tsitsi

texts.en:
Tsitsi is a 25-year-old businesswoman from the Gokwe South district of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at a local school in her community; she teaches students valuable life skills. To provide for her family, Tsitsi sells clothing at the local flea market.

Tsitsi is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase more clothes to sell, to meet the high demand from her customers. At this time, Tsitsi lacks the capital to increase the quantities she has available to sell in her store. An increase in stock will raise her profits and generate more income to help her care for her child and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Bulgan

texts.en: Bulgan is a 27-year-old mother who lives with her husband, five children, and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling trousers at an outdoor market since 2013. Her husband works at a construction site. Two of their children go to secondary school and the others go to kindergarten. Her family lives in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. Bulgan is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy an electric car to transport her children to their school and kindergarten. Winter is approaching and it gets dark earlier, so walking from school to home will be dangerous for her children. The electric car she is purchasing emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel.

loans.use: to buy an electric car to transport her children from school to home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron; to buy gutters; and to pay for installation.

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Bora is a 65-year-old man who lives in a remote area of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. At home, he is a lovely father of one dependent child and a married child. He has been a doctor​​​​​ who helps people in his village since 1980. His wife, Navy,manages and operates a rice farming business. This couple can make a net profit of around $7 USD a day.

Bora wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV, and radio. He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. Bora awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica settled for a living in Lopez Jaena with her small family. She helps her husband manage their own farm for a living. With her revenue, she was able to put up a retail business in addition to their farm. She has sold cosmetic products in their community for over a year and the business is doing well. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. Jessica took a loan recently to purchase more cosmetic products to sell. She plans to use her income to buy another farm and to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Tsogt-Ochir

texts.en: Tsogt-Ochir, 45 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2012. His wife sells clothes at a trade center. Their eldest daughter studies at the university. Tsogt-Ochir is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to pay his daughter's tuition fee. He believes that getting educated will create great opportunities for his daughter. He does not want his daughter to be a taxi driver or clothes seller.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly, 41 years old, is an active rice farmer in a small community in Kampong Speu Province. He has four unmarried children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a rice farming business on farmland that is located near his house. He has been involved with this business since 1980 and the net profit that he can make is USD 3 a day. 

Ly would like to improve his living standards by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, he is asking for a Kiva loan to build a small biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnership with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, he hopes that he won’t spend much money on fuel and will lessen the smoke from wood or charcoal. He is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate better than its general loans. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a small biogas digester

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 55 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. Paz works very hard to provide for them.

Paz runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 2 years. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

In the future, Paz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 35 years old. She lives in the Kaspi district with her 13-year-old school-aged daughter. Lia works at a local kindergarten as a wet-nurse and gets 220 GEL (Georgian Lari) per month. As her existing income is not enough to cover her everyday costs, Lia decided to start her own business and get additional income.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $800 to start a trading business. With the credit she receives, Lia will purchase a stock of clothes and will resell then at higher prices in the Kaspi district. This will increase her income, and in turn she will generate better living conditions for her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes to resell

loans.name: Iasinta

texts.en:
Iasinta is a 55-year-old, divorced woman, with four children. To earn a living, she makes and sells barbecue in her community. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Iasinta needs a loan to buy a brand new barbecue grill, tongs, large pots, sausages, chicken leg quarters, and soy sauce. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Iasinta has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a brand new barbecue grill, tongs, large pots, sausages, chicken leg quarters, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Dulguun

texts.en:
Mr. Dulguun has used his previous loan effectively and now lives with his mother in comfortable and warm place. His main income comes from the driver job for a cable television company. 

This time he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to an buy electric car for the job. Because his former car became outdated, it was emitting black smoke and polluting the environment, so he is buying electric car which does not emit harmful pollutants and wastes less fuel.

loans.use: to an buy electric car, as his former car was emitting black smoke.

loans.name: Ledita Esmeralda

texts.es: Ledita de 27 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se desempeña como artesana de barro, elaborando productos como: vasijas, floreros, platos, etc. todo a base de barro, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 12 años por lo que gracias a su experiencia y creatividad sus productos son considerados de excelente calidad. La vivienda de Ledita ya tiene algunos años de construcción, por lo que tanto las paredes como el techo de la misma se encuentran deteriorados, es por ello que necesita repararlos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, madera, lámina y polines para reparar el techo y las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ledita, aged 27, is a single mother and lives in her own home with her son.

She is a hard-working woman, who makes a living working as an artisan of clay goods. She makes products such as pots, vases, plates, and the like—everything made from clay. She has been following such occupation for the last 12 years, and as a result of her experience and creativity, her products are considered to be of excellent quality.

Since Ledita's house was built a number of years ago, both the walls and the roof are deteriorated; therefore, she needs to repair them. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, timber, metal sheeting, and purlins to repair the roof and the walls of her home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, timber, metal sheeting, and purlins to repair the roof and the walls of her home.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old and married with six children. With children in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, milk, coffee and other items.

Teresita has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, milk, coffee and other items

loans.name: Cabriela

texts.en:
A $1000 loan is offered to Gabriela to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as a refrigerator, soft drinks (Fanta, water, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, eggs, biscuits, noodles, shampoo, soap, and oils. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2009. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Gabriela independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Baasansuren, 55 years old, lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a sentry at a private firm for five years. His wife teaches literature at a high school. Their elder son is an electrical engineer and works at a power plant and their younger son goes to high school. 

Baasansuren is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, planks, and fiberglass for house renovation. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and then fewer pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Orepa

texts.en: Orepa is 65 years old and married.  She has12 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Orepa needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a watering hose, gloves, a tiller, a spade and new boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Orepa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a watering hose, gloves, a tiller, a spade and new boots

loans.name: Sea

texts.en:
Sea, 58 years old, is an active rice farmer in a small community of Kampong Speu Province. He has six unmarried children and he also has two married children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a rice farming business in a farm land which is located near his house. He has been involved with this business since 1979 and the net profit that he can make is USD 3 a day. 

Sea would like to improve his living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, he is asking for a Kiva loan to build a small biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, he hopes that he won’t spend much money on fuel and will lessen the smoke from wood or charcoal. He is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate better than its general loans. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a small biogas digester

loans.name: Julynda

texts.en:
Julynda is 32 and has an only child. She helps her husband on their farm for a living. Aside from planting, she helps her husband make seedlings and grafting materials and sells them in their community. The couple earns good income from this. 

She borrowed a new loan to buy raw materials for grafting and organic fertilizer. She hopes to expand her business in order to make more savings for her child's future education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for grafting and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Kiza Jean

texts.en: Kiza Jean studies in the university, seeking a BS degree in Aquatic Resource Management and Technology.  She wants to help the environment.  She was determined that, with her knowledge, she would contribute beyond what is in her mind for now.  Making her family proud of her is one of her goals in life. Her previous loan from GDMPC was used for school supplies and other materials needed last semester.  Recently, she took a new loan to cover miscellaneous expenses and books for the first semester. In the future, she wants to become successful.

loans.use: to cover miscellaneous expenses and books for the first semester

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional ingredients, like milk and sugar.

Mary Jane has been in this business for three years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients, like milk and sugar.

loans.name: Talava

texts.en:
Talava is 43 years old and divorced with two children. 

She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for one year. Talava has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, brushes, rollers, material, stencils, rubber designs, and a new cutter. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, brushes, rollers, material, stencils, rubber designs, and a new cutter

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Saran, 32, is a farmer in a small rice farmland near her house. She has two children dependent on her.  So far, she has been a farmer for twenty one years and the average income that she can make is USD 2.00 a day.   

To accelerate her farming process, she wants to buy cows to help her in the farming process. Because there is insufficient money, she would like to apply for KIVA loan via HKL to buy the cows. With the support from this loan, she hopes to process her farming faster than before and receive more crops. She thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Laira

texts.en: Laira has made a living in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental with her family. She has been helping her husband in their fishing business for over twenty-one years.  She has successfully repaid her previous loan for buying new fishing nets. She took a new loan recently to cover fishing boat repairs and maintenance costs.  She wants to increase her sales so as to save more for her plan to acquire a new fishing boat used for the business.

loans.use: to cover fishing boat repairs and maintenance costs.

loans.name: Annette

texts.en:
Annette is 52 years old and has one child.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Annette has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Annette aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Madai Gabina

texts.es:
La socia Madai Gabina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz, trigo entre otros, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Madai Gabina still works selling dried grains like corn, wheat, and more. Through this business, she wants to be able to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her grain-sales business. She is requesting the loan to buy corn, barley, and wheat.

Madai Gabina is happy about the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy corn, barley, and wheat

loans.name: Queeni

texts.en: Queeni, a 29 year old woman with an only child, runs a general store for a living.  She has had her business for over two years and the business is doing well, while her husband earns from working as a carpenter. She joined GDMPC and has borrowed a new loan to buy additional groceries for sale.  In the future, she wants to expand her business so as to improve the general living of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for sale

loans.name: Lizah Mae

texts.en: Lizah Mae wants to find a better job in the future. She is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration degree at university. She has two siblings living with her family. Her father earns money from transportation services, and with his little earnings is able to support their education. Lizah Mae joined GDMPC recently and has taken a loan to pay her tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is a married 56-year-old mother of six who has settled for a living in Lopez Jaena. Her husband operates a transportation service using their motorcycle, and she helps him with it. She also sells snacks in their village to earn other income aside from this. She has taken a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover maintenance costs for their vehicle. She plans to acquire a new vehicle to expand the business.

loans.use: to cover maintenance costs

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Her name is Lolita. She is thankful that she was previously granted a 12,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase hardware toosl and supplies for her hardware shop. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
She would like to apply for another Php 10,000 with which to buy additional tools and other hardware items needed in her store. The more items displayed at the store the will mean more sales and thus increase her earnings. It will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She is glad and thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Lolita aims to grow her business and dreams to have her own place for her hardware store. She hopes that all her six children will finish school.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for hardware items like keys, locks, handles, wire, and other tools, and to maintain her shop

loans.name: Wenfilda

texts.en:
Wenfilda is 42 years old and married with four children, three of whom in school. Wenfilda works very hard to provide for them.
She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.
Wenfilda has been in this business for two years. 
In the future Wenfilda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en:
Joanina is applying for a loan of $800 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 38 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as Body Loosen, shampoo and hair oil.  She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 
Joanina is living in a town nearby the school.  Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy Body Loosen, shampoo and hair oil

loans.name: Cheril

texts.en:
Cheril is 34 years old and married.  She has five children, four of whom are in school, Cheril works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Cheril has been in this business for two years.  In the future Cheril would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Kembang Kertas Group

texts.en:
Ni Nengah, 39, was chosen as the head of the Kembang Kertas group when the group was estabished. After several loan cycles, she can manage the group and arrange them to do the business well. The pigs business has proven to support their incomes to fulfill the families’ needs. Ni Nengah sold her pigs, and she can make her plans come true to renovate her kitchen.

The Kembang Kertas group has received eight loan cycles, and their main goal is to become successful pig breeders with their own capital. Now, the group still needs a new loan to increase their businesses. With seven members, the group is receiving 9,950,000 IDR.

Ni Nengah is using her portion of the loan to purchase two superior piglets and feed. She plans to save all the profit and use it for capital later. She hopes it will work.

The group is showing their thankfulness for the loan because they can have it without collateral and receive free training from the vet.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Srey Yon

texts.en:
Srey Yon (pictured at home), age 22, is single and lives with her parents in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Srey Yon is a third-year student, majoring in nursing at the university in Phnom Penh. She hopes to graduate in 2015, and she will become a professional nurse for a hospital or clinic.

She is asking for a loan in order to pay for her school fee.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida has been working on her family's farm for a living. This is her main source of income, but she also sells firewood and coconuts in their village, and would sell in town if she had more stock. She successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to buy copra to sell. Recently, she took a new loan to buy coconuts and firewood to sell. 

Adelaida wants to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and firewood to sell

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гульзат 40 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. В поиске источника доходов для своей семьи, она 24 года назад стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Гульзат достигла хороших успехов в работе и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гульзат имеется 3 дойные коровы, 10 овец, также 18,00 ГА земли, где она выращивает зерновые культуры для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Гульзат реализует экологически чистое домашнее молоко, которое пользуется большим спросом среди местных жителей. Так как спрос на молоко растет, Гульзат обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на покупку племенной дойной коровы, часть средств будет направлено на постройку сарая для скота. Доходы от кредита Гульзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, а также на покупку автомобиля для семьи.
texts.en:
Gulzat is 40 and married with two children. 24 years ago, in a search for a source of income for her family, she started working in agriculture and animal husbandry.Thanks to her hard work she has achieved great success in her business and now earns a monthly income of 8,000 KGS, with assets including three milking cows, 10 sheep and 18 hectares of land on which she grows cereal crops both for her own use and for sale. 

Gulzat sells organic milk, which is in high demand among local residents. Since demand is growing, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy an additional milking cow as well as to build a barn for her livestock. She plans to use profits from the loan to further develop her business and to buy a family car.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase sales of organic milk and to build a barn for her livestock

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 44 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school.

Angela is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Angela requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Angela has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Estela

texts.en:
Ma. Estela is 39 years old and married.  She has five children, four of whom are in school,  Ma. Estela works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like noodles, chips, coffee, soap, etc.

Ma. Estela has been in this business for two years.  In the future Ma. Estela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like noodles, chips, coffee, soap, etc

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 56 years old and married with six children.
Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.
Helen has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising chickens.
Helen aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sopian

texts.en:
Meet Sopian. Sopian is single and he lives with four family members in Sukabumi, a city located about 106 kilometers from Jakarta. 

He runs a small shop that sells mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and he serves mobile phone reparation for his customers. He began working with PT Rekan Usaha Mikro Anda (Ruma) about a month ago because he wanted to expand his business. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to provide more mobile airtime transactions on the weekends. 

Sopian is pictured in the photo, holding a Ruma banner in his small shop, while the man behind him is one of his customers who was looking around his shop when the photo was taken. Sopian thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile phone services in his community.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 33-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Fouzia is providing sewing services and earning an income to contribute along with her husband to managing the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Fouzia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase needles, threads, pieces of cloth, and machine oil

loans.name: Pucaray De Huancalle Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PUCARAY DE HUANCALLE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Pisac, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Margot, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua preparando diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para comprar insumos como carne, aceite entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de papa, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
These are members of the PUCARAY DE HUANCALLE communal bank, located in the Pisac district, within the Cusco department and province. Margot continues running food sale business, which she has done for years. Her business is doing well, thanks to the commitment she invests in it daily. The member prepares and sells various dishes such as chicken and potatoes, soups, and meat dishes, among others. Margot wants to continue working so that she can keep supporting her family.

Margot is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as meat, oil, and other things. The other members are in the business of selling potatoes, groceries, and food. Margot is for this loan, and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall such as meat and oil, among others.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
His name is Melchor. He is thankful that he was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which he used to buy slippers to sell for his business. He also drives a Jeepney, in which he transports people from one place to another to augment his income. Through his earnings he is able to support his family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
Melchor would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP, which he will use buy more quantities of slippers to add to his inventory. Having more items displayed at the store will mean more sales and thus increase his earnings. It will definitely help him sustain his family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. He is thanking God in advance for the financial grant that will be given to him. 

Melchor hopes to own a Jeepney. He dreams of giving his children the best education possible for them to have a good future. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy slippers to sell.

loans.name: Nolita

texts.en:
Nolita is 70 years old and a widow with five children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Nolita is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nolita has been farming vegetables for eleven years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy improved cookstoves and biomass pellets

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Marites works hard to support her family. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Marites is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy more bananas to sell in her food stall.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 54 years old and single with one child. She has a small flower garden where she grows a variety of colorful flowers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Louise needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a pitchfork, a spade, a crowbar, a rake, gloves, plastic pots, and new boots. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Louise will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a pitchfork, a spade, a crowbar, a rake, gloves, plastic pots, and new boots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, as well as to pay for labor to put a cement floor in the bedroom of her house.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina has three children and lives in Lopez Jaena with her live in partner. To make a living, she helps him in their fishing business. She sells fish in the market earning well to provide for their needs. She is asking for a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new fishing nets. Hoping to improve her business, she wants to increase sales to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past nine years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from farming sugarcane and pig fattening. Norma has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Norma has previously borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Saleema

texts.en:
Saleema, 42 years old, lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last seven years. His rickshaw has not been working properly for some time because it gets such regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order and he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

Saleema's husband wants to buy a new auto rickshaw but, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. Saleema has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Saleema is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Moila

texts.en: Moila is a 41-year-old unwed woman with 8 children. For the past two years, she has operated a business making and selling ice-cakes in her community. Moila needs a loan to buy sugar, a large cooler, cordials, a new chest freezer, a large spoon, Chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Moila has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy sugar, a large cooler, cordials, a new chest freezer, a large spoon, Chinese candy and foam cups

loans.name: Savali

texts.en: Savali is 22 years old and single with one child. She owns and operates a small store selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for one year. Savali needs a loan to buy bags of salt, sugar, flour, rice, a sack of onions, curry powder, snacks, a crate of soft drinks and water bottles. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house. She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, flour, rice, onions, curry powder, snacks, soft drinks and water bottles

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José de 44 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 20 y 18 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se desempeña como albañil, dicha actividad la realiza de lunes a sábado desde hace mucho tiempo, su compañera de vida lo apoya gracias a su trabajo como cocinera de un hotel y vendedora de productos por catalogo. José desea encementar el piso de su vivienda, ya que este es de tierra por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: José is 44 years old and lives in his own house along with his wife and their two children ages 20 and 18. José is an entrepreneurial man who makes a living working in construction. He works Monday through Saturday and has done so for a very long time. His wife supports him, thanks to her job as a cook in a hotel and her business selling products via catalogs.
