José wishes to put a cement floor in his home since it is currently a dirt floor. For this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, and gravel to put a cement floor in his home.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is glad that she was previously granted a 26,000 PHP loan, which she used as additional working capital in her direct sales business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
Tomasa would like to apply for another PHP 28,000 loan, which she will use to buy more merchandise and products to add to her inventory. More items displayed at the store will mean more sales and thus increased earnings. It will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. Tomasa is thanking God in advance for the financial support that will be given to her. 

Tomasa aims to grow her business and have her own place for it. She desires that her offspring will marry someday so she can enjoy her grandchildren. Tomasa faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Thai, who is 56 years old, lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. He has five married children, and he also has three dependent children. He is an active and honest farmer who makes an income of around USD 8.00 per day. So far, he has been working as a farmer for 34 years.  
Thai wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote good health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy improved cookstoves and biomass pellets

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children,  Regina works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs.  Regina is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Regina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, 40, who is a lovely mother of three dependent children, lives in a small community of Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. So far, she has been involved in the farming business for twenty-six years. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells the crop to the local dealers. Sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market. 

For supplementary income, she wants to hire a one-hectare plot of farmland to operate the farming business. Because of the shortage of capital investment, she would like to apply for a Kiva loan to pay for hiring a one-hectare plot.

With the support of this loan, she hopes she can increase her income and change her living standard. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to pay for hiring a one-hectare plot of farmland.

loans.name: Shandy Rocio

texts.es:
La socia Shandy Rocio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz, trigo entre otros, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Shandy Rocio still works selling dry grains such as corn and wheat, among others. Through this business, she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her business selling grains. She is requesting this loan to buy corn, barley, and wheat.

Shandy Rocio is happy about the loan and she promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy corn, barley, and wheat.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура повторная клиентка ИМОН. Она имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Манзура очень честная и добрая женщина. Она родилась в семье постуха в 1986 году. Манзура с детства помогала отцу по скотоводству. После окончания средней школы она поступила в Худжандский Государственный Университет. Она получила высшее педагогическое образование. Манзура вышла замуж и родила 2 детей. Данное время ее муж Наим находится в Российской Федерации. Манзура сама занимается скотоводством. Она откармливает крупно - рогатый скот и мелко рогатый скот. Манзура данное время имеет 100 голов мелко-рогатый скот. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес дальше и увеличить доход. С полученного дохода она собирается дать хорошее образование своим детям. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки мелко-рогатого скота. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Manzura is a repeat client at IMON. She has a good credit record. Manzura is a very honest and kind woman. In 1986, she was born into a family of shepherds. During her childhood, Manzura helped her father with the livestock. After graduating from high school, she enrolled in Khujand State University. She received a degree in teaching. Manzura got married and had two children. Currently, her husband, Naeem, is in the Russian Federation. Manzura is working in animal husbandry. She fattens cattle and smaller livestock. Manzura currently has a herd of 100 goats and sheep. She wants to further expand her business and increase revenue. With profits from the loan, she is going to provide a good education for her children. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy livestock. She's waiting for your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: buy livestock.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Her name is Joan. She is grateful that she was granted a 60,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase ready-to-wear clothing needed in her business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 60,000 loan, which she will use for her working capital to buy more RTW clothes and to open a variety store to augment her income.  More items displayed at the store will mean more sales and increased income. It will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her offspring's educational expense. She is thanking God in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Joan aims to grow her business and have her own place for the variety store that she plans to open. She dreams of giving her child a good education and having a harmonious relationship with her husband.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more ready-to-wear clothing and open a variety store

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hard-working entrepreneur who has an egg retailing business in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of eggs to sell to customers.

NWTF is presenting Elena's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 71 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Salvacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mekar Sandat Group

texts.en:
The Mekar Sandat group can pay off the loan on time. During the past six months, the group succeeded in maintaining the pigs. Besides control by the loan officer, they also are visited by the vet regulary. That way the pigs can grow well and have a good price.

Ni Komang, as the head, is responsible for the group and the repayment. As the piglets seller, she succeeded to sell out her piglets. She is very happy for that, and she hopes with the next loan, she will get more to improve her business.

Although most inhabitants there work as farmers, as do Balinese women, they still maintain the culture of raising pigs for supporting the family income. 

Ni Komang is using her loan to purchase two superior piglets and feed. She’s trying a new plan to manage fattening pigs. She hopes the price for pigs stays high, and she can earn a satisfactory profit. 

Two members couldn’t attend the meeting because they went to the temple for praying.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Lorn is a 47-year-old, married woman .She has three dependent children and she also has two married children. She lives in a small village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. 

To make a living and support her family, Lorn manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this career for 24 years, with average income is USD 8.00 a day.

Lorn wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan, granted through Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), that has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai, who was born in 1971 in Dong Anh district, has one son and one daughter. The older daughter is studying at the university, while the younger son is doing his last year at high school.  Mai’s husband is a worker and Mai has been running a grocery store for six years. Her family’s total income is about VND 9,000,000 per month. 

Mai has been a loyal participant in SEDA’s program since 2003. She repaid her previous loan of VND 11,554,000 and is now requesting her eighth loan for VND 12,862,000 to purchase goods for her grocery. She wishes she could save enough money to expand her business and provide a better education for her children. The other members of Mai’s group are as follows:
 
• Vuong is 54 years old. She has two children. She is requesting a loan of 13,298,000 VND to sell fruits at the market. 
• Dang is 46 years old. She has two children. She is applying for a 12,426,000 VND loan to raise pigs. 
• Nhan is 33 years old. She is the mother of two children. She wants to borrow VND 12,426,000 to make tofu and raise pigs. 
• Van is 52 years old. She is the mother of two children. She would like to borrow VND 12,426,000 to buy construction materials to resell.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her grocery

loans.name: Jonnalyn

texts.en: Jonnalyn is 18 years old, single, and currently studying at Nueva Vizcaya State University for her Bachelor of Science in Hotel, Restaurant, and Tourism management. She is aiming to finish her degree and be employed someday to help her parents finance the education of her younger sisters and improve their status of living. Due to the high cost of school fees, her parents could not afford to finance her studies. For this reason, Jonnalyn wants to access educational assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 15,000.00 to pay her tuition and miscellaneous fees in full. She is hoping that she will obtain her loan request to be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her tuition and miscellaneous fees in full

loans.name: Nining

texts.en:
Nining is a housewife who lives with her husband and their two children in West Bandung, a regency area in West Java. Her husband works in a private company and she contributes to the family income by running a small business that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. 

Nining joined Ruma a month ago because she wanted to expand her network, learn how to use technology, and learn how to run her small stall more effectively. She is excited about expanding her business to now sell mobile phone airtime credits. She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to provide more mobile airtime transactions to her community on the weekends. 

Nining is pictured in the photo sitting in her house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To provide mobile services in her community

loans.name: Ma. Gloria

texts.en:
Ma. Gloria, is aged 52, married to a farmer, and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a food vending business in their village for almost 10 years, earning a net income of PHP 300 daily, money that is usually spent on their daily expenses. 

Due to lack of capital, Ma. Gloria is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase more eggs, fish, vegetables, dried fish, onions, garlic, and food seasonings to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase eggs, fish, vegetables, dried fish, onions, garlic, and food seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is 62 years old, a mother of five children and living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her elder son has owned a nursery farm business for the last 10 years where he sells different kinds of plants. Mostly, he focuses on flower plants, fruit plants, and some export quality plants to sell to his customers. He prefers quality instead of quantity in his nursery farming business. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this nursery farm business. 

Now, the needs of his family have increased suddenly and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock so that he can maximize sales from the business.

Therefore, Sughran requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy more plants to sell. Sughran thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more plants for her son's nursery farm business

loans.name: Jiani

texts.en:
Meet Jiani. He is single and lives with his four family members in Sukabumi, a city located about 106 km from Jakarta. He runs a small stall that sells men’s accessories, such as hats, belts, sling bags, and sandals. He also sells mobile phone airtime credits and utility bill payment services to his customers. 

Jiani began working with Ruma about a month ago because he wanted to expand his business opportunities. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits, especially because his small stall is located near a factory with lots of factory workers visiting his stall. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to provide more mobile airtime and bill payment transactions on the weekends. 

Jiani thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide bill payment and mobile services in his community

loans.name: Kimanga Group

texts.en:
Asia, who is in her 40s, is married and a mother of five children, two of whom are at school and the rest are grown. She has been supporting her family by running small businesses. She has a genge selling fruits and vegetables, snacks like sambusa and bagia. She is also a hairstylist, a business she has been doing for five years now. Asia works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able make a very good monthly profit.

Asia is requesting her third loan via Kiva partner's Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous loans, all of which she repaid successfully, she restocked her genge with fruits and vegetables. She managed to receive extra income that she used to cover part of her home food expenses and school fees. Her dream is to improve her business and live better. She will invest her new loan in buying stock for all her businesses.

Asia will share this loan with her loan group "KIMANGA", which totals three members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock for her all businesses.

loans.name: Jasiri Group

texts.en:
Ombeni is a father of two children, one son and one daughter, one schooling and another still a baby. He is married and aged in his mid-thirties. 

Ombeni has a business of meals, where he buys corn from small traders and changes it to meals to resell. He has been in this business for five years now, and works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily. He is able to make a good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his first credit request, to be apportioned among the members of Jasiri, a four-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Ombeni, after being supported with the credit, will buy sacks of corn and make meals for his business. His dream is to grow his project more and make his family better.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and make meals for his business.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en:
Asmat is a 39-year-old lady who is very poor and needy. Her husband provides sheltering services to generate income to feed his entire family. He has been doing this business for many years and has been using wooden planks and bamboo, which have been depreciating over time. 

Now he is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Asmat has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboo to continue his business again.  She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.
 
Asmat is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering material.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, planks, and wooden boards for sheltering services.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 50 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan along with her family. Her husband owns a poultry farm business. He is the sole earner and responsible to financially support his family.

The income generated by her husband's present flock is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so he wants to increase his business of poultry. He has been doing this for the last two years and has become famous for providing good-quality poultry products in his locality within a very short time. 

With the support of BRAC Pakistan, he has gradually improved his business. Currently, Sakina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to increase her husband's poultry business. 

This will help him to increase his sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income. Sakina thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's poultry farm business.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 45 year old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family which consists of three children. Her husband has been running a small restaurant for the last twelve years. He provides food services to the people and serves good and fresh food meals. 
Sajida's husband's restaurant is situated in the main market. A maximum of shop keepers come in his restaurant to eat delicious food. He needs some crockery and fresh food items to enhance his current business. In this regard, Sajida made contact to Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan.  
BRAC Pakistan issued this loan to Sajida for the development of her husband's business. 
Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's restaurant

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 57 años de edad habita en vivienda humilde pero propia. Él se encuentra muy feliz en su vivienda porque a pesar de vivir solo, logra salir adelante con su trabajo de tejedor de hamacas y colchas, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 7 años, por lo que es una persona con una gran experiencia en este oficio. Miguel desea mejorar un poco sus condiciones de vida y darle una mayor seguridad a su vivienda, por lo que desea construir 2 paredes para la vivienda y un cuarto para la cocina, ya que actualmente su vivienda es de lamina y madera. Al no contar con el financiamiento necesario, Miguel solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para construir 2 paredes y un cuarto para cocina en su vivienda.
texts.en: Miguel, who is 57 years old, lives in a house that is humble but that is his own. He is very happy in his house because, in spite of living alone, he has manged to make progress with his work weaving hammocks and coverlets. He has been doing this work for 7 years, so he is a person with a lot of experience in this work. Miguel wants to improve his living conditions a bit and give better security to his home, so he wants to build two walls for the house and a room for the kitchen, since now his house is made of metal sheeting and wood. Because he doesn't have the necessary financing, Miguel is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron. In addition, he will need to pay for the necessary labor to build two walls and a room in his house for the kitchen.

loans.use: o buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron, and also to pay for labor to construct two walls and a room for the kitchen in his home

loans.name: Buy

texts.en:
Buy, 52 years old, is an active rice farmer in a small community of Kampong Speu Province. He has two dependent children, and he also has one married child. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a rice farming business on farmland which is located near his house. He has been involved with this business since 1990 and the net profit that he can make is USD 3.00 a day. 

Buy would like to improve his living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, he is asking for a Kiva loan to build a small biogas digester under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnership with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, he hopes that he won’t spend much money on fuel and will lessen the smoke emitted from wood or charcoal. He is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate better than its general loans. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a small biogas digester

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, is 55, married to a farmer, and blessed with three children. She  has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost twenty years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily.  Her net income from this business is usually spent on their daily expenses. 

Due to insufficient funds for her business she would like to take a loan amounting to PHP 33,000 to purchase canned goods, beverages, noodles, breads, and biscuits to sell. She's hoping that her retail store will continue to grow and improve.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, beverages, noodles, breads, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 49 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school. Emelia works very hard to provide for them.

Emelia runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and eggs.

Emelia has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Emelia would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and eggs

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 25-year-old, married woman and the mother of two children. She has been running a clothes selling business for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community and makes enough through this business to contribute to the family income. 

Fouzia has requested a loan from brac Pakistan, to buy more stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. This way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell at home.

loans.name: Hennie

texts.en:
Hennie runs a general store, and at the same time is running a piggery business, raising piglets to offer for sale in order to make a living. She lives with her family in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying grains to sell. To increase sales, she took a new loan recently to buy more grocery goods to sell in her store.

In the future, Hennie intends to expand her business in order to generate more income to meet the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
Maruf grew up in a poor family. His parents were farmers. Maruf also became a farmer 15 years ago when he began his agro-business. He buys cows, feeds them for 3 or 4 months, and then sells them in the local market. Also, Maruf grows wheat and potatoes on  1 hectare of land. Maruf is the father of 5 children. His wife and children help him with managing the business. 

Maruf is planning to increase business because his family is large and he needs to more money to improve living condition.Therefore, Maruf is asking for a loan of 5500 Somoni to buy cattle to increase his working capital. 

He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase his working capital

loans.name: Sergio David

texts.es:
Sergio es un joven de 23 años, muy trabajador, soltero y vive junto a su familia en Parcona.
Gracias al inmenso apoyo de sus padres y mucha dedicación en sus estudios está estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad. Como una manera de apoyar a su familia trabaja como Obrero en un fundo Agrícola. Trabajar y estudiar es una tarea muy dura del día a día, sin embargo Sergio siente que su mayor motivación para hacerlo sencillo es la tranquilidad y felicidad que puede brindarle a su familia con ello.
Sergio está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa, de esta manera practicará sus pasos de baile porque le encanta la música y mejorará su calidad de vida. Así seguirá esforzándose para poder sacar adelante a su familia y más adelante abrir su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Sergio, 23, is a hardworking, single young man who lives with his family in Parcona.
Thanks to the immense support of his parents and much dedication to his studies, he is studying for a career in accounting.  As a way to support his family, he works as a laborer on an agricultural estate.  Working and studying day after day is a very difficult task, nevertheless Sergio feels that his greatest motivation for doing it is simply the tranquility and happiness that he can offer his family with it.
Sergio is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have given him he will be able to purchase a sound system for his house.  In this way, he will practice his dance steps because he loves music and it will improve his quality of life.  Thus he will continue forging ahead in order to be able to get his family ahead and later on to open his own business.

loans.use: to buy a sound system for his house.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 46 years old and married, with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 45,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 14 years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata works hard to support her family. Fortunata is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like gasoline and fishing nets.

Fortunata has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Fortunata would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like gasoline and fishing nets

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.ru: Гулназ 31 год, замужем, мать 3 детей. Гулназ в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством , стартовав в 2003 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Гулназ на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы, 1 лошадь, 35 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулназ обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и 10 овец. Гулназ является членом группы "Степ", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность достроить дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Gulnaz is 31 years old, married, and the mother of three children. As a source of supplementary income, Gulnaz has worked in animal husbandry since 2003. Because of her hard work, Gulnaz now has two cows, one horse, and thirty-five sheep. In order to further develop her business, Gulnaz appealed to the bank Bai -Tushum for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy one cow and ten sheep. Gulnaz is a member of the group "Step," which consists of her and two other people. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further developing the business finishing a house for her family.

loans.use: buy one cow and ten sheep to make a profit and finish building her house.

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru: Анаркуль 61 год, вдова, есть сын, который как может помогает матери. У Анаркуль среднее образование, почти всю свою жизнь занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультур. На данный момент у нее в хозяйстве есть 3 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 15 овец и 3 лошади. Также на 3,60 ГА поливной земли Анаркуль выращивает картофель, эспарцет, ячмень и пшеницу. Анаркуль реализует молоко и сельскохозяйственную продукцию местным жителям. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS), что катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь и развитие бизнеса. Так как вся деятельность Анаркуль экологичная, домашняя и чрезвычайно вкусная, она пользуется большим спросом. Анаркуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков с целью откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Анаркуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет приобрести отдельное жилье для сына, который сейчас живет с Анаркуль.
texts.en: Anarkul is 61 years old and a widow. She has a son who helps his mother. Anarkul has a secondary education. For almost all of her life, she has worked in animal husbandry and farming. At this point in time, her farm has three milk cows, two calves, fifteen sheep and three horses. Also, she has 3.60 hectares of irrigated land where Anarkul grows potatoes, sainfoin, barley, and wheat. Anarkul sells milk and agricultural products to local residents. Her monthly income is about 8,000 KGS, which is too low for her to have a decent life and business. Since all of Anarkul's produce is natural, home-made, and very tasty it is in great demand. Anarkul approached the bank Bai -Tushum for a loan of 120,000 KGS to buy bulls to fatten and resell. Anarkul plans to invest profits from the loan into expanding her herd. Additionally, she wants to buy her son (who currently lives with her) a house.

loans.use: purchase bulls to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Blandina

texts.en:
Blandina  is a farmer and she is grows vegetables to sell at the market.  She started to planting vegetables in 2012 with her own working capital of $45.00. 

Now she is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants used to improve her business. Everyday her life revolves around farming because she is earning a good income from it.  She taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to increase her business and she wants to use it to buy more pumpkin seeds, other vegetable seeds, manure etc.

loans.use: To buy pumpkin seeds, other vegetable seeds, manure, etc.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en: Juvelyn, a 34 year old mother of three, lives in Oroquieta City with her family. She sells assorted ready-to-wear clothes and cosmetic products in her village. Juvelyn earns well from this business. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing and cosmetics to sell. In the future, she wants to put up a retail store in her home to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 41 years old, married and is blessed with two children. She is engaged in hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. Despite the hardships of life, she and her husband aim to improve their living status and educate their children so that they will become successful someday. Her eldest son is now in college and they want him to finish his chosen course. 

Due to financial insufficiency, Noemi wants to access educational assistance through a loan from KIVA's lenders amounting to PHP15,000.00 to fully pay the school tuition fees for her son.  She believes that this educational assistance will be a great help for them to support the education of her son.

loans.use: to fully pay school tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie, is 47 years of age, married to a farmer, and blessed with three children. She manages a vegetable production business, in which she has planted a variety of vegetables for almost 25 years and earns a net income of PHP 150 daily. Her net income on her business is usually spent on their daily expenses at home. 

Due to insufficient funds, Rosemarie would like to avail herself of a loan, amounting to PHP 9,000, to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seedlings. She's hoping that her business will become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seedlings.

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Felma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Felma is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her business.  Felma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aibarchyn

texts.ru: Айбарчын, 32 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. Айбарчын занимается животноводством, начав свой бизнес в 1999 году. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Айбарчын на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 2 лошади, 50 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является покупка скота,  а именно 2 коров для разведения. Айбарчын  является членом группы "Степ", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита Айбарчын планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, также планирует увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en: Aibarchyn is 32 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Aibarchyn works in animal husbandry. She began her business in 1999. Thanks to her hard work on the farm, Aibarchyn today has two cows, two horses, and fifty sheep. In order to further develop her business, she approached the bank Bai -Tushum for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy cattle, namely, two cows for breeding. Aibarchyn is a member of the group "Step", which consist of her and two other people. Aibarchyn plans to invest income from the loan into further developing her business and increasing the number of her livestock.

loans.use: buy two cows to invest in the further growth of her business

loans.name: Kubran

texts.en:
Kubran is a 39-year-old mother of three children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, renewing the turbine and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and up to now his business has been very steady. Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some important parts have been tearing off and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of parts it affects the whole mechanism of the lathe machine.
Her husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine or buy cutting tools. 
Therefore, Kubran has requested a loan for her husband so that he can fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools to work over the lathe machine.  
Kubran hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: help her husband to fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools .

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is 21 years old, married, and the mother of two children. 

Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw, which always is in bad condition. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. For this reason, Sana has contacted Kiva’s field partner, Brac Pakistan, so that her husband can repair his rickshaw.  He wants to maintain the rickshaw's engine piston, one wheel and to pay the labor costs to fix it.  This will help the riclshaw run more smooth and provide better transportation services to his passengers. 

Sana is hopeful that this loan will be productive for her husband's transportation services. Sana thanks to Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain the rickshaw's engine piston, one wheel and to pay the labor costs to fix it.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en: Alpha has a business selling jewelry like earrings, bracelets, necklaces, and rings. Alpha is 44 years old and has one son at the college level of education. Alpha's greatest dream is for her son to finish his studies and have a decent job someday. Through her income from her business, Alpha is able to provide support for his studies. Alpha is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy jewelry to sell in the market. She will also use the loan to buy slippers and sandals as additional items to sell in her stall. Alpha hopes that someday her dream becomes a reality.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell in the market.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is a housekeeper while her husband is a farmer and a welder. Lenie is caring for her two children who are at a high school level of education. 

While caring for her children, Lenie engages herself in a retailing business in which she is selling a variety of grocery items in their village. Their village is far from the public market. That’s why she is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy a volume of grocery items in the market to sell in their village. 

By availing herself of the loan, Lenie believes that she can save some of her fare expense and consider it as her additional profit.

loans.use: to buy a volume of grocery items in the market to sell in their village.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of four children.

She owns a beauty parlor in partnership with an expert in hair styling and cutting.  She is an expert in makeovers.  Both are very professional in their art.  She provides makeovers to her clients at home, also. Most of their clients belong to the neighborhood and her clients appreciate her craft.  Over time, the furniture has broken and her beauty products are running out.  Now, she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon. 

Therefore, Uzma has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner Brac Pakistan, so that she would be able to buy new furniture and additional cosmetic products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion etc.

She wants to establish a separate parlor in nearby town so she won't have to split her profits.

Uzma thanks to the Kiva and field partner, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and additional cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, and lotion for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 38-year-old married mother of two children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. Shamshad owns a small business selling ladies' ready-made garments from home. She purchases clothing from the market at a low price, sews it and sells it for higher prices in her community. The ladies of town like her garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because the winter weather has started and people are demanding warmer clothes. Her husband meets all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings. 
She has requested a loan so that she can buy more varieties of garments to fulfill the demand. Shamshad wishes for the bright future of her children. Her dream is to provide a better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy garments of various colors for reselling.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 38 years old and the mother of three children. They live in Lahore, Pakistan.  She is a responsible wife and mother.  She has to look after her young babies, old parents and the sibling of her husband.  She wants to purchase a separate house for her family in which she can feel at ease and relax. But her husband’s business does not provide enough income.

She wants to help her husband grow the business. Her husband owns a pharmacy in which he sells many types of medicines. His pharmacy is near a medical clinic, and most of the customers are referred by the doctor of that clinic.  Most of the medicines are unavailable due to their high cost.

Nusrat knows that her husband can earn more if he offered these missing medicines. Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband.  She hopes that her husband will be able to buy these medicines so that he can maximize his profits. 

Nusrat hopes that through that profit she will be able to buy a new house soon.

loans.use: to buy more medicines so that he her husband's pharmacy can maximize profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pisi

texts.en: Pisi is 29 years old and married with two children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Pisi has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, wooden carved designs, rubber designs and rollers. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, wooden carved designs, rubber designs and rollers

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered from Tuba Rai Metin to Ester for her to use to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come everyday to shop.  

She is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, candies, biscuits, beverages, etc. 

She has been involved in her business since 2010, when she started with her own working capital of $100. Running a business has made Ester independent because she can be responsible for herself. 

She hopes that with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can improve her business as she wants to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, candies, biscuits, beverages and other things to sell.

loans.name: Marianito

texts.en:
Marianito is a 62-year-old man who has worked his own farm for many years to make a living. He sells his farm produce, in the market, in volume, to gain more revenue. His family helps him on the farm. 

He joined GDMPC more than three years ago.  He is now taking a new loan to buy organic fertilizer and to use a portion for house renovation. He plans to cultivate all the vacant lot for farm expansion.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and for house renovation.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Magdalina works hard to support her family. She has a rice milling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Magdalina is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her rice milling.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 37-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
She has requested a loan for her husband. He owns an entertainment club, in which he placed three or four video game consoles to offer his customers for playing. 
One of these video games has been depreciating for a long time and now it is fully damaged. Its screen has been broken and the joysticks do not move properly. 
This loss effects his daily income, he wants to buy a new video game but does not have the capacity to purchase it.
This is the reason Shabana has requested a loan so that her husband can buy a new video game for his customers.
Shabana is very happy after receiving this loan and very thankful to Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy video games for entertainment services.

loans.name: Veronica Yaneth

texts.es: Verónica de 25 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos una niña de 1 año y un varón de 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer con una gran tenacidad que se esfuerza cada día para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos ella sola, llevando el sustento diario gracias a su trabajo en un comedor y pupuserìa en el cual presta sus servicios domésticos. Verónica desea construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y ladrillo para construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda.
texts.en: Veronica is 25 years old and lives in her own home with her 2 children, a 1 year old daughter and a 7 year old boy. She is a woman with great tenacity who struggles every day to bring up her children alone. She earns the daily bread thanks to her work in a soup kitchen and stuffed tortilla shop where she provides domestic services. Veronica wants to build a fourth bedroom in her home so she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, iron, and brick in order to build a fourth bedroom in her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, iron, and bricks in order to build a fourth bedroom in her home.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  SABALY est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers à l’image de AWA qui est la 2ème femme assise dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, des  articles divers avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group SABALY is composed of married women, who average 40 years of age and five children each. The women live in traditional extended families in the HEREMAKONO NORD district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. 

To bolster their financial capacity for improviing their commerce, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first loan with it. 

This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, as does AWA, who is the second woman sitting from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase various goods from Bougouni wholesalers. She makes her sales retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit at the market and at home. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 35.000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business  and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase various goods to sell

loans.name: Nissan Group

texts.en:
Zaina, who is in her mid 30s, is single and has two children who are in school.  She has been selling charcoal and firewood for nine years now.  She works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Zaina's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans, since repaid, to buy sacks of charcoal and started selling firewood.    She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva's support.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. 

Zaina will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and firewood to resell. She dreams of having her own license because right now she is using her relative's license.

Zaina will share this loan with her loan group "Nissan," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and firewood to resell

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BEN ont en moyenne 38 ans,5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de la ville de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits et des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BEN sont à leur 13ème prêt solidaire. AISSATA, 3ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pantalons, 10 chemises, 15 robes, 10 jupes et 10 foulards. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 36 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group BEN average 38 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, a district in SAN/SEGOU CITY (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they buy and sell clothing and a variety of goods. 

After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group BEN are now on their thirteenth solidarity loan. 

AISSATA, who is the third woman standing from the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 20  pants, 10 shirts, 15 dresses, 10 skirts, and 10 scarves. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers. She makes her sales to men and women customers paying with cash and often credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 36,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Sumara

texts.en: Sumara is a 38-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children.  She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He is a tailor and very expert in his profession. He has been sewing clothes for many years. This is the reason he has lot experience with his profession. His sewing machine has become out of order and it needs to be replaced with a new one, but he does not have sufficient money to buy a new machine. Therefore, Sumara has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy a new professional sewing machine. Her family has to do hard work to generate income for a huge family. Her husband also participates with monthly income. Sumara is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new professional sewing machine for her husband.

loans.name: Kisarawe One Group

texts.en:
Kisarawe One is an entrepreneurial group that consists of fifteen people who are sharing business ideas. It has started few years ago with more members, rotating in different ways usually named as a flexible group. Today only seven are present after finishing the previous loan cycle successfully. Mohamedi is among the seven members, and who today became a group profile presenter. 

Mohamedi is in his 70’s, widowed, and has four grown children, equal gender. He runs a local business of chickens. He travels to villages to find chickens, a journey taking two to three days. After finding the chickens, he takes them back to town and resells them to different hotels and other restaurants. It takes three days to resell and then arrange for another journey. Mohamedi buys 20 to 35 chickens per journey, but his desire is to be able to reach up to 100 chickens per journey. He has had this business for three years and believes that through Kiva support, his desires will be possible. From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is not his first loan cycle, and all past loans since paid back successfully. He used the previous loans to buy chickens, which he resold and Mohamedi was able to receive a good profit, which he used to buy a plot and build a house. He paid for his welfare cost. He is so proud with Kiva support. He is now requesting a new credit, which he will use to buy local chickens to resell.

Mohamedi will share this loan with his group, Kisarawe One, whose seven members will be accountable to repay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy local chickens to resell.

loans.name: Evenecer Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Evenecer está conformada por ocho integrantes seis mujeres  y dos hombres, madres y padres responsables con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajadores, de condición humilde, responsables, con ganas de superación. Todos se dedican al comercio informal,  tienen diferentes actividades económicas para poder sacar a sus familias adelante ya que es su medio de subsistencia.
Gracias a su ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Marisol y tiene por actividad económica la venta de fritanga  que consisten vender comida típica y casera como gallo pinto, carne asada, manuelitas, tajadas, tacos, vigoron, maduros, tostones, enchiladas. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Esta joven seroña tiene una rutina de trabajo de unas doce horas desde la preparación de  comida hasta la venta del mismo. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que ha sido su medio de subsistencia. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles como: arroz, aceite, frijoles, carne, pollos, repollos, tomates, cremas, tortillas, maduros, cuajadas. Para elaborar los diferentes comidas típicas caseras.  La asociación comunal Evenecer agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Evenecer communal bank is made up of eight members, six women and two men who are responsible parents with ten children under their care. They are originally from El Sauce, a place located in the northern part of the region whose workers are characterized for being humble and responsible and wanting to get ahead. All of them are engaged in informal trade. They have different financial activities in order to move their families forward through their way of livelihood.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead Marisol is the coordinator and her financial activity is selling fried snacks that consists of typical homemade food such as rice and beans, roasted meat, cinnamon sugar rolled crepes,  fried plantains, tacos, lime and cabbage slaw with yucca, ripe plantains, roast sucking pig, and enchiladas. Her business is located in her home and this young woman’s work routine is some twelve hours from the preparation of food until she sells it. This is an activity that she carries out with a lot of pleasure as it has been her livelihood.

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital to supply her business of buying and selling food products such as rice, oil, beans, meat, chicken, cabbage, tomatoes, cream, tortillas, ripe plantains, and curds in order to make various typical homemade meals.

The Evenecer communal bank is grateful for the support from Kiva loaners that help people with scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, oil, beans, meat, chicken, cabbage, tomatoes, cream, tortillas, ripe plantains, and curds, for her home based business

loans.name: Mryna

texts.en:
Myrna is earning more income from her general store, which she has managed for over thirteen years, to make a living.

She has successfully repaid her previous business loan and the store is still doing well. Recently, she took out a new loan to buy more grocery goods to sell. 

In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su madre, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú; ella goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos.

Aurora se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotes, verduras y frutas, desde hace más de 10 año de antigüedad en el negocio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería como arroz, azúcar y otros.. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, para obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar sus ganancas y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Aurora is 46 years old, single, and lives with her mother in their own home in a large community in the urban area of Cayaltí, in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. She takes joy in the good personal and work references she gets from her neighbors.

Aurora makes a living in the sale of groceries, vegetables, and fruit, and has over 10 years of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan to buy inventory such as rice, sugar, and other items. In this way, she can grow her business to obtain more revenues and be able to improve its profits and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as rice, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a hardworking housewife and blessed with three children. Her husband is a government employee. He is a humble and honest person. He works at a lower level in a government organization. His income is not sufficient to meet all their expenses. One of their sons started a small general store business two years ago to stand on his own feet and support his family. He has been successful in attracting many customers. Now that his business is doing well, he wants to buy more stock for the growth of his business. These items include the existing products for which demand is high and some new items to attract more customers to his store. He is enthusiastic and passionate about his business, looking at his interest. 

Suriya has applied for a loan through Brac Pakistan, a Kiva partner, to help her son with the business. Her son is thankful to her for always being supportive. Suriya is hopeful that her son's business will grow and he will be self-sufficient and a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to help her son buy more stock to add to the general store.

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en: Koreti is a 55-year-old, married woman with six children. She has a small business selling Samoan banana chips and also fried chicken with rice. To earn extra income, she also runs a small sewing business. Koreti needs a loan to buy a bunch of bananas, cooking oil and plastic bags, but as for her sewing business, she'll also be purchasing a new industrial sewing machine and material. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. Koreti joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cooking oil and plastic bags, and also to purchase a new industrial sewing machine and material.

loans.name: Suanepa

texts.en: Suanepa is a 35-year-old, married woman with five children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Suanepa needs a loan to buy yeast, a new oven, large basins, bags of flour, bags of sugar and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Suanepa has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy yeast, a new oven, large basins, bags of flour, bags of sugar and plastic bags.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy, 30, is a single woman who lives in a small community of Svay Rieng Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been involved in a framing business since 1998. In her farm land, she grows rice and sells the crop to the local dealers and sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market. 

She wants to build a pool in her house to store the water for her household use. She hopes that this pool will help to reduce her family's expenditure on water and provide a convenient way to access the water. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to apply for a KIVA loan to build a pool. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to build a pool for water storage

loans.name: Sambas

texts.en: Meet Sambas. Sambas lives with his wife in Sukabumi. Sukabumi is a city located about 106 km from Jakarta. He runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall, and he quickly became interested to join Ruma about a month ago. Sambas believes that using technology will make the business run easier. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more mobile and bill payment services to his community on the weekends. He also hopes that he will be able to improve his business as he learned from Ruma. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Bonita

texts.en: Bonita, a 30-year-old woman and a mother of two, helps her husband by managing a transportation service, while her husband earns from private employment. She has her tenant that operates her motorcycle used for the transportation. She has successfully repaid her previous loans used for their improvement. Recently, she took a new loan to buy new tires, and a portion of her loan amount to be used for house renovation. In the future, she plans to buy a sidecar for her motorcycle for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy new tires and also to renovate her house.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La venta de mercancia variada como pantalones, bolsos accesorios femeninos, y el comercio de helados son los dos negocios con los cuales cuenta Ana para aoyar el bienestar de su hogar conformado por su esposo y su hija de 6 años de edad. Ana tiene 30 años de edad y desde el año 2013 inició su propia aventura de negocios, vendiendo minutos a celulares con el fin de generar un pequeño ingreso, poco a poco compró una vitrina en la que empezó a exhibir articulos y a venderlos y pósteriomente cuando le ofrecieron un congelador para vender helados, no lo dudó y tambien lo agregó a su inicial negocio. Ella compra de contado a proveedores ubicados cerca al lugar donde habita con su familia y los vende a crédito y de contado desde su misma vivienda, a vecinos y familiares que gradualmente le refiernen mas clientes. Su meta es tener un gran almacen y ayudar a que su hijo sea un ´profesional, aunque su mayor desafio sea incmentar sus ventas . En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará accesorios, ropa y helados, con esta inversión ofrecerá mayor variedad a su clientela y su negocio mejorará.
texts.en:
The sale of varied merchandise such as pants and women’s handbag accessories, and selling ice cream are two business which support the wellbeing of Ana’s household which consists of her husband and her 6 year old daughter.

Ana is 30 years old and she started her business venture in 2013, selling cellular minutes, in order to earn a little income. Little by little she bought a showcase where she began to display and sell items, and later when they offered her a freezer for selling ice cream, she did not hesitate, and also added it to her initial business. 

She buys in cash from providers located near the place where she lives with her family and makes cash and credit sales from her home to neighbors and relatives who gradually refer more customers. Her goal is to have a large store and help her child become a professional, although her greatest challenge is to increase sales.

Currently she is asking for a Kiva loan, her first financing that she is making through the Foundation Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy accessories, clothing and ice cream. This investment will offer more variety to her customers and her business will improve.

loans.use: to buy accessories, clothing, and ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food vending business. Lolita has been in this business for 20 years. She also earns more income from pig fattening. Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 62 años de edad, es el propietario de un taller de mecánica, ubicado en un municipio del departamento del Atlántico, donde habita con su cónyuge y su hijo de 12 años de edad. Hace 35 años inició su experincia en mantenimiento y reparación mecánica, pues desde muy niño trabajó en talleres , en los cuales aprendió a reparar y mantener motocicletas y máquinas de coser, hasta ubicarse en un local y trabajar independientemente, como hasta hoy lo hace, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, durante todos los dias  su taller y generar empleoque beneficien a la sociedad. Su mayor desafio es el incremento de sus ventas, para generar mas ganancias y finalmente lograr obtener su propia vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundbación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará repuestos para motocicletas, y para máquinas de coser. Con esta inversión tendrá inventarios de repuestos, con los que hoy no cuenta y esto hace que su credikiva mejore su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 62 years old, and is the owner of a mechanic shop located in the department of Atlántico where he lives with his partner and his 12 year-old child. Thirty five years ago he started his experience as a maintenance and repair mechanic. Since he worked in workshops from a young age, he learned how to repair and maintain motorcycles and sewing machines until he opened up his own shop and began working independently, as he still does today from 8 in the morning until 6 at night, every day.

His workshop generates employment the benefits the community. His greatest challenge is increasing his sales to generate more revenues and ultimately obtain his own home. He is currently requesting a a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy motorcycle parts and sewing machine parts. With this investment he will have an inventory of parts that he does not have today, and this is why his Kiva loan improves his business.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts and sewing machine parts.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is the age of 30, a mother of two children, and lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has sold fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased, and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So, he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the vegetables. Therefore, Sajida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more vegetables for sale. 

Sajida thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's vegetable sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a press and a welding table

loans.name: Nissa

texts.en: Nissa has been separated from her husband and she worked in his farm to make a living. Her family helped her improve her farm. After she had joined GDMPC this year, she borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer. She is hopeful to gain better income from her farm, to ensure a better future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Luvizminda

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Luvizminda works hard to support her family.

She has a tobacco retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store and pig fattening businesses. Luvizminda is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell.

Luvizminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is age 36, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to do hard work to feed her family, and she is the mother of two sons and two daughters. To manage her household expenses, she owns a small tailoring business with the help of her daughters at home. Razia and both of her daughters have been stitching clothes for many years. Her elder daughter has been helping and learning tailoring work with her, and now she has gotten a lot of experience. Razia wants to buy a new juki machine for her elder daughter, so that she can contribute with her income by sewing clothes.

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy new juki machine for her daughter. She wants to make some savings so that she can arrange the marriage ceremony of her daughters. Razia thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new juke machine for her daughter.

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
Susan is 21 years old and lives in the town of Siroko, in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past three years, Susan has been working hard to manage her retail shop in which she sells essential goods such as rice, sugar, beans, and soda. 

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of UGX 900,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential goods to sell and a refrigerator and will help Susan to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Susan hopes that, in the future, she will be able to start constructing rental houses. 

Susan is a member of BRAC Uganda's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential goods to sell and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Mkombozi Mwenge Group

texts.en:
Saidi, who is in his early 50s, is married with three children and only one is still in school.  He has been running a genge for twenty two years now.  He works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Saidi's 18th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy seeds and manure and develop his shamba.  He also bought some cows and then started the genge business. He is so hardworking and happy with the loan.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, started building his house, and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy the out of stock items in the genge business.  He dreams of finishing building his house and a car to be mobile.

Saidi will share this loan  with his loan group "Mkombozi Mwenge", which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the out of stock items in the genge business.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en: Madeleine is 35 years old, and she is married with six children aged between 3 and 11, and five of them go to school. She has been selling clothes for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro de 62 años, se dedica a la producción y venta de almuerzos y de hielo desde hace 8 años, cuando escucho la sugerencia de sus vecinos, comerciantes del barrio donde habita, referente a producir hielo, con los que ellos pudieran refrigerar refrescos, enfriar sus jugos y hasta el agua. Teniendo a esta clientela cercana, adicionó la preparación y venta de almuerzos,  de contado y a crédito, trabajando todos los dias desde las 7 de la mañana  hasta las 6 de la tarde, para venderle a sus vecinos y referidos por estos, de acuerdo a sus necesidades. La meta de Alejandro es triplicar la producción de hielo, para en el futuro comprar su propio apartamento y lograr el desafio de fidelizar a su clientela y ahorrar. Actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, meiante el cual comprará un congelador, un cubetero con el cual alcanzar el aumento en la producción de hielo y con ello mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 62 years old, earns a living making and selling lunches, and ice. He started doing this eight years ago, when he heard a suggestion from his neighbors, businesspeople from the neighborhood he lives in, referring to making ice with which they could cool refreshments, juice and even water.

Having a nearby clientele, he added the preparation and selling of lunches, on cash and credit. He works everyday from 7am to 6pm to sell his neighbors and relate to them, according to their needs. 

Alejandro's goal is to triple his ice production to be able to buy his own apartment in the future, and to accomplish the challenge of retaining his customers, and save. 

Currently, he's applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo does. With it, he will buy a freezer and an ice cube mold, with which he will achieve an increase in ice production, thus improving his business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and an ice cube mold.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 52 años de edad, viuda, madre de tres hijos, y se dedica al tejido artesanal con lana de alpaca.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, buena madre, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la urbanización Chijini Chico que se encuentra ubicada camino a Viacha.
Maria es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua natal es el aymara y utiliza el español según sus necesidades de comercio. Su negocio es la confección y elaboración de mantas y chompas con lana de alpaca y lleva en el negocio más de 15 años. El proceso de producción artesanal de una prenda de lana de alpaca lo inicia con la disgregación de la fibra, de acuerdo con la calidad de los vellones y por los colores, separando las impurezas. Luego de sacar las impurezas, la lana es hilada en una rueca manual o en rueca de pedal. El tejido lo realiza totalmente a mano, con la utilización de palillos o agujas circulares.
