Ella sueña ampliar su negocio y llegar  a más clientes. Su deseo es mejorar y aumentar su producción realizando la compra de una máquina de tejer, para ofertar tejidos a mano y a máquina, de esa manera obtendrá mayores ingresos económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de tejer para aumentar su producción y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 52 year old woman, widowed, and the mother of three children. She earns a living making artisanal weavings with alpaca wool.

She is entrepreneurial, independent, patient, a good listener, supportive, strong, a good mother, joyous, optimistic, happy, with a good attitude, dedicated to her work, generous, friendly, responsible and very hardworking.

She does her work in the city of Chijini Chico, which is found on the way to Viacha. Maria is of dark complexion and medium height with long black hair. Her native language is Aymara, and she uses Spanish according to her business needs. 

Her business is the preparation and processing of alpaca wool blankets and sweaters, and she's been doing this for more than 15 years. 

The artisanal production process for an alpaca garment starts with the disintegration of the fiber, separating impurities according to the quality of the fleeces and colors. After removing the impurities, wool is spun on a manual spinning wheel or distaff pedal. The fabric is done entirely by hand, using chopsticks or circular needles.

She dreams of growing her business and having more customers. Her wish is to improve and increase her production by buying a weaving machine to offer products woven by hand and machine, thus earning better income.

Because of these goals, Maria is seeking a loan to buy a weaving machine to increase her production and earn better income.

loans.use: to buy a weaving machine to increase her production and earn better income.

loans.name: Aida Del Carmen

texts.es: Aida, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija con quien vive en una aldea del municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Ella trabajo un tiempo en una maquila y luego decidió por poner su propio negocio y vende mercadería en general como ser ropa, zapatos y otros que le piden sus clientes. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante desde hace 8 años. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo a ODEF por 5,000 lempiras para comprar camisas, pantalones, faldas, blusas y zapatos para surtir y aumentar las ventas. Su plan es mantener su negocio estable y en crecimiento.
texts.en:
Aida is 37 years old. She's a single mother and has one daughter who lives in a village in the city of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara.

She worked in a factory and later decided to start her own business and sell general merchandise, like clothing, shoes and other things her customers ask for. She's been a traveling saleswoman for eight years. 

She's asked for a second loan from ODEF for 5,000 lempiras to buy shirts, pants, skirts, blouses and shoes to stock and increase her sales. Her plan is to keep her business stable and growing.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts, blouses and shoes to stock and increase her sales.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela es una mujer de 57 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, su negocio es el comercio de ganado.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, optimista, de buena actitud, comprometida, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Aunque nunca tuvo hijos, sí tiene sobrinos y los apoya económicamente. Su labor la realiza en la comunidad de batallas situado a una altitud de 3,735 metros sobre el nivel del mar, a una distancia de 65 kilometros, a 1 hora aproximadamente de la ciudad de La Paz, por la ruta que se dirige a Copacabana.
Estela es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es típica (manta y pollera), y su lengua natal es el aymara; el cual utiliza para comunicarse con los comunarios de su zona y en muchos lugares de la ciudad de El Alto, también habla español por sus necesidades de comercio. Su trabajo es el comercio de ganado vacuno, cría animales de granja, los engorda para luego comercializarlos. Ella desea mejorar su negocio realizando la compra de animales de granja como también su alimento. Su sueño es comprarse un carro donde poder ir de viaje y transportar ganado.
Es por esos motivos que Estela solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado y con los beneficios comprar material de estudio para sus sobrinos.
texts.en:
Estela is a 57 year old single woman with no children. Her business is selling cattle. She is enterprising, independent, optimistic, has a good attitude, committed, generous, friendly and very hard-working. She does her work in the community of Batallas which is situated at an altitude of 3,735 meters above sea level and 65 km or one hour from the city of La Paz on the road that goes to Copacabana.

Estela is dark-skinned, medium height, with long braided black hair. Her clothing is traditional (a shawl and pollera). Her native tongue is Aymara, which is used to communicate amongst the inhabitants of the area and in much of the city of El Alto. She also speaks Spanish to do her business.

Her business is selling cattle. She raises farm animals and fattens them to sell. She wants to improve her business buying the farm animals and also buy feed. Her dream is to buy herself a vehicle so she can go traveling and also transport cattle. For these reasons Estela is requesting a loan to buy cattle and with the profits buy study material for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Hassane

texts.en:
Hassane is a thirty-one-year-old resident of Kasasa LC1 zone. He is married to Angella and they have three children that they look after. Hassane has a retail shop dealing in general foodstuffs and other household items. He started this business seven years ago as a source of income after he failed to find a job. The business allows him to support the family, since he is the bread-winner for the entire family. Hassane works in poultry farming to supplement his income. 

Hassane’s business is well-located but his main business challenge is inadequate capital, which means he can't buy enough poultry feed and stocks for his business. This hinders the growth of the business and its ability to expand. As a result, he is requesting a loan of UGX 5,000,000 so he can buy poultry feed and retail stock items to beat the competition and make more sales and profits. He thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen lives in Rawalpindi, is 34 years old and a housewife. She has five children. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession. As their family depends on the income generated from the taxi, her husband works day and night to make sure that his family's needs are met. Due to constant driving, there has been wear and tear on his taxi which now requires to be repaired. As his taxi is no longer driving properly, his income is badly affected and he is not able to generate the earnings he previously got. This is a major concern for Yasmeen and her husband as they will become short of money to pay for their daily expenses. Also, they do not have savings to pay for the maintenance of the taxi. 
Therefore Yasmeen has applied for a loan to help her husband with the taxi repairs. They are happy and thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees is a 40-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, oranges from his shop. Presently he is interested to offer more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Balqees, has requested for a loan amount from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase more variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at profitable price. With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Balqees is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fruits to enhance in her husband's fruit sale business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 32 years old and lives in Rawalpindi with her family. She has four children. Not only is she a good housewife, she also financially supports her family. Given their low family income, it was not possible for them to meet daily expenses and make ends meet. Therefore, Nasreen started a tailoring business. This small business has helped her generate income and meet the family's daily expenses. She has four years' experience in her business. Given the increase in demand for tailoring, she wants to buy additional items to increase her income by sewing more clothes. Therefore, she has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner. Nasreen is hopeful that her business will flourish. She aims to provide better education for her children to provide them with a secure future.

loans.use: to expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en: Hanifan is a 57-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children and she adores her family.  Her son works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her son owns a clothing sales business, which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that, Hanifan is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her son to purchase more variety of clothes to sell. In this way he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of profit amounts, he will put aside some savings amount to pay for the electricity and gas bill. Hanifan hopes that the loan will be helpful for her son's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her son's clothes sale business.

loans.name: Gerson Adali

texts.es: Gerson, tiene 48 años de edad, está en una relación en unión libre, tiene 4 hijos, vive con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Trinidad, Santa Barbara.  Tiene su propio  negocio  de una pulpería en su casa. Vende  productos alimenticios como ser arroz, frijoles, lácteos, embutidos, refrescos, harina, churros, carnes, productos de aseo, etc. Anteriormente trabajaba como agricultor en una granja y hace 3 años decidió poner una pulpería.  El préstamo  que ha solicitado es por 20,000 lempiras, el cual invertirá en la compra de productos de la canasta básica como carnes, arroz, frijoles, productos lácteos, churros, refrescos, azúcar, harina, pan, huevos, y otros abarrotes para tener variedad en los productos. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos preparados con buena educación y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Gerson is 48 years old. He is in a committed relationship and has 4 children. He lives with his familia in a village in the municipality of Trinidad, Santa Barbara. He has his own convenience store business in his home. He sells food items such as rice, beans, dairy products, sausages, soft drinks, flour, donuts, meats, cleaning products, etc. 

Previously he worked in agriculture on a farm and 3 years ago, he decided to start a convenience store. The loan he has requested is for 20,000 lempiras, which he will invest in the purchase of staple items such as meats, rice, beans, dairy products, donuts, soft drinks, sugar, flour, bread, eggs and other groceries in order to have a variety of products. 

His dream is to see his children well educated and his business grow.

loans.use: To buy staples such as meats, rice, beans, dairy products, donuts, soft drinks, sugar, flour, bread, eggs and other groceries.

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en: Rasheedan is age 49; she is a mother of two children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, as well his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Rasheedan requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc.  Rasheedan hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family.  Rasheedan thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc.  for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra is a 57-year-old woman; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years and he is responsible to meet the needs of family. Zohra is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to managing the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth and machine oil for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Zohra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth and machine oil to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Francisco Ismael

texts.es: Francisco, tiene 28 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene1 hijo, reside con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. El ayudaba a su madre desde pequeño a administrar una pulpería y hace 4 años que le quedo a el como su negocio propio donde vende productos de la canasta básica como arroz, frijoles, manteca, pan, azúcar, refrescos, churros, etc. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para invertirlo en la compra de productos como carnes, granos básicos, azúcar, churros, refrescos, huevos, pan, condimentos, productos de aseo etc. Y así podrá surtir su negocio. Tiene como meta ampliar su negocio y darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
Francisco is 28 years old. He lives with his common law wife and they have one son. They live in a village in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. 

Since he was a boy, he has helped his mother manage a convenience store, and 4 years ago, he took it over as his own business. He sells staple products such as rice, beans, lard, bread, sugar, soft drinks, donuts, etc. He decided to request a loan for 15,000 lempiras to invest in the purchase of products like meats, basic grains, sugar, donuts, soft drinks, eggs, bread, condiments, cleaning products, etc. That way he will be able to stock his business. 

His goal is to expand his business and give his son the best he can.

loans.use: To buy products such as meats, basic grains, sugar, donuts, soft drinks, eggs, bread, condiments, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in soap, detergents, bleach, rice, sugar, candies, shampoo, corn, etc., for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, seafood, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, candies, etc., for her store.

loans.name: Maria Inez

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 52 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre con su esposo,  vive con su esposo y un nieto en una aldea del municipio de La Masica, Atlántida. Ella tiene su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de abarrotería, granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, refrescos, golosinas y también vende ropa nueva para damas y sandalias para damas, caballeros y niños. Este negocio lo tiene hace 13 años en su casa. El  monto de préstamo que solicita es por 21,000 lempiras y lo  invertirá en la compra de productos de abarrotería como granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, refrescos, jugos, pan etc. y compra de ropa y sandalias para surtir el negocio. Su meta es  obtener mayores ventas, y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old. She is in a common law relationship with her husband. She lives with him and a grandson in a village in the municipality of La Masica, Atlántida. 

She has her own convenience store where she sells groceries, basic grains, sugar, lard, soft drinks, candy and also sells women's clothing and sandals for women, men and children. She has had this business for 13 years in her home. 

The amount of the loan she is requesting is 21,000 lempiras and she will invest it in the purchase of grocery products, like basic grains, sugar, lard, soft drinks, juices, bread, etc. and buy clothing and sandals to stock her business. 

Her goal is to obtain greater sales, and help her family get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, such as basic grains, sugar, lard, soft drinks, juices, bread, etc. and buy clothing and sandals to stock her business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Ajuy, Iloilo. Carmelita has been engaged in a fishing business for more than a year now with her husband. Several months ago, Carmelita's fishing business was ruined when typhoon Haiyan hit the country. Carmelita is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets, a crab cage, fish hooks and lead weights. Through this, Carmelita and her husband will be able to go back to fishing to earn an income. In the future, Carmelita dreams of expanding their fishing business so that it will generate more revenue. She also wants to save money to pay for the school fees of her four children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets, a crab cage, fish hooks and lead weights

loans.name: Sabin

texts.en: Sabin is 43 years old and married with eight children aged between 1 and 22, two of whom go to school. He has been selling clothes for 10 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profit from the business will used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood and bamboo retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Gina is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of bamboo and firewood to resell.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bamboo and firewood to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to assist with renovations for enclosing an area for the after school care and to buy furniture such as activity tables, book shelves and reading corner materials.

loans.name: Kiran's Group

texts.en:
Kiran is 26 years old and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.

She owns a beauty parlor and is an expert in makeover services. Most of her clients are from the neighborhood and appreciate her services. With the passage of time her beauty products have been diminishing and this time she wants to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon.

Therefore, Kiran has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she will be able to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc.

She wants to establish a parlor in the main market of town because she wants to enhance her income. Kiran thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 40-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. Presently he is interested to offer more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Fatima, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at profitable price. With the profit her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Fatima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to increase her husband's fruit sale business

loans.name: Ana Elsy

texts.es: Ana de 38 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de un año de edad y sus 3 sobrinos de 16, 20 y 24 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que gracias a su actitud de positivismo ha logrado mantener su tienda de productos varios en el gusto de su clientela gracias a su buena actitud a la hora de atender y que hace lo posible por tener variedad, y es ese deseo de mantenerse en el gusto de la gente lo que la impulsa a solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: café, maíz, azúcar, leche, champú, detergente, jabón, pan dulce, etc.
texts.en: Ana is 38 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her own house along with her 1-year-old son and her three nephews, ages 16, 20, and 24. She is an entrepreneurial woman who, thanks to her positive attitude, has managed to keep her customers' appreciation for her store, where she sells various products, thanks to her good attitude at the time of service and the fact that she does what she can to have variety. It is this desire to stay in people's favor that motivates her to apply to FUSAI for a loan to invest in coffee, corn, sugar, milk, shampoo, detergent, soap, sweet breads, etc. for her store.

loans.use: to invest in coffee, corn, sugar, milk, shampoo, detergents, soap, sweet breads, etc. for her store

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Enilika was born in the 1970s; she is married and has five children, one son and four daughters. All of her children are at school. For seven years now, she has been supporting her family by engaging in a furniture business. She has business helpers who make the furniture. Enilika works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month.

She has taken and repaid loans in the past from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous credits, all of which she repaid successfully, to buy wood and other furniture-making materials. With her good work, she received extra income which she used to buy a plot of land and build a house. The house is not yet completed, it is at roofing level. She will use this loan to buy wood for furniture making. With the profits from her business, she wants to roof her house, so that she can save money instead of renting. Enilika will also pay school fees and food expenses. She dreams that one day she will be able to improve her business, and build a showroom for her furniture. 
 
Enilika will share this loan with her loan group "Mapatano" which totals two members. The group members will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy wood for furniture making.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 34-year-old lady, living with her spouse and six children in Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities to her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.
Her husband has been driving an auto-rickshaw for many years; his income is insufficient to feed the entire family. He has to maintain the auto-rickshaw body but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. 
Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can replace the auto-rickshaw body. 
She hopes that she will be able to make enough savings by the time her children are getting married. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto-rickshaw body for her husband's business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda humilde pero propia al lado su compañero de vida y su hijo de 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que viendo la necesidad de apoyar a su compañero de vida con la economía familiar, ha instalado en su propia vivienda una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, además elabora y remienda prendas de vestir de sus vecinos lo que le permite tener un ingreso extra. Cristina ha observado la necesidad de una venta de maíz en su comunidad, por lo que desea invertir en ello, además desea invertir en su tienda para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. Por lo anterior Cristina solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, golosinas, leche, café, champú, pan dulce, etc.
texts.en:
Cristina is 43 years old. She lives with her life partner and their 3-year-old son, in a simple home that they own. 

She is an enterprising woman who, upon seeing the need to support her life partner with the family finances, has set up a store for basic necessities in her own home. She also makes and mends clothing for her neighbors. This gives her some extra income. 

Cristina has noticed the need for an outlet for corn sales in her community, so she would like to invest in that. She also wants to invest in her store to be able to offer more variety to her customers. For these reasons, Cristina is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in corn, rice, beans, sugar, sweets, milk, coffee, shampoo, pastries, etc.

loans.use: To invest in corn, rice, beans, sugar, sweets, milk, coffee, shampoo, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Jose Santos Evaristo

texts.es: José de 32 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 10 y 12 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se desempeña como cobrador de un medio de transporte publico, en el cual ayuda a las personas a subir a la unidad y es a él a quien cancelan el valor del pasaje, por lo que es un empleo de mucha responsabilidad y él lo ha sabido mantener desde hace mucho tiempo, es gracias a este empleo que lleva el sustento diario a su hogar y al lado de su compañera de vida van sacando adelante a sus hijos. José desea comenzar a construir su vivienda de cemento, ya que como podemos observar en la fotografía su vivienda actualmente es de lamina y madera, por lo que con el deseo de hacerla más segura y sabiendo que no cuenta con mucho presupuesto ha decidido iniciar construyendo las bases y los pilares de cemento,  además desea construir una pila ya que no cuenta con un deposito de recolección de agua, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pila, bases y pilares de cemento en su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old. He lives in his own house together with his life partner and their two children, aged 10 and 12.

He is an enterprising man, who makes a living working as public transportation fare collector. He helps people to get on the vehicle and collects the fare. This a job of great responsibility, and he has been able to keep this job for a long time. It is thanks to this job that he provides the daily sustenance for his family. Together with his life partner, he gets their children ahead.

José wishes to start building a house out of concrete. As we can see in the picture, his current house is made out of metal sheeting and timber. Wishing to make his house safer and knowing that he has a tight budget, he has decided to start by building the foundation and the pillars out of concrete. In addition, he wishes to build a water basin because he doesn’t have a tank to collect water. For these reasons, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a water basin, the foundation, and the pillars of his house out of concrete.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a basin, the foundation, and the pillars of his house out of concrete.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa de 53 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos y un nieto de 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida desde hace 2 años, como vendedora de ropa y sandalias, dicha actividad la realiza en los mercados aledaños de forma ambulante. Rosa desea surtir más sus productos para ofrecerles una mayor variedad a sus clientes, además desea invertir en mariscos para vender en su vivienda. Por lo anterior Rosa solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: mariscos, sandalias, blusas, faldas, calcetines, etc.
texts.en: Rosa is 53 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her three children and a 5-year-old grandson. She is an entrepreneurial woman who has earned a living for 2 years as a vendor of clothing and sandals. She carries out this activity in the neighboring markets as a street vendor. Rosa wants to stock more products in order to offer a greater variety to her customers. In addition, she wants to invest in seafood to sell in her home. To do this, Rosa is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in seafood, sandals, blouses, skirts, socks, etc.

loans.use: to invest in seafood, sandals, blouses, skirts, socks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to build walls for his house

loans.name: Jose Adelmo

texts.es: José, tiene 39 años de edad, está soltero, tiene 2 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura y hace 9 años estableció su propio negocio de venta de mercadería de ropa para damas y caballeros. Las ventas las realiza en forma ambulante, visitando varias aldeas del alrededor.  Ofrece camisas, blusas, faldas y pantalones. Lleva tres ciclos de préstamo con el actual que es de 6,000 lempiras con el cual  comprar camisas, faldas, blusas y pantalones para aumentar sus clientes y ventas. Su meta es tener un local propio para distribuir la mercadería.
texts.en: José is 39 years old. He is single. He has two children. He lives in a village in the township of Azacualpa, Santa Barbars. Previously he worked in agriculture, and 9 years ago he established his own business of selling clothing for women and men. He makes sales as a street vendor, visiting various villages in the area. He offers shirts, blouses, skirts, and pants. He is in his third loan cycle, counting the present one, which is for 6000 lempiras, with which he will buy shirts, skirts, blouses, and pants to increase his customers and sales. His goal is to have his own shop for distributing his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, blouses, and pants to sell

loans.name: Ruben Jonattan

texts.es:
Ruben es un joven soltero de 20 años, que trabaja vendiendo productos de limpieza en el mercado de su ciudad natal, Huaraz. Debido a circunstancias de la vida no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional y por eso desde muy joven trabaja para apoyar a sus padres. La ética con la que trabaja es el resultado de todos los valores inculcados en él por sus padres. Cada día trabaja mucho más motivado porque quiere brindarle un futuro mejor a su familia.
Ruben está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para implementar su negocio, de esta manera sus ingresos mejorarán y así más adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación podrá comprarse su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ruben is a young single man of 20 who works selling cleaning products in the market of Huaraz, his city of birth. Due to life circumstances, he was not able to study for a professional career, and for this reason he has worked since he was very young to help his parents. The ethic with which he works is the result of all the values inculcated in him by his parents. Every day he works with much more motivation because he wants to offer a better future to his family.

Ruben is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have offered him, he will be able to buy merchandise to put his business in place. In this way, his income will improve and thus in the future, with much effort and dedication, he will be able to buy his own house.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products (merchandise) for his business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 30 years old. He is not married. He is a farmer and has been farming for the past ten years.  With the loan requested, he would like to buy more maize and sorghum cultivation in order to get more food stuffs for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Tank Bovu Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her mid-thirtiejs, is married with two children who are still at school.  She has been running a beauty salon for five years now.  She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Mary's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to  buy standard salon equipment for her business,  which will help her to meet her customer's desire.  She dreams of owning a boutique.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group, Tank Bovu, which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy standard salon equipment for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies such as rice, meats, vegetables, condiments, beans, flour, cheeses, etc. to prepare and sell meals.

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Paz Y Progreso” está constituida por 10 mujeres emprendedoras y optimistas. Fausta de 31 años  es separada. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de comida como lomo saltado. Gracias a su esfuerzo pudo salir adelante en su negocio por el buen servicio que brinda a sus comensales logrando tener más clientes. Su mayor anhelo es de dar más variedades de menús típicos del lugar. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de carne de pollo, pescado y verduras.  El grupo “Paz Y Progreso” agradecen por el apoyo brindado a los inversionistas Kiva. Fausta es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste chompa morado.
texts.en:
This is the Bank "Peace and Progress" which is made up of ten entrepreneurial and optimistic women. Fausta is 31 years old and is separated. She currently makes a living selling food like lomo saltado, a Peruvian stir fried beef with potatoes. Thanks to her effort she was able to succeed in her business through the good service she offers her diners and has managed to attract more customers. 

Her greatest desire is to offer more of a variety of traditional menus from her area. In this opportunity, she is requesting a loan to buy poultry, fish and vegetables. The group "Peace and Progress" is grateful for the support offered by the Kiva loaners. Fausta is the first from the left and dressed in the purple jumper.

loans.use: to buy poultry, fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose es trabajador con su actividad de comerciante le ha dado estudio a sus hijo y todo lo que este a su alcance, para él su familia es su mayor prioridad, ha trabajado con créditos los que ha invertido en su vivienda y quiere seguir invirtiendo esta vez construirá un Dormitorio en la parte de atrás de la vivienda que necesita para sus hijos, solicita crédito para comprar piedras conteras, zing, piedrin, cemento y pagar mano de obra, su mayor propósito es que su familia goce de buenas condiciones, espacio y privacidad en su hogar.
texts.en: Jose works hard in his business as a shopkeeper.  His work has allowed him to provide his children with an education and everything at his disposal.  Jose's family is his first priority.  Jose has worked with loans before to invest in his housing situation.  He wants to continue with that investment and this time will add a bedroom to the back of his house.  He needs the room for his children.  He is requesting a loan to purchase quarried stone, zinc, gravel and cement and to pay for labor.  Jose's main goal is for his family to enjoy good conditions, space and privacy in their home.

loans.use: to add a bedroom to his house.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 25 años de edad, casado, padre de dos hijos y su negocio es la pesca artesanal.
Él es responsable, paciente, dedicado, de buen humor, comprensivo, fuerte, luchador y muy trabajador. Su trabajo pesquero lo realiza en el lago Titicaca que tiene un marcado carácter de actividad de subsistencia (captura por día entre 6 y 10 kilogramos por viaje). El pescado constituye la fuente de alimento básica para su familia siendo muchas veces el único aporte de proteínas en su dieta. Las capturas las comercializa a través de intermediarios en poblaciones próximas al lago. El carácter artesanal de su actividad no ha permitido un mayor desarrollo de su pesca.
Edwin es de tez morena, cabello corto, negro, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara que combina con el español para el comercio. Su trabajo pesquero es realizado por temporadas y por especies para evitar la extinción y ayudar a su crecimiento, existen especies introducidas como la trucha marrón, la trucha lacustre y la trucha arco iris a fin de mejorar la pesca comercial. Al principio, a los pescadores no les gustaba la trucha, porque el color rosado de su carne recordaba al de algunas especies autóctonas cuando se echaban a perder. Sin embargo, no pasó mucho tiempo antes de que esta especie encontrara una gran aceptación entre los campesinos locales del Altiplano y los habitantes de la ciudad.
Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, mejorando sus ingresos económicos, realizando la compra de un terreno donde pueda habitar su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Edwin solicita un préstamo para la compra de un terreno dónde pueda vivir su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 25-year-old man who is married with two children. His business is small-scale fishing. He is responsible, patient, dedicated, good-natured, understanding, strong, a fighter and a hard worker. 

His fishing job is on Lake Titicaca, which has a notable character for subsistence activity (he catches between 6 and 10 kilos per trip, per day). Fish makes up the basic source of food for his family and is often the only source of protein in their diet. He sells his catches through intermediaries in the villages near the lake. The artisanal nature of his business has not allowed him greater develop of his fishing. 

Edwin is dark-skinned, with short, dark hair, and medium height. His native tongue is Aymara, which he combines with Spanish for business. His fishing work is seasonal and by species to avoid extinction and help them grow. Some species, such as brown trout, lake trout and rainbow trout, have been introduced to improve commercial fishing. At first, the fishermen didn't like trout, because the reddish color of its flesh reminded them of some native species when they were spoiled. However, within a short period of time, this species met with great acceptance among local campesinos of the Altiplano and city dwellers alike. 

Edwin's dream is to improve his family's quality of life, by improving his financial income and buying a piece of land where his family can live. These are the reasons that Edwin is requesting a loan to purchase land where his family can live.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land where his family can live

loans.name: Veronica Shirley

texts.es:
Veronica es una madre de familia amorosa de 20 años, tiene un niño de 3 años y trabaja en la venta de diversos animales como cuyes, conejos y patos para consumo en un puesto que tiene en el mercado de su ciudad natal, Huaraz.
Por circunstancias de la vida quedó embarazada a muy corta edad y no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero eso no fue un impedimento para que saliera adelante, su hijo es su mayor motivación para luchar en esta vida porque quiere brindarle un futuro mejor.
Veronica está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar más animales para ofrecer a sus clientes, con esto sus ingresos mejorarán y ella mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y así seguirá luchando para más adelante poder tener su local propio.
texts.en:
Veronica is a 20 year old mother from a loving family. She has a three year old boy and works selling various animals like guinea pigs, rabbits, and ducks for consumption in a stall she has in the market of her home town, Huaraz.

Due to life circumstances, she became pregnant at a very young age and could not study for a professional career. However, this did not keep her from succeeding in life. Her son is her greatest motivation to fight in this life, because she wants to offer him a better future. 

Veronica is very grateful to the Kiva loaners because, with the help they have offered her, she will be able to buy more animals to offer to her customers. With that, her earnings will improve and she will improve the quality of life of her family, and in this way, she will continue striving to one day be able to have her own business premises.

loans.use: to buy animals for her business.

loans.name: Jose Enrique

texts.es:
Jose es un joven emprendedor de 19 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de juguetes en su ciudad natal, Huaraz.
Gracias al apoyo de sus padres y a mucho esfuerzo de su parte está estudiando la carrera de Mecánica, es una tarea muy difícil del día a día estudiar y trabajar, pero es un desafío que Jose está superando de manera excelente porque quiere tener un futuro mejor y sacar adelante a su familia.
Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería, diversidad de juguetes para tener en stock y ofrecerlos a sus clientes. Gracias a esto sus ventas mejorarán y más adelante podrá abrir su propio negocio y convertirse en un profesional exitoso.
texts.en:
Jose is a 19 year old entrepreneurial young man who makes a living selling toys in his home town, Huaraz.

Thanks to the support of his parents and much effort on his part, he is studying to be a mechanic. It's a very difficult task to both study and work every day, but it's a challenge he is overcoming superbly because he wants to have a better future and to provide for his family.

Jose is grateful to the Kiva loaners because with the help they have given him, he will be able to buy merchandise, a variety of toys to have in stock and to offer to his customers. Thanks to that, his sales will improve and in the future, he will be able to open his own store and become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy toys to supply his business.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a hard-working woman. She is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso, in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, making sweaters.

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy thread and a sewing machine. This will help Harriet to generate greater profits and expand her business. Harriet hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a house.

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy thread and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is 39 years old and married. She has been blessed with three children. She is a housewife and looks after her children and the household. Her husband has a woodworking business and is responsible to bring in income for the family. He buys logs of wood from the local market, and then cuts them down with his saw machine, to be used as fuel. He has seven years of experience in this field. He has to work really hard to meet his regular expenses, as he is the sole earner in the family.

The saw machine has stopped working, due to constant wear and tear. Therefore, he wants to replace it with a new one. But, due to insufficient income, he is unable to do so. Kishwar has therefore requested a loan, which she will use to help her husband buy a new saw machine for his wood-cutting business. They are thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan, for their kind assistance.

loans.use: to replace her husband's saw machine

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Ade, his wife, and their child live in Sumedang, a town located about three hours’ drive from Jakarta. To support the family's living, Ade manages a small shop that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. He joined Ruma, because he wanted to try out mobile airtime business. He also wanted to expand his network by joining Ruma.

Ade is excited to expand his business, by adding mobile phone airtime credits to the things he sells. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva, in order to do more transactions on weekends. Ade is pictured in the photo, standing in front of his stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile phone airtime credits to his community

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a hard-working woman. She is 24 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso, in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is currently in school. For the past three years, Jane has been working hard to manage her food stall, where she sells bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes.

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food items, and will help Jane to generate greater profits and educate her child. Jane hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a house.

Jane is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hard-working woman. She is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kajjansi, in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two and one-half years, Mercy has been working hard to manage her canteen business, where she sells snacks.

To help expand her business, Mercy has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase snacks and soft drinks, and will help her to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Mercy hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand the business further.

Mercy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 48-year-old, married woman, and a mother of five children. She lives with her family, in the typhoon-ravaged province of Iloilo, Philippines. Gemma has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband, for more than 10 years. She is in need of additional capital for their fishing business. She is requesting a loan to buy fishing gear like nets, crab cages, lead weights, hooks, and a new boat engine. This loan will enable Gemma and her husband to augment their catch. They sell their catch to the market.

Gemma dreams of expanding her fishing business and making it a success. Moreover, she wants to save more money for the education expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear, including a new boat engine, nets, and crab cages

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Sonia es una persona muy trabajadora, realiza su labor cotidiana como conserje en el Hospital de Nueva Guinea, con su humildad y sencillez supo darles buena enseñanza a sus hijos los que ahora son mayores de edad, independientes.  Sonia a pesar de las mejoras que ha realizado en su vivienda con sacrificio propios y con créditos obtenidos de Afodenic aun tiene otras mejoras que realizar como es embaldosar el corredor de su casa que es de suelo provocando en invierno zancudos y otros mosquitos perjudicial para su salud; Solicita este crédito para la compra de materiales como cemento, arena, piedrin y pagar mano de obra, así gozar de buenas condiciones en su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia is a very hard working person. She works on a daily basis as a cleaner in the New Guinea Hospital. With her humility and simplicity, she knew how to give her children, who are now independent adults, a quality education. 

Despite the improvements Sonia has made to her home through her own sacrifices and with loans from Afodenic, she still has other improvements to complete like tiling the hallway of her home which is currently dirt and attracts stilt-walkers and mosquitos which are damaging to her health. She is requesting this loan to buy materials like cement, sand, gravel and to pay for labor costs and in this way enjoy better conditions in her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for tiling.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 34 years old, and he is a mechanic. He has been a mechanic for 11 years, now. He is married and, together with his spouse, has been blessed with three children.

He will be using this loan amount to buy more tools and supplies for use. These include engine oil, sprayers, nuts, wheel caps, and side mirrors, among other items. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and repay the loan.

This is Silas's sixth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He has repaid his previous loans successfully. In future, he hopes to grow his business and live a successful life.

loans.use: to buy more mechanical tools and supplies

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia, a widow, is an entrepreneur who runs a general store, to make a living. Her children already have their own families, and they help Ofelia by working in the store on weekends. For many years the business has been doing well, and she wants to improve it. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC, and she will use it to buy more grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her store and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Zeka Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Hannah, a member of Zeka Women Group. She is married and has four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from trainings on enterprise and financial management. She is thirty years old, married, and living with her husband and four children.

Hannah runs a greengrocer kiosk, which supplies items such as kale, onions, and cabbages. Her main goal in life is to be financially stable. She will achieve this, after expanding her enterprise by adding more stock, such as kale, onions, and cabbages. She is constrained financially, and needs a loan to finance her expansion plans. She hopes to improve on her customer base, and hence earn more income. It’s from the profits that she will be able to finance her kids' education. Hannah is happy to receive Kiva's financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock, including kale, onions, and cabbages.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a 44-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband; he provides services carrying luggage from one place to another, via donkey cart. He wants to use a mule instead of a donkey, because the mule can carry more goods than the donkey. In this way, he would be able to easily carry more goods in shorter time, which will become the cause of saving time and increasing income.

Therefore, Bushra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan amount for her husband to buy a mule, to continue his business in a better way.

Bushra wants to save the excess profit amount. She plans to use these savings for future sudden needs, and for her children's education purposes. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a mule for her husband to use in his goods-carrying business

loans.name: Alpha

texts.fr:
Né en Août 1988 à Koulikoro, Mr ALPHA  est enseignant, en plus de cela il a embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus. Il est célibataire. Il vit chez son  père dans le quartier Médine de la préfecture de San.  Il s’est basé sur la vente du riz  qu’ il a appris  auprès de ses amis et l’exerce actuellement pour lui-même depuis 3 ans. Il est très sollicité et apprécié  par ses clients. Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décide de faire recours à l‘institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso.  Il est à son 1er prêt individuel. Mr ALPHA compte acheter une quantité importante de riz. Il s’approvisionne  auprès des cultivateurs de San. Il  vend tous les jours dans le quartier, à une clientèle composée de femmes et hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt, utiliser pour aider son père dans les besoins quotidiens et réinvestir le reste dans son activité de revenus .
texts.en:
Mr. Alpha was born in Koulikoro in August 1988. He is a teacher who has also embraced revenue-generating activities. He is single and lives with his father in the Médine neighborhood of San prefecture. 

He has been selling rice for three years - a trade he learned from his friends. He is very sought after and appreciated by his clients. He turned to the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, to help him satisfy his growing client base. This is his first individual loan. Mr. Alpha would like to buy a large amount of rice. He buys his supplies from the San farmers. He sells his goods every day in the neighborhood for cash and often for credit to a clientele comprised of women and men.

He would like to earn a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA that he will use to pay the loan, help his father with his daily needs, and reinvest in his revenue-generating activities.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a hard working woman. She is 19-years-old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 2.5 years, Teopista has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Teopista has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes, and will help her generate greater profits and expand the business. She hopes that in the future she can expand her business. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: purchase more clothes

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana de 59 años de edad, estudió hasta  4to grado, es madre soltera de 3 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando, además con ella viven 2 nietos.

Adriana se  dedica a trabajar como panificadora, ella tiene 5 años de trabajar en esta actividad, aprendió por una tía que le enseñaba cuando estaba más joven, ella por no tener otra actividad se ha dedicado a ello. El pan lo hace en su misma casa, y sus nietos son los que le ayudan a realizar el trabajo.

Ella necesita el crédito para instalar servicios de energía eléctrica en una casa que tiene en otra ciudad, también pagara una deuda que tiene en otra institución.

Su sueño es que sus nietos salgan adelante con sus estudios y que se superen en la vida.
texts.en:
Adriana is 59 years old and studied through the fourth grade. She is a single mother of three children who are studying. In addition, she has two grandchildren living with her.

Adriana works as a baker. She has been in this line of work for five years. She learned this skill from an aunt who taught her when she was a very young woman. Adriana has no other businesses so she is dedicated to this type of work. She makes the bread at home and her grandchildren help her with the work.

The loan she is requesting will be used to have electricity services installed at a house that she owns in another city. She will also pay off a debt that she has with another institution. Her dream is to see her grandchildren move forward with their studies so that they can succeed in life.

loans.use: to have electricity services installed at a house in another city and to pay off a debt with another institution.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy craft foam supplies to make crafts, cards, books and general stationery items

loans.name: Las Pilitas Group

texts.es:
La Asocicicion comunal las pilitas está conformada por siete mujeres y dos hombres, madres y padres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. y se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras responsables con ganas de superación personal.  En la actualidad luchan día a día para salir adelante con sus hijos. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo la coordinadora es  Blanca y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, aceite, jabón, jugos, galletas, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro, no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  La asociación comunal  Las Pilitas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Pilitas is made up of seven women and two men, who are responsible mothers and fathers bringing up fifteen children. They are from Sauce, located in the north of the region, and are known as being hard-working, responsible individuals who seek personal improvement. They fight every day to move forwards with their children.

Thanks to her efforts, the coordinator is Blanca. She has a small grocery store selling foodstuffs such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, soap, juice and biscuits. The aim of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business, so that in the near future she can increase her earnings. 

The communal bank Las Pilitas is grateful for the help given by Kiva lenders to those with limited means in poor countries like Nicaragua allowing them to have a dignified means of making a living.

loans.use: to stock their grocery store with products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, soap, juice and biscuits.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Lucy. She is 26 years old, married and living with her husband. She is a mother of two children who are aggressive and hardworking. Lucy is a member of the Magha Women Group that joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to gain skills in entrepreneurship and savings.

She buys vegetables from the local farmers and takes them to the city market. Lucy is borrowing a loan to purchase more stock for her vegetable business, which she has been operating for the last two years. Her supplies will increase and, therefore, so will her income. She hopes that her business will go a long way in helping her support her kids' education by providing school uniforms and writing materials and paying school fees for them. 

She is happy for Kiva and their lenders for the great support.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice's group is composed of hardworking women. Alice is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past two years, Alice has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, salt, and posho.

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, soap, salt, and posho, and will help Alice to generate greater profits and expand the business. Alice hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house.

Alice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, salt, and posho.

loans.name: Louay

texts.en:
Louay is a 40-year-old married Iraqi citizen and the father of two children. He has been working in manufacturing and making repairs to jewelry for jewelry shops in nearby villages since 2002. He was in partnership with his friend, but since he was the initial worker, the one who took care of everything related to the business, from seeking new customers, the PR and the work itself (creating, fixing and maintenance), he decided to pay his friend his share and work hard on his own to develop his business and family's living.
Louay started creating his own jewelry designs, and he is working hard on developing his business to open his own jewelry retail shop. 
Today, he is acquiring an SME loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business capital with raw gold and with special released tools necessary for developing his business and producing high quality products.
Louay has a strong relationship with the jewelry businessmen in his region. His business development helped him develop his family's living. Through his acquired income, he was able to buy a new house, make necessary repairs to keep it a healthy living place and buy furniture.
He hopes to open his retail selling shop and have his name well known in jewelry design business.

loans.use: To increase his business capital with raw gold, and with special released tools necessary for developing his business and producing high quality products

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Jeniffer.  She is a member of Magha Self Help Group. She is 40 years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from training in enterprise and financial management.

She is a vegetable farmer involved with cabbages, onions, tomatoes and kale, which she sells in the nearby markets. She is borrowing a loan to buy watering pipes and cans so that she can reduce the time it takes to water her crops and improve the crop yield. She hopes for an increased supply leading to higher and more consistent income. It’s due to this, that she will be able to support her children's education by paying school fees. 

She is very happy with Kiva and their lenders for the great support.

loans.use: To buy watering pipes and cans

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
En su séptimo ciclo se encuentra este grupo formado en la ciudad de Encarnación, por mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer y superar las limitaciones de cada una.
La Sra. Gumercinda es miembro de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de calzados sobre pedidos hace varios años, y tiene una clientela bien formada, en su última encuesta se encontraba mejorando poco a poco por medio de su trabajo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que se esmera por poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de calzados variados para poder seguir y salir adelante.
texts.en:
This group, which is in its seventh loan cycle, is from the city of Encarnación. It consists of hardworking and enterprising women. They have taken the poverty elimination survey so that they can become familiar with their limitations and be able to overcome them.

Sra. Gumercinda is a member of this group. She has been selling shoes on request for several years. Gumercinda has a well-established clientele. Her latest survey indicated that she has made gradual improvements as a result of her work. She is a hardworking person who puts forth the effort to get ahead.

Gumercinda is requesting a loan in order to buy shoes of various types so that she can continue her work and move forward.

loans.use: to buy various types of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in Lahore. She is 36, married and the mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He provides transportation services locally. He is a loving and responsible father as well. Their children are school going. He is the sole earner in the family so he has to bear all the financial burden of the family. He works really hard to make ends meet.

Currently his rickshaw tires need to be replaced with new ones as they have deteriorated due to constant driving. This has affected his income as well. He is short of money to buy new tires. Therefore Nasreen has requested a loan to help her husband through BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner.

Though they have low income, Nasreen's husband is satisfied and content that he is capable of earning and is looking forward to more opportunities to raise more income. He plans to save money to buy a new rickshaw to rent out in the future.

loans.use: to help her husband buy new wheels for his rickshaw.

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Annet's group is comprised of hard working women. Annet is 21-years-old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Annet has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and provide for the children. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the business. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: purchase more clothes

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Ly, a villager residing in the Borseth District, is 47 years old and the mother of three children. To make a living, she grows rice and her husband is a construction worker. She has been engaged in her business for twenty-nine years. Together, she and her husband can earn 30,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan cycle for her with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use the loan portion to spend to build a clean latrine for her family to use. She hopes to have a clean latrine for her family so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to build a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana de 43 años de edad, está casada y su esposo es motorista, tiene 7 hijos y ambos se esfuerzan para sacarlos adelante para que estudien y no les falte nada.

Ana es una mujer comprometida con su trabajo, lleva 10 años dedicándose a la venta de artículos varios en un comedor que posee como negocio familiar.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar insumos para elaborar alimentos y venderlos en su comedor.

Ella sueña con seguir trabajando junto a su esposo y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old, married, and her husband works as a motorbike driver. She has seven children and both she and her husband work hard to support them so that they can attend school and so that they never want for anything.

Ana is a woman who is committed to her work. She has spent 10 years making a living selling various dishes in a restaurant she owns as a family business.

She needs the loan to buy ingredients to make food and sell it in her restaurant..

He dreams are to continue working alongside her husband and for her children to become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food and sell it in her restaurant.

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en:
Mirvat is a 39-year-old married mother of three children. Three years ago she decided to open her own business for renting and selling dresses for special occasions to assist her husband in covering their family’s needs.

Mirvat is a hard worker who succeeded in satisfying her customers and gained a good reputation for her good customer service and special quality of products and acquired prices. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with newly released fashionable and elegant dresses for the upcoming autumn season, which will help her attract new customers.

Mirvat is trying hard to improve her work and increase her income to provide a better life for her beloved children.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with newly released fashionable and elegant dresses for the upcoming autumn season.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is a 50-year-old woman who is married to Raymundus, a 53-year-old man. They are blessed with a son named Kanisius, 23. Besides serving in her role as a housewife, Marcelina has been running a kiosk business since 2008.  She sells various products needed on a daily basis such as snacks, sugar, coffee, instant noodle, coffee, shampoo, soap, etc. Currently, her stock of products in the kiosk is running out so she needs extra capital to purchase more stock but she has limited money to do so. Therefore, she has applied for an individual loan of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be used to purchase more stock for her kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her kiosk

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en: Elisabeth is a 36-year-old single woman. She lives with her mother and siblings. Her father has passed away. Her mother is Yosefina, 64, and her siblings are: Tina, 39, an assistant pharmacist in a dispensary; Debi, 32, a housewife; Osa, 27, an administrative staff member at a university; and Matheos, 25, a customer service agent at a bank. Elisabeth runs a kiosk business to support her family income. In her kiosk, she sells various products of daily basic needs. She also sells various kinds of cakes. Currently, she wants to expand her business by purchasing a display case where she can display the products that she sells. She has limited money, therefore, she applied for an individual loan amounting to IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be used to purchase a display case and more stock of products.

loans.use: to purchase a display case and more stock of products

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Dembagnouman vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Pelengana sud de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de fruits et légumes, d’habillement  et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  16eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Ramata (la 1ere femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de fruits et légumes dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de fruits et légumes  à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Ramata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 89 500 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The five women in the Dembagnouman group all live in nuclear families. They are on average 47 years old with four children. They all live in the South Pelengana neighborhood of the city of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali) .

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, kinship, marriage and their income-generating activities in the neighborhood. They are retail merchants of fruit and vegetables, clothing and food preparations. In order to increase their stock supply, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their 16th group loan cycle. 

Mrs Ramata (the first woman standing from left to right in the photo) is a big seller of fruit and vegetables in the neighborhood and its surrounding area. She intends to use her loan to buy a large quantity of fruit and vegetables in Segou. Retail sales are conducted for cash and often on credit, from her home and in the market, to a mixed clientele. 

Mrs Ramata hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 89,500 CFA francs, which will be used for her children's minor needs and also to increase her stock supply.

loans.use: buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Teodoro Marcelino

texts.es: El joven Teodoro Marcelino, es soltero, sin hijos con mas de 4 años de experiencia en Docencia ganándose el pan diario con su labor y con sacrificio propio logró comprar su terreno para construir su propia vivienda que ha sido su meta.  Solicita crédito para Comprar una parte de materiales de Construcción para ir poco a poco comprando y posteriormente empezar la construcción mas o menos en el mes de Diciembre, pues con el aguinaldo ajustara otras compras y pagara mano de obra para levantar las paredes. De antemano agradece por este apoyo con el financiamiento que hará cumplir su mayor propósito.
texts.en: Teodoro Marcelino is a single young man with no children.  He has more than four years experience as a teacher, earning a living through his labor.  His sacrifices allowed him to buy a plot of land on which to build his own home.  This was one of his goals.  He is asking for this loan to buy building materials so he can begin construction little by little, beginning around December.  Between this and his savings, he will make some other purchases and pay for labor to raise the walls.  He is grateful for this loan that will help him achieve his greatest purpose.

loans.use: to build a home.

loans.name: Jonathan Andrey

texts.es: Jonathan Andrey, tiene la edad  de 22 años, está en unión libre, vive con su esposa, la cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de herramientas para la construcción de casas y algunos equipos que requiere para ser mas eficientes en la elaboración de los trabajos y los diferentes diseños de casas, con estas nuevas herramientas espera cumplir con los  pedidos de los clientes y además de ir saliendo mas rápidamente para poder tener mas trabajos y entregarlos con mas rapidez. Con esta compra de productos adecuados tendrá una calidad mejor de trabajos para el consumidor. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jonathan Andrey is 22 years old and in a common law marriage.  He lives with his wife and she is his main priority.  He will use the money from this loan to buy tools for building homes, along with some equipment he needs to become more efficient in his work.  He wants to use these tools to better meet his customer requests and finish them in less time so that he can get more jobs and deliver in less time.  Purchasing these tools will allow him to produce better quality work.  This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any previous loans through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him a much lower interest rate and made things easier.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra inicio la venta de variedades, específicamente accesorios como collares, pulseras, chanclas, entre otros hace 3 años, actividad aprendida gracias a una amiga que le enseño del oficio. 

Recurrió a esta actividad como una alternativa de generar dinero para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar; como mujer pujante, verraca pero ante todo delicada y bella busca desesperadamente el sustento para su hogar conformado por sus dos hijos. 

Debido al alza de los precios de la canasta familiar, del arriendo, gastos escolares, Sandra se ve en la necesidad de generar un mayor volumen de ingresos y es por este motivo que necesita un crédito que la ayude a mejorar la variedad de productos que exhibe como una mayor cantidad de cadenas y pulseras que diariamente ofrece a sus clientes y a personas puerta a puerta. 

Con este préstamo podrá sostener su negocio y podrá brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos que para ella son lo más importante.

Su principal sueño es poder convertirse en la propietaria de un almacén el cual le genere unos ingresos estables.
texts.en:
Sandra began selling sundries, specifically accessories such as necklaces, bracelets, slippers, and other things three years ago.  She learned to do this, thanks to a friend who taught her the trade.  She began doing this in order to earn money with which to help her husband with the household expenses.  As a delicate, but motivated and lovely woman, she desperately searches for a means to support her household, which includes her two children.

Given the increase in food prices, rent, and school expenses, Sandra sees the need to generate more of income and needs a loan so she can increase the variety of products she has, such as chains and necklaces that she sells daily door to door.

This loan will allow her to maintain her business and provide a better quality of life for her children who are very important to her.

Her greatest dream is to become a storeowner so she can generate a stable income.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking woman. Rose is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Rose has been working hard to manage her food stall business. 

Rose has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bananas, Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and improve her business. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business.
