Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy bananas, Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Anibal Jhonatan

texts.es: Anibal, tiene 25 años actualmente se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial en la universidad, su carrera tiene un periodo de 5 años viene estudiando 3 años. El trabaja en una empresa de construcción, haciendo sus prácticas pre-profesionales, se dedica siete  horas para realizar su estudio, se siente contento y a la vez muy satisfecho de estar logrando uno de sus más anhelados sueños de convertirse en una profesional. Su sueño más grande es poder terminar su carrera satisfactoriamente por eso que le pone mucho empeño y ganas de superación,  es por ello que solicitó el préstamo para el pago de sus matricula y pensiones de sus estudios y así el joven puede desarrollarse tranquilamente. Su sueño es poder culminar sus estudios y ponerse a trabajar.
texts.en: Anibal is 25 years old and is studying for a degree in industrial engineering. This university course lasts for five years; he has already completed three of them. Anibal also works for a building company, completing practical internships. He spends seven hours studying. Anibal is happy and very satisfied to be achieving one of his most desired goals of having a profession. Anibal's biggest dream is to be able to finish his degree. As a result he is putting in a lot of determination and really wants to do better than he ever has before. Anibal is applying for a loan in order to pay tuition fees and other university costs so that he can study without any worries. Anibal's dream is to finish his studies and to start working.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge que desde mucho tiempo ha luchado para obtener condiciones en su hogar, a diario imparte el pan de la enseñanza a niños de las zona, con sus ingresos provenientes del sector publico ha podido realizar compras de electrodomésticos necesarios para su hogar. Con este crédito su mayor propósito es reparar paredes en la parte de la cocina que están en mal estado y levantar dos que aun falta, y así contar con mejores condiciones.  manifiesta que con el crédito se beneficia por ser una manera de realizar inversiones e ir pagando poco a poco, ya que siendo asalariado su capacidad económica no es suficiente para hacer inversiones de un solo.
texts.en: Jorge has struggled for many years to support his household and teaches children in the area every day.  He has been able to use his public servant’s salary to buy appliances for his home.  He needs this loan to repair the walls of his kitchen, which are in bad shape.  He says that this loan will allow him to make purchases and pay little by little.  Since he is salaried, his income is not enough to make the purchases on his own.

loans.use: to repair his kitchen.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old, married and has two children. She has a curio shop in Tala town where she makes house decorations such as table mats, necklaces, bracelets and handbags. She has been in this business for three years and it has been profitable.

She will be using this loan to buy more stocks of beads, threads of different colors and fabrics. She will use the anticipated profits to open a retail shop.

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya; she repaid her previous loans successfully. In the future she hopes to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, beads and threads.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay monthly tuition fees.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: mariée et mère de 3 enfantsà 28 ans, Yawa réside à Adidogomé. Elle vend des  des chaussures. Elle achète s'approvisionne 3 foispar mois à grand marché de Lomé. Elle revend par vente ambulante à au marché d'assiyéyé. Yawa sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
A 28-year-old married mother of three children, Yawa resides in Adidogomé. She sells shoes.
   
She resupplies three times a month at the main market in Lomé. Sales are conducted as an itinerant vendor and at the Assiyéyé market.

Yawa is requesting this loan to expand her business so she can satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: buy three packages of shoes

loans.name: Edwin Ivan

texts.es: Edwin es un joven de 31 años de edad,es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Actualmente trabaja como Vigilante en el Municipio de su ciudad, Edwin cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y dedicación. Es una persona muy trabajadora, amable y respetuoso. Edwin está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que podrá cubrir los gastos para tramitar su licencia de conducir ya que tiene una moto y quiere generar mayores ingresos brindando servicio de transporte, asimismo podrá reparar la moto. De esta manera seguirá esforzándose y podrá ahorrar dinero para más adelante terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Edwin is a young man who is 31 years of age. He is single and lives with his family in Ica. Edwin currently works as a municipal security guard in his town. He believes that he is doing well because of his excellent achievements and dedication. Edwin is a hardworking, friendly, and respectful individual.

He is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. As a result, he will be able to cover the expenses related to obtaining his driver’s license since he owns a motorcycle. He wants to generate more income by providing transportation services. In addition, he will be able to have the motorcycle repaired. Edwin continues to put forth the effort and save money so that later on he can finish the construction of his house.

loans.use: to pay for his driver's license application and repairs to his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jardin Del Lago Group

texts.es:
Jardín del Lago es un grupo que se unió en la ciudad de Encarnación, está en el ciclo 12 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde por medio del trabajo de todas quieren ir mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marina ella se dedica a la venta de comidas en forma ambulante, en estos momentos ya tiene una clientela bien formada, se destaca el trabajo de la Sra. Marina, ya que es una persona que quiere salir adelante e ir superándose poco a poco.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, condimentos, hortalizas, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
Jardín del Lago (Garden of the Lake) is a group that was formed in the city of Encarnación. The group is in its 12th loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another move forward. They have taken the poverty elimination survey since all of them want to keep improving through their work.

One of the members is Sra. Marina, who sells food as a street vendor. At the moment, Marina has a well-established clientele since she has become known for her work. She is a person who wants to move forward and improve herself a little bit at a time.

Marina is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of vegetables, condiments, greens, and other products so that she can continue her work as she strives to improve.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, greens, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to look after cacao crops.

loans.name: Laurencio De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Laurencio es un veterano de mil batallas vividas a lo largo de su vida, vive en el municipio de Bello con su esposa y no tiene hijos.

El es un hombre muy trabajador y desde hace 5 años viene trabajando en el negocio de la chatarra. Inicio con este negocio luego de haber sido despedido de una empresa en la que trabajaba.

Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de chatarra. El tiene una pequeña bodega arrendada donde almacena su mercancía y luego lo vende a distribuidores.

Manifiesta que es un negocio muy bueno y sencillo de realizar para su edad.
El solicita un préstamo para compra de chatarra al por mayor y así poder sostener su negocio de una manera efectiva.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio y de darle un impulso considerable a su actividad, permitiéndole obtener recursos para el sostenimiento de su esposa.
texts.en:
Laurencio is a veteran of a thousand of life’s battles. He lives in Bello with his wife and has no children.

He is a very hardworking man and has been working the junk business for five years.  He started doing this after having been dismissed from the company where he worked.

He buys and sells junk and has a small warehouse where he stores his wares and then sells them to distributors.

He says that this is a very good and simple business for him to do at his age.  He is asking for a loan to buy junk in quantity so he can sustain his business efficiently.

This loan will provide him the opportunity to fund his business and will also provide him a considerable amount of support, allowing him to increase his resources to support his wife.

loans.use: to buy wares.

loans.name: Maria Albina

texts.es:
Maria Albina tiene de 35 años, es conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo e hijos, es de familia unida, con buenas referencias personales y laborales; vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Tumán, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque.

Maria Albina se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, su conviviente se dedica a brindar el servicio de mano de obra agricola, ella solicita préstamo para la inversión en compra de diversos animales, con ello tendrá un mejor stokc y variedad de animales que ofrecer lo que hará que pueda darle una mejor atención a sus clientes y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Albina is 35 years old. She is married and lives in a house that she owns with her husband and children. The family is very close and is known to be a good and hard-working family. María lives in a community where the inhabitants work in trade, farming and cattle raising. The community is in the Tumán district of Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region.

María makes a living growing and selling animals. Her husband is a farm labourer. María is applying for this loan in order to buy various animals in order to have more stock and a variety of animals to sell. This will allow her to offer her customers better service and she will be able to earn a higher income in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy various animals in order to have more stock and a variety of animals.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
María de 32 años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la actividad agrícola, tiene cuatro hijos que estudian en la escuela de la misma comunidad, y son los únicos que dependen de ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, ya tiene bastante tiempo en esta actividad en la cual ha adquirido bastante experiencia.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más ropa y ginas para tener más variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Su sueño es crecer en su negocio y tener algún día un local propio.
texts.en:
Maria, 32, is married.  Her husband works in agriculture.  They have four children who are studying at the local school.  They are the only people who are dependent on them.

She sells clothes.  She has been doing it for quite a while and has gained a lot of experience.

She needs a loan to buy more clothes and flip-flops to be able to offer more variety to her customers.

She dreams of seeing her business grow and having her own store one day.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and flip-flops so she has a more varied stock.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador de 72 años de edad, es una persona que se dedica a los oficios de fontanería desde hace 42 años, comenzó a laborar en una pequeña institución de agua y ahora se desempeña como fontanero en su comunidad. Está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y juntos procrearon un hijo que ya es mayor de edad.

Él se dedica a la fontanería y los fines de semana trabaja en las actividades agrícolas.


Él necesita el crédito para comprar materiales para la reparación de su casa ya que tiene una parte del techo que se le ha dañado y necesita mejorarlo.


Su sueño es montar una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Salvador, 72, has been a plumber for 42 years.  He started when he worked for a small water company and now he is the local plumber in his community. He is married and his wife takes care of the household chores.  Together they have one son who is now an adult.

Salvador works as a plumber during the week and at the weekend he dedicates his time to agricultural work.


He needs the loan to buy materials to repair his house because part of the room has been damaged and he needs to fix it.


He dreams of opening his own store in his home.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair his home, especially his roof.

loans.name: Alcides Omar

texts.es:
Alcides de 43 años de edad, está casado y su esposa es maestra, aún no tiene hijos y solo él vive en casa con su esposa.

Alcides trabaja como maestro en una escuela desde hace 17 años, sus padres fueron agricultores pero con esfuerzo lograron pagarle los estudios para que tuviera una profesión, el lugar donde trabaja está a 5 minutos de su casa y se va a pie, trabaja en un horario de 7:15 AM a 12 M.D.

Él necesita el crédito para reparar un carro que él dañó accidentalmente.

Él sueña con retomar un negocio de una librería que tenía hace un tiempo, y además le gustaría ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alcides, 43, is married.  His wife is a teacher.  They haven't got any children yet and they live alone in their house.

He is also a teacher.  He has been teaching in a school for 17 years.  His parents were farmers who, with a lot of effort, were able pay for his studies so that he could have a professional career.  He lives five minutes from work and he walks there.  His day starts at 7:15 and finishes at 12:00 pm.

He needs a loan to repair his car which he damaged accidentally.

He dreams of restarting a bookshop business that he had some time ago, and he would also like to extend his home.

loans.use: to repair his car that he damaged accidentally.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María de 66 años de edad, es viuda ya que su esposo falleció  hace 15 años y desde entonces ha sacado adelante a sus cuatro hijos por si sola, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y le ayudan a ella en lo necesario. Ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos ya que por su edad no tiene otra actividad productiva.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, bloques y arena para mejorar su vivienda y el techo.

Ella sueña con mantener a su familia unida y que sus hijos le den nietos.
texts.en:
Maria, 66, is a widow.  Her husband died 15 years ago and since then she has looked after their four children on her own.  Her children are now all adults and are able to help her when necessary. She takes care of the housework because at her age, she is too old to do any other work.

She needs a loan to buy building materials such as cement, blocks and sand to improve her home and repair the roof.

She dreams of keeping her family together and is hoping that her children give her some grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy building materials for some home improvements.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en: Florentina is married with three children. She is a businesswoman. She has been involved in her business activities since 2009 when she started with her own working capital of $50. She is applying for a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin. She has a kiosk and wants to use the loan to buy additional supplies, including noodles, soy sauce, lighters, toothpaste, cigarettes and other things to sell. She hopes that with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she can improve her business and run a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, soy sauce, lighters, toothpaste, cigarettes and other things to sell.

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr:
-   
mariée et mère de  4 enfants à 48 ans, Adèle  réside à agoè. Elle vend  de la boisson locale. Elle  s'approvisionne 1 fois par mois chez un  grossiste du quartier. Elle  revend à son  Domicile. Adèle sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en:
A 48-yer-old mother of four children, Adele resides in Agoè. She sells a local beverage.

She resupplies once a month at a local wholesaler, and resells from her home.

Adele is requesting this loan to expand her business, so she can satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: buy eight bags of sorghum

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 29-year-old married woman with two children. Her oldest child is 10 years old and the youngest one is 5 years old. She has a secondary education and is an employee in the private sector with a small salary. That salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of her family, so Samia decided to seek another business as a second source income. Samia works out of her home as a beautician. Her income from the beauty business is very low because she does not have enough equipment and cosmetics. In order to increase the capital in her business, Samia applied for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to purchase more cosmetics and accessories in order to attract more customers.

Samia looks forward to expanding her business in order to provide her family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and accessories to attract more customers.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
_ - 
Afi a 38 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants résident à agoè. Elle fait le petit commerce en vendant les pagnes et  des produits en  Alimentation  générale. Elle s'approvisionne 2 fois par mois au grand marché de lomé et revend à la devanture de son domicile. Afi sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Afi is 38 years old, married with four children, and resides in Agoè.

She runs a small business by selling pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) and grocery products. She resupplies twice a month at the big market in Lomé and resells in front of her home.

Afi is requesting this loan to expand her business and make more profit.

loans.use: buy five pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) and tomatoes

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ñepytyvo  es un comité nuevo, está en su primer ciclo, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, están luchando y esforzándose por crecer.
Beatriz se dedica a la venta de verduras, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, a través de sus ventas trata de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Pide este préstamo para la compra de verduras, frescas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir luchando por crecer y mejorar día con día.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group “Ñepytyvo” is a new committee that is in its first loan cycle. All of the members are friends and neighbors from the city of San Lorenzo. They are striving and putting forth the effort so that they can grow.

Beatriz sells vegetables. She is a hardworking and determined woman. Through her sales, Beatriz is striving to improve her living conditions and those of her family. She is requesting a loan in order to buy fresh vegetables. This will enable her to continue growing and improving each day.

Beatriz appreciates the opportunity she has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en: Khorn is a rural villager in the Borseth district of Kampong Speu province. She is 41 years old and married with six children. To make a living, she does rice farming and she can earn 30,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan for her. She and her co-borrower are requesting a loan. As the group leader she will use her loan portion to build a clean latrine. She hopes to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to build a clean latrine

loans.name: Léocadie

texts.fr:
-  
Agée de 46 ans  Léocadie est mariée et mère d’ 1 enfant  résidant à agoè. Elle a commencée son petit commerce en  vendant de la boule d’akassa. Elle s'approvisionne  2 fois  par mois marché assiyéyé et revend  Domicile  à sa  devanture.  Léocadie  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Léocadie is a 46-year-old married mother of one child, residing in Agoè. She began her small business by selling akassa balls (made from fermented maize).

She resupplies twice a month at the market in Assiyéyé and resells from her home-based stall. She is requesting a loan to expand her business, so she can satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: buy three bags of maize and mobile phone recharge units

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 60 años, es casada, conocida en el medio por la labor de crianza de ganado lechero. Vive en casa propia, con su esposo sin carga familiar, hijos viven disipados. Teresa es una persona con buenas referencias personales y laborales, de familia unida. Vive en una comunidad ubicada a 42 Km de Chiclayo, pasando Zaña, habitada por gente amable y respetuosa, que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Teresa se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero, desde hace más de 06 años aproximadamente, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como patos, pavos, cerdos y cabritos. Ella necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de cerdos, chivos y comida para estos. Dicha inversión le generara mayor venta de estos, mejores ingresos y por ende mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Teresa is 60 years old, she is married and well-known for her work, which is raising dairy cattle. She lives in her own house, together with her husband but without a family to care for. Her children live independently. Teresa is a person with good personal and work references, from a united family. She lives in a community which is 42 kilometers from Chiclayo, in the direction of Zaña. The people in this community are friendly and respectful and they work in commerce, agriculture, and cattle-raising. 

Teresa is dedicated to raising dairy cattle. She has done this for approximately 6 years. She also raises small animals such as ducks, turkeys, pigs, and goats.

She needs a loan to invest it in the purchase of pigs, goats, and food for them. This investment will result in higher sales for her, therefore a higher income and, eventually, a higher profit.

loans.use: to buy pigs, goats and food for them.

loans.name: Sergio Bladimir

texts.es:
Sergio es un joven de 26 años de edad, está soltero y aún no tiene hijos, él vive con su hermana con quien se coordina para llevar a cabo las actividades del hogar.

Sergio tiene 19 años de años de realizar la actividad agrícola, lo aprendió de su padre y hoy en día le sirve para obtener el sustento diario de él y su hermana.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar un refrigerador ya que desea tener venta de refrescos en su casa.

Él sueña con tener mucha salud para trabajar, construir su propia vivienda y montar un negocio de helados.
texts.en:
Sergio is a young man who is 26 years of age. He is single and has no children. Sergio lives with his sister, who coordinates the household activities.

Sergio has been farming for 19 years since he learned the trade from his father. Today he is able to support himself and his sister because of these skills. Sergio needs to buy a refrigerator because he wants to sell soft drinks from his house. He dreams of being in good health so that he can work, building a house of his own, and opening an ice cream business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator so that he can sell soft drinks from his house.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Dolores; La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL la socia continua  con su negocio de servicios de llamadas telefónicas, La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua realizando llamas nacionales como locales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca delante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra  de nuevos equipos de celulares.
texts.en:
This lender is Dolores. Dolores is a member of the San Rafael village bank. She still has her telephone call service business. She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments. She is a responsible and diligent person. She continues to make national and local calls for her clients and by this supports her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy new equipment for cell phones.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for cell phones.

loans.name: Noemi Luz

texts.es:
La socia Noemí pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de ferretería, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo  pinturas, cementó entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cemento entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Noemí is a member of the San Rafael village bank. She continues running her hardware store. She is a responsible and diligent person. She continues selling paint, cement, and more, and this is the way she supports her family.

Noemí asks for a loan to buy cement and other things.

She is thankful for the loan she has received and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy cement and other things.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La señora Mariela continua vendiendo productos naturales para la salud, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de  productos naturales.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Mariela continues working in her business selling natural health products. She is a responsible and diligent person. She has had her business for some time and is goes well thanks to the efforts she puts into it each day, and with her business she supports her family.

Mariela asks for a loan to buy natural products. She is thankful for the loan she received and promises to make her repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es:
El socio Jhonatan pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, él socio continua brindando el servicio de taxi, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, el socio a la vez continua alquilando equipos electrónicos para compromisos que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su carro.
texts.en:
Jhonatan is a member of the San Rafael village bank. He continues providing taxi services. He is a responsible and diligent person.

Jhonatan is thankful for the loan he received and promises to make is repayments as scheduled. 

He also continues to rent out electronic equipment sometimes, when a job requires it. This is how he supports his family.

He is asking for a loan for his car's maintenance.

loans.use: to do car maintenance.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Roxana pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, la socia continua dedicándose  a su negocio de venta de productos naturales para la salud, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo a sus clientes que le solicitan,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de  productos naturales.
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorga y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the "San Rafael" village bank. She continues her business of selling natural health products.

Roxana is a responsible and diligent person. She continues selling to customers who place orders with her, and this is how she supports her family. She asks for a loan to buy natural products.

She is thankful for the help she has received and commits to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Carlos continua dedicándose a brindar el servicio de transporte, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
texts.en:
Carlos is a member of the "Illary III" village bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco.

Carlos continues providing transportation services. He is thankful for the loan he received and he promises to make his payments as scheduled. He has been working in his business for a good amount of time, and it gives him economic and personal satisfaction. He wants to continue working in order to support his family.

He asks for a loan to have maintenance work done on his car.

loans.use: to do car maintenance.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
La socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de madera, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,la socia  continua elaborando muebles, mesas entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de madera.
texts.en:
This group member continues her business buying and selling wood. She is a responsible and diligent person. She continues making furniture, tables, and other things for her customers on order.

The group member is thankful for the loan and promises to may her repayments as scheduled. She wants to support her family. She asks for a loan to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia continua con su negocio de bar y picanteria, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo pollo al horno, sopas, cuy al horno entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajar para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues her work at her bar / restaurant business. She has had this business for various years and it goes well thanks to the efforts she puts into it every day. She still sells roasted chicken, soups, roasted guinea pig, and more. She wants to continue working and by this continue supporting her family. 

She asks for a loan to buy supplies like oil, rice, etc. She is very happy about the loan and promises to make her repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy supplies like oil, rice, etc.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia Sabina continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas.
La socia está contenta con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabina still has her grocery store. She has been in this business for a number of years, and it goes well thanks to the efforts she puts into it every day.

She still sells staple goods such as rice, sugar, etc. She wants to be able to continue her work, and by this to be able to continue supporting her family. She asks for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits. She is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments as agreed.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia Inés sigue dedicándose a la venta de comida, la socia continua elaborando diferentes tipos de platos como arroz con pollo, saltado, sopas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, carnes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Inés continues selling food. She still prepares different kinds of dishes like chicken and rice, "saltado" [stir fry], soup, and others which her customers order from her. She is a responsible and diligent person, and this is how she gets her family ahead.

She asks for a loan to buy oil, meat, etc. She is thankful for the loan she received and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, etc.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia Maruja sigue con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia continua vendiendo diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, leche, azúcar, golosinas entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
Maruja still has her grocery store. She continues selling different products such as rice, milk, sugar, sweets, etc. 

She is thankful for the loan she received and promises to make her payments. She wants to get her family ahead. She asks for a loan to buy oil, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mirian Matilde

texts.es:
La socia Mirian Matilde, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de velas, la socia vende las velas a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de velas.
texts.en:
This is Mirian Matilde. She continues her business selling candles. She sells the candles to customers who place orders with her.

She has been in this business for a number of years and it goes well thanks to the efforts she puts into it every day. She is thankful for the loan and promises to make he payments. She wants to get her family ahead.

She asks for a loan to buy candles.

loans.use: to buy candles.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La socia Georgina pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III,el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco. La socia tiene 52 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de tortas, pasteles entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negoció el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de pasteles para sus clientes que le solictan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, azúcar entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Georgina is a member of the "Illary III" village bank. This bank is located in the department of Cusco.

Georgina is 52 years old, has 4 children and is married. In addition to her daily tasks, she has a business preparing cakes, pastries, etc. She has been in this business for quite some time and it goes well because of the efforts she puts into it every day. She makes different types of cakes for her clients on order. She wants to continue her work and keep supporting her family.

She asks for a loan to buy supplies, like flour, sugar, etc. She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres En Acción De Fhiladelfia Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Mujeres En Acción De Fhiladelfia” La cual  está constituida por 08 socios responsables y entusiastas. María de 52 años de edad es casada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica  a la compra y venta de calzados. Hace 11 meses que emprendió su negocio de calzado que lo distribuye a pedidos por catalogo. Su mayor deseo es implementar su local para poder exhibir sus productos.  Solicitó el crédito para la compra  de zapatillas, botines, sandalias y calzados de vestir. El grupo “Mujeres En Acción De Fhiladelfia” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. María es la tercera del lado derecho y viste casaca plomo.
texts.en:
This is the group "Mujeres En Acción De Fhiladelfia". It consist of 8 responsible and enthusiastic members.

María is 52 years old, married and has 1 child which is grown-up. She works buying and selling shoes. She started her business 11 months ago and sells on catalogue orders. Her major wish is to set up premises and thus to be able to display her products.

She asks for a loan to buy shoes, boots, sandals, and dress shoes.

The group "Mujeres En Acción De Fhiladelfia" thanks the Kiva lenders for the help they have given. María is the third from the right in the picture and is wearing a grey cardigan.

loans.use: to buy shoes, boots, sandals, and dress shoes.

loans.name: Maria Clementina

texts.es:
María, es un apersona soltera, vive con sus dos hijos, de los cuales uno ya está casado y el otro es soltero tiene 33 años de edad; por la necesidad de salir adelante con sus hijos, inicio a vender ropa, en el negocio ya tiene más de 30 años de experiencia, lo realiza de lunes a sábado en un horario de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. y los días domingo de hasta la 1:00 p.m., hasta la fecha no presenta problemas en su negocio.
Invertirá en la compra de faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas y otras prendas con nuevos estilos para tener más surtido su negocio, será de ayuda la inversión para mantenerse trabajando, satisfacer a sus clientes y seguir teniendo ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para ampliar su negocio, cancelar su deuda, trabajar con capital propio y tener un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
María is single and lives with her two children. One of them is already married and the other is 33 years old. As she needed to provide for her sons, she started to sell clothing. She already has more than 30 years' experience in this business. She works from Monday to Saturday from 7:00 a. m. to 4:00 p. m., and on Sundays until 1:00 p. m. She has never had any problems with her business.

She wants to invest in the purchase of skirts, blouses, trousers, shirts, and other clothes with new styles, in order to have a wider selection in her business. This will help her to keep up her business and to satisfy her clients, and by this she will continue to have an income to cover the expenses of her family.

It is her dream to continue working and to increase her business, to pay back her loan and to work with her own capital, and to have a more dignified life.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, trousers, shirts, and other clothing in new styles to have a wider selection in her business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina sigue dedicándose  a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia  se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member who continues to work at her grocery store business. She feels grateful for the loan and she is committed to reaching her her established goal. She has been in this business for years and it brings financial and personal satisfaction. She wants to continue working to be able to continue supporting her family.  

She is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar and more.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and more.

loans.name: Alma Muriel

texts.es:
Alma, necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar leña, maíz, cal y gas propano, son la materia prima para elaborar la venta de tortillas, así podrá continuar teniendo sus clientes satisfechos y generando los recursos económicos para seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones.
El invertir el financiamiento anterior en su negocio Alma ha mejorado la productividad y su situación económica ha tenido un cambio positivo. Brinda a su familia el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Alma needs a new loan to buy firewood, corn, lime, and propane gas. These are the supplies she needs to prepare the tortillas she sells. By this, she will be able to continue satisfying her customers and keep earning the income to meet all her obligations.

By investing her earlier loan into her business, Alma has increased her productivity and her economic situation has improved. She earns the money her family needs each day.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, lime, and propane gas, as these are the supplies she needs to sell tortillas.

loans.name: Karen Yesenia

texts.es: Karen, tiene 26 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos, reside con su esposo, sus hijos y un hermano  en el municipio de El progreso, Yoro. Ella  se dedica a la venta de frutas en pedazos y en bolsa como ser mangos verdes con salsa, papaya, naranjas, melón, sandia, banano y vende dulces, galletas y otras golosinas. Este negocio lo tiene hace 5 años en un puesto de venta por el mercado.  El  monto de préstamo que solicita es por 5,000 lempiras con el cual va surtir de frutas frescas de temporada y compra de dulces, galletas y churros para vender. Su propósito es mantener siempre su fuente de ingresos para la familia, obtener ingresos para darle educación a sus hijos y ahorrar para tener su propia casa.
texts.en: Karen is 26 years old. She is in a common law marriage with her spouse with whom she has 2 children. She lives with her husband, children, and a brother in the town of El Progreso, Yoro. She sells fruit that is cut up and in bags, like green mangos with salsa, papayas, oranges, melons, watermelons, and bananas. She also sells candies, cookies and other snacks. She has had this business for 5 years at a sales stall in the market. The amount of the loan she is asking for is 5,000 lempiras to buy fresh seasonal fruit and to buy candies, cookies, and churros to sell. Her objective is to always maintain her source of income for her family so she can educate her children and save to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fresh fruit and candies, cookies and churros to sell.

loans.name: Angel Maria

texts.es:
Ángel, ha sabido utilizar los préstamos que se le otorgan, comenta que con ayuda de ellos su negocio ha mejorado mucho, dándole oportunidad de siempre tener su fuente de ingresos con vida, su estilo de vida familiar es más confortable.
Nuevamente se decidió por un crédito con el comprara bebidas, boquitas, dulces, pan, pollo, embutidos, tomates y otros materiales para surtir el chalet y preparar la venta de panes, así podrá continuar trabajando sin escases de materia prima.
texts.en:
Ángel has used well the loans she has received. She says that with their help her business has improved a lot. This has given her the opportunity to have a source of income, and the life of her family has become much more comfortable.

She is asking for a new loan to buy beverages, snacks, sweets, bread, chicken, cold meats, tomatoes, and other things in order to stock her store and to prepare sandwiches for sale. By this, she will have enough supplies to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, snacks, sweets, bread, chicken, cold meats, tomatoes, and other supplies to stock her store and sell sandwiches.

loans.name: Maria Genoveva

texts.es:
María, se compró todos los materiales básicos para elaborar la venta de antojitos y comida con la ayuda del préstamo anterior, sus ventas son mucho mejor, las nuevas ganancias le sirven para cubrir los gastos familiares, el pago de la deuda y hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
Como una forma de mantener su inventario bien surtido se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar pollo, embutidos, verduras, aceite, etc., para continuar mejorando la variedad en el menú de su negocio, espera seguir atrayendo clientes nuevos y progresando.
texts.en:
María bought all the supplies she needs to prepare and sell snacks and dishes with her previous loan. Her sales have improved a lot and the new profits help her to cover the household expenses, the repayment of her debt, and to improve her home.

As a way to keep her business well stocked, she decided to ask for another loan to buy chicken, cold meats, vegetables, oil, etc. By this she will continue improving the variety of the menu of her business, and hopes to attract new clients and to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy chicken, cold meats, vegetables, oil, etc., in order to continue improving the variety of the menu of her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare the soil to be able to plant the last crop of corn.

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es: María tiene 54 años de edad es casada con 05 hijos independientes. Este es el grupo “Las Pioneras” conformada por 06 mujeres responsables y solidarias. María se dedica a la venta de bolsas de plásticos. Como actividad secundaria se dedica al cuidado de la salud con hierbas naturales. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo puede generarle ingresos para su hogar. Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de bolsas de plástico y hierbas naturales. El grupo “Las Pioneras” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el crédito brindado. María es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste casaca morado.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old, she is married and has 5 children who are grown up. This is the group "Las Pioneras", which consists of 6 responsible and united women. María works selling plastic bags. Her second activity is to provide healthcare with natural herbs.

She is happy because, thanks to her efforts, she is able to earn enough money for the household expenses. It is her main wish to set up a grocery store. She will use the loan she has asked for to buy plastic bags and natural herbs.

The lending group "Las Pioneras" thanks the Kiva lenders for the loans they provide. María is the third on the left, she is wearing a purple cardigan.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags and natural herbs.

loans.name: Oscar Mauricio

texts.es:
Oscar, vive con su compañera de vida, juntos son padres de tres hijos de 14, 12 y 2 años de edad; dese hace 20 años aprendió a ofrecer el servicio de transporte de carga por motivación de un amigo, su horario de trabajo es de nueve de la mañana a nueve de la noche, de esta manera don Oscar puede cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Invertirá en darle mantenimiento al pick up de trabajo, le permitirá mejorar el servicio y seguridad de sus viajes, espera tener mayores ingresos, ganar popularidad, seguir cubriendo las necesidades de su familia y cancelar su deuda con buen record crediticio.
Su proyecto es tener recursos económicos para comprar un taxi con el que pueda generar ingresos extras y seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Oscar lives with his partner and they have three children who are 14, 12 and 2 years old. A friend motivated him to take up the business of providing freight transportation services 20 years ago. He works from 9 o'clock in the morning until 9 o'clock at night. By this, Oscar can cover the basic expenses of his family.

He will invest in the maintenance of the pick-up he uses for work. This will enable him to improve the service and the safety of his trips, and he hopes to earn more money and popularity, and to continue covering the expenses of his household and paying back his debt on time.

It is his plan to have sufficient economic resources to buy a taxi, which he will use to earn additional money and to increase his business.

loans.use: to invest in his pick-up's maintenance, which will enable him to improve the service and safety of his trips.

loans.name: Kossua

texts.fr:
_ - 
Agée de 51 ans  Kossua est  divorcée  et  mère d’ 3 enfants  résidant  à agoè. Elle a commencée son petit commerce en  vendant des céréales et alimentation générale. Elle s'approvisionne  2 fois  par mois grand marché de lomé  et  revend dans sa  boutique  au  marché assiyéyé.  Kossua  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: 51-year-old Kossua is a divorced mother to three children who lives in Agoe. She gets her supplies twice monthly from the main market in Lomé. She then resells her wares from her stall at the market in Assiyéyé. Kossua is requesting a loan in order to expand her business so that she can better satisfy her customers and gain a larger profit.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of corn and some tomatoes

loans.name: Akuelé

texts.fr:
-   
divorcée et mère de  1 enfant à 51 ans, Akuelé  réside à agoè. Elle vend  du charbon de bois et des condiments. Elle  s'approvisionne 3 fois par mois au  marché de tsévié. Elle  revend à la devanture de  son  Domicile et est ambulente. Akuelé sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: 51-year-old Akuelé is a divorced mother to one child who lives in Agoe. She sells wood charcoal and foodstuffs. She gets her supplies three times per month from the market in Tsévié. She then resells her wares out of her own home and on the street. Akuelé is requesting a loan in order to expand her business so that she can better satisfy her customers and gain a larger profit.

loans.use: to purchase two cartons of tomatoes, one sack of onions and five sacks of wood charcoal

loans.name: Assaba

texts.fr:
_ -  
Agée de 59 ans  Assaba est  veuve  et  mère d’ 3 enfants  résidant  à agoè. Elle a commencée son petit commerce en  vendant des pagnes et alimentation générale. Elle s'approvisionne  2 fois  par mois grand marché de lomé  et  revend  dans son  quartier environnant  et  au  marché assiyéyé,Zongo.  Assaba  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: 59-year-old Assaba is a widowed mother to three children who lives in Agoe. She started out her small business by selling pagne cloth and general foodstuffs. She gets her supplies twice monthly from the main market in Lomé. She then resells her wares in her local area and at the markets in Assiyéyé and Zongo. Assaba is requesting a loan in order to expand her business so that she can better satisfy her customers and gain a larger profit.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheets of pagne cloth and 12 cartons of tomatoes

loans.name: Rafael Alexis

texts.es:
Rafael, se dedica a la compra de materiales reciclables para luego venderlos, vive con su familia; el negocio lo aprendió dentro de su familia, desde hace 5 años lo hace de manera independiente en un horario de siete de la mañana a seis de la tarde, su ventaja es que la rentabilidad del negocio es muy buena.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar hierro, aluminio, baterías y otros materiales para luego venderlos a mejor precio, se mantendrá trabajando y podrá pagar de contado por los materiales que compra en sus recorridos. Espera que la inversión le genere mayores ganancias con las que podrá pagar su deuda y cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.
Sus sueños es tener un negocio más rentable y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Rafael works buying recyclable materials in order to sell them. He lives with his family and learnt the trade from his family. He has worked independently in this field for five years, and he works from 7 o'clock in the morning to 6 o'clock in the evening. It is an advantage for him that his business is very profitable.

He will use the loan to buy metal, aluminum, batteries, and other materials, and then sell them at a better price. He will continue working and will be able to pay cash for the materials he finds. He hopes that the investment will result in higher profits for him, which he will use to pay his debt and to cover the expenses of his household.

It is his dream to have a more profitable business and to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy metal, aluminum, batteries, and other materials and then to sell them at a better price.

loans.name: Graciela Genoveva

texts.es:
Graciela, está satisfecha por los buenos resultados que ha tenido al invertir el financiamiento anterior en su negocio, manifiesta que sus clientes son mucho más, las ganancias no han sido muchas, pero si le sirven para subsistir con su familia y pagar su deuda.
Se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito para comprar granos básicos, jugos, huevos, gaseosas, golosinas, pan, entre otros productos para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, pues al aumentar la demanda de sus productos el inventario debe ser rápidamente abastecido.
texts.en:
Graciela is very happy with the good results she achieved when she invested her earlier loan in her business. She says that she has many more customers now, and that the profit she made - even if it was not a lot - helped her to support her family and pay back her debt.

She decided to take out a new loan to buy basic grains, juices, eggs, sodas, sweets, bread, and other products to fulfill the demands of her customers, because when the demand for her products increases, her stocks will very soon be depleted.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, juices, eggs, sodas, sweets, bread, and other products to fulfill her customers' demands.

loans.name: Grupo Barrio La Unión Sector Kiosco Group

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como vendedora de abarrotería en una tienda.  Era lo que ella esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. De 46 años de edad mujer emprendedora y decidida a enfrentar la realidad de la vida, ella cuenta con tres hijos por los cuales ella tiene realizar un esfuerzo enorme para poder mantener  a su familia, los hijos de Feliza son excelentes estudiantes en una escuela de su comunidad. (Ella se encuentra de 1ra de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía)

La actividad productiva que Feliza realiza es la compra y venta de  abarrotería, ella decidida a realizar esta actividad porque es rentable y hay pocas personas que realizan esta actividad en su comunidad, ella viene realizando dicha actividad desde hace diez años y le ha dejado muy buena ganancia para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Ella es una gran mujer emprendedora y líder en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se ha decidido a emprender el negocio junto a ella para que ellas también mejoren sus condiciones de vida de sus familias.
El uso respectivo que ella dará al crédito gestionado es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotería ya que para ella es de mucha importancia para poder desempeñar su actividad de cada día ya que es el medio en la que ella puede tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia. 
Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es ahorrar para un futuro construir casas para sus hijos  para que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada y dar estudio a sus hijos y que ellos se convierten en profesionales en los diferentes campos laborales de la vida.
texts.en:
Life has given her the opportunity to work selling groceries in a store. That’s what she was hoping for, not only for an open door but what was behind that door. What she found was something that defined what she wanted to do. At 46 years old, and entrepreneur and decisive about confronting the reality of life, she has three children for whom she has to make an enormous effort to be able to take care of her family. Feliza’s children are excellent students in her community's school. In the photograph, she is the first one going from left to right 

The productive activity that Feliza practices is to purchase and sell groceries. She has decided to do this activity because it is rentable and there are few people in her community who practice it. She has been doing this activity for 10 years now, and it has left her with good earnings to sustain her family. 

She is a great woman entrepreneur and a leader in her community, which is why a group of women has decided to open a business alongside her so that they can too improve upon the living conditions of their families. 

She will use the requested loan to purchase groceries because for her it is of the utmost importance to keep her business successful everyday, as it is the only means through which she can have an income to benefit her family. 

One of her aspirations is to save enough for the future and build houses for her children, so that they have an adequate quality of life, and to give her children an education so that they can become professionals in the different working fields of life.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is a hardworking woman. Gorret is 22 years old, and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Gorret has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes, and will help Gorret to generate greater profits and provide for the child. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to get a permanent shop for her business. 

Gorret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Erisha

texts.en:
Erisha, a 51-year-old married man with 6 children, is predominantly a rural farmer doing crop husbandry. He is also a cathechist at a local Anglican church.

He in most cases grows maize, beans, and bananas, from which he gets food and income to support his family, since catechism does not pay much money. He has been a reverend since 1987 because it is his profession. 

With the loan, he will hire labourers to clear the piece of land so that he can increase his production and make enough money to pay his children's tuition. He is assured of the income since he usually sells his goods to the local community. However, he faces the challenge of limited capital, which affects his business. 

He is described as an honest and hardworking man and appreciates lenders for the services offered.

Pictured is Elisha with the UGAFODE credit officer (left to right).

loans.use: To clear land

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
This is Aurelia, 52, a resident of Batasan Hills, Quezon City, Philippines. She is a single mom with one child.  She manages her own household while operating the business.  She works hard  to continually provide income for their daily household and personal needs.

Aurelia maintains a direct selling business.  She is a dealer of clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Boardwalk, Natasha, and other direct selling brands. The dealers buy them at lower prices than shown in the catalogue, and then sell them at a higher price to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and friends and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 4,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will use the loan as additional capital to buy merchandise items and orders like undergarments, T-shirts, bags and beauty products for her customers.   She is positive this will boost her sales and her income.  

Aurelia hopes that her child will be able to graduate from college one day, and have her own business as well.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to make the initial purchase of Boardwalk Personal Products

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 35 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children. She has a clothes selling business in Tala town. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell. These include shirts, dresses, sweaters, skirts, blouses and trousers. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and she paid her previous loans successfully. In future she hopes to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a fisherman from Iloilo, Philippines. He is 36 years old, married, and a father of five children. 

Nelson has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income. 

Nelson's fishing business was greatly damaged when a super typhoon hit several months ago. As of now, Nelson is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and buckets. Through this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. 

Nelson dreams of expanding his business so that it will generate more income for their needs, especially for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and buckets

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
La socia Aydee pertenece al banco comunal LOS ANGELES, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 29 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de plastiqueria,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son platos, tasas entre otros, la socia desea poder  seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de plásticos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidos.
texts.en:
Aydee, 29, is a member of Los Angeles Communal Bank, located in the department of Cusco.  She has one child and lives with her companion.

She alternates her daily activities with her plastics business.  She has been in this business for some time and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She sells plates, glasses, and other products.  She wants to keep on working so she can continue to support her family.

Aydee's requesting the loan to buy plastic products.  She's grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy plastic products

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is 35 years old, married, and blessed with five children. She is a loving mother and looks after the household activities. 

Her husband drives a three-wheeled rickshaw and provides transportation services within Lahore. Their children are school-going. As her husband is the sole earner, he tries his best to meet the regular family expense. He is a loving father and is determined to educate all his children to make them capable and responsible. 

As he works days and night his rickshaw needs to be repaired, but he is short of funds. For this reason, Nabeela has requested for a loan to help her husband pay for the repair expenses. They are thankful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to cover the repairing cost of her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Nelina

texts.en:
Nelina is 25 years old; she is married and she has two children. She a businesswoman, and  she has a kiosk in her house. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to use it to buy additional items, including sugar, milks, biscuits, candies, soaps, slippers, salts, shampoo, cigarettes, detergent, sardines, rice and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

She has been involving in business activities since 2012, and she started with her own working capital of $900. She is happy to be taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can learn how to improve management because with good management she can open a big store in the future. So she is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin to her.

loans.use: To buy sugar, milks, biscuits, candies, soaps, slippers, salts, shampoo, cigarettes, detergent, sardines, rice and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa is a hardworking woman. Hasifa is 22 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past two years, Hasifa has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Hasifa has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Hasifa to generate greater profits and expand on the business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to boost the business. 

Hasifa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, crab nets, lead weights and fish hooks, and a new boat engine

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 48 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with seven children. She does farming in Kangundo town, where she grows cash crops and keeps cattle.

She will be using this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting. She will also buy cattle feed for her cattle. Farida will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her seventh loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she paid her previous loans successfully. In future she hopes to improve her farming and make more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and cattle feed.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina lives in Ermera, and she is married. She has been involved in business activities since 2009; she started with her own working capital of $500. She is requesting a loan of $600 because she has a kiosk and she is very interested in her business, so she took a loan from Tuba Rai Mentin.  She wants use it to buy more goods such as cooking oils, noodles, biscuits, candies, cigarettes, aqua, pens, and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

Paulina is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin so she can have more working capital to buy more goods. She needed to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her management of her business, and she wants to increase her income in the future. 

She also has animals in her house like cows, pigs, and chickens.

loans.use: To buy cooking oils, noodles, biscuits, candies, cigarettes, aqua, pens, and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to raise and sell to increase his business more.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en: Angie is married with three children. She lives in Lopez Jaena. She helped her husband in their fishing business by selling fish in the village while her husband does the fishing. Oftentimes when they caught more volume of fish, they went together to the villages to sell fish. She borrowed a new loan recently from GDMPC microcredit to buy new fishing nets. She earns better income from this activity and she wants a little improvement as well to improve their living situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 25-year-old single man who supports his elderly parents and has been operating a motorcycle transport business for a period of four years earning an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Michael was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 30,000. He intends to use this amount to add to his savings and buy an additional motorcycle. 

Michael plans to use the anticipated income to start a car-hiring business and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: to add to his savings and buy an additional motorcycle.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene lives in Lopez Jaena with her family. She is a 24-year-old woman who has a child. She helps earn a living by vending fish in the market while her husband does the fishing. She borrowed a new loan to buy another fishing net to be used for the business. She wants to earn more to save her revenue in order for it to be used for their house renovation.

loans.use: to buy another fishing net.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking woman. Gloria is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 4 months, Gloria has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which sews clothes. 

To help expand her business, Gloria has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials for the business and will help Gloria to generate greater profits and improve on the business. Gloria hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a salon business. 

Gloria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy materials for the business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Eva works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Eva is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her cafeteria business.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her cafeteria business.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en: Brigitte is 37 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 1 and 12. Three of them go to school. She has been selling at a mini-market for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as milk, sugar, and cakes. The profits from the business will be used to buy a new house.

loans.use: to buy more items such as milk, sugar, and cakes.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is 46 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 1 and 14. Three of them go to school. She has been selling at a mini-market for 21 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cakes, eggs and milk for sale. The profits from business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more eggs, cakes and milk for sale.

loans.name: Sinia Sonia

texts.es:
Sinia, requiere más capital que invertirá en la compra de variedad de pescado y en remodelar el local del negocio, será de utilidad para tener un mejor inventario y un espacio con mayor comodidad e higiene, sus deseos de mantenerse trabajando y generando ingresos para salir adelante con su familia hacen que Sinia día con día administre de la mejor manera sus ganancias.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a ofrecer productos frescos y de calidad a sus clientes, sus ventas e ingresos han tenido un cambio positivo, su familia se mantiene viviendo en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Sinia is in need of more capital to invest in buying different types of fish and remodeling her establishment. This will allow her to increase her stock levels, have a more comfortable place, and increase the hygiene standards. She wishes to continue working and generating income to get ahead with her family, which is an incentive for her to better manage her profits.

With the previous loan she was able to offer her customers fresher products and improve their quality. Her sales and profits have improved and her family lives a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy different types of fish and remodel her establishment.

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en: Fidele is 27 years old. He is married with 1 child, who does not yet go to school. He has operated a selling shop for 6 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more items such as books, pens, soaps and basins for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more items such as books, pens, soaps and basins for sale.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine is 29 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 3 and 6. Both of them go to school. She has operated a selling shop for 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as spoons, plates, sugar and salt. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more items such as spoons, plates, sugar and salt.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal El triunfo está conformada por nueve integrantes siete mujeres  y dos hombres, padres y madres responsables, con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Estas personas son responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal, que luchan día día para sacar a sus familias adelantes y brindarles oportunidades que ellos no pudieron tener, por falta de recursos económicos. 
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Miriam y tiene por actividad económica la venta de pan de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos como: pan simple, picos, cachos, semitas, torta de pinas, pasteles, dedos, sopa de leche.  La rutina de esta mujer es levantarse todos los días  a ofrecer su producto con un canasto en la cabeza de unos 25 kg. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, ya que ha sido el medio de subsistencia de sus hijos.  El triunfo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The communal bank "El Triunfo" is comprised by nine members: seven women and two men. They are responsible fathers and mothers with ten children under their care. They are from Malpasillo, a place located in the Northern part of the region. They are responsible, hardworking people, who wish to excel, and who struggle day by day to move their families ahead and provide them with the opportunities they were not able to have due to lack of financial resources.  Thanks to her efforts and desire to succeed, Miriam is the coordinator and her business is selling bread as a street vendor and in her house. She works some eight hours a day offering products such as: bread, Nicaraguan pastries (picos, cachos, semitas), pineapple cake, cakes, ladyfingers, pudding. Her routine is to get up every day to offer her product with a 25 kilo basket over her head. She works happily doing this since it has been her children's subsistence. "El Triunfo" is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors give to poor people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have the means for decent work.

loans.use: to buy food products such as: bread, Nicaraguan pastries (picos, cachos, semitas), pineapple cake, cakes, ladyfingers, pudding.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is married and has six adult children. She is from Iloilo, Philippines. Tessie operates a fishing business with her husband, which they have been doing for more than 20 years. Unfortunately, a super typhoon hit the country and ravaged some several places including Tessie's hometown.  Their fishing boat was ruined during the typhoon.

Tessie requested for a loan, which she will use to buy fishing gear such as fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and a boat engine. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Tessie hopes to improve their fishing business and make it more productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear such as fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and a boat engine

loans.name: Colette

texts.en: Colette,   aged 47 years, is married with five children, aged between 11 and 27, and all of them go to school. She has been selling bananas for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Habibakhon

texts.ru: Хабибахон кредитуется в ИМОНе первый раз. Она родилась в 1973 году. Она имеет высшее педагогическое образование и работает в средней школе более чем 25 лет. Она очень любит свою профессию и имеет большой опыт в сфере преподавания. Она имеет 2 детей. Ее сын получил высшее образование и работает. В этом году ее дочь окончила среднюю школу и поступила в университет. Теперь Хабибахон должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для оплаты учебы дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту.
