texts.en: This is the first time Habibakhon has used IMON to ask for a loan.  She was born in 1973, has a degree in education, and has been working as a schoolteacher for more than 25 years.  She really loves her job, and is quite experienced at it.  She is also the mother of two children, a son and a daughter; her son has a college education and is currently working, while her daughter finished secondary school this past year and has started college herself.  Habibakhon needs to pay for her daughter's tuition, and is seeking a loan of $1000 USD to do so.  She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: pay for her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda es una mujer de 49 años de edad, viuda, tiene cinco hijos tres en edad escolar, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, fuerte, amable, comprometida con su trabajo, buena madre, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad de Huarina que es un pueblo histórico y descendiente de los URUS. Los habitantes aymaras de esa época se ocupaban de la caza y pesca, eran aguerridos y rebeldes, esta localidad sufrió grandes transformaciones, por la llegada de los españoles, que se instalaron en este ayllu y fueron cambiando todas sus tradiciones y su forma de vivir. Huarina también fue la cuna del gran Mariscal Andres de Santa Cruz. Actualmente es un pueblo turístico ubicado a las orillas del lago Titicaca, y continua siendo un lugar de pesca y agricultura de sus comunarios.
Amanda es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es típica (manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el aymará y utiliza el español para el comercio con los turistas. Su negocio es la venta de comida elaborada a base de pescado, ella cocina con leña sobre piedras, forma que le da un sabor especial a sus platos. Su comida diaria se llama ‘Wallake’ que es un plato típico de la región, Huarina se caracteriza por la preparación de este plato ya que tiene componentes revitalizantes con muchos nutrientes que fortifican y contribuyen a la energía para el cuerpo humano.
Ella sueña mejorar su calidad de vida obteniendo mejores ingresos económicos para  su familia y realizando la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor como; papa, chuño, ispi (pescado seco), etc.
Es por esos motivos que Amanda solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Amanda is a 49-year-old woman. She is a widow and has five children that go to school. She works selling food. Amanda is an enterprising, hardworking, kind, strong and responsible woman committed to her work. She is also a good mother. She works in Huarina, a historical town where the Uru people lived. Long ago, the Aymara people living there fished and hunted, and were fierce and rebellious. This town underwent enormous changes when the Spaniards came and established themselves in this “ayllu” [the traditional form of a community in the Andes]. They influenced their traditions and their way of living. The great marshal Andrés de Santa Cruz was born in Huarina. The town, located by the Titicaca Lake, is today popular with tourists. It continues to be a place where locals fish and grow different crops.

Amanda is dark-skinned and has long and black braided hair. She wears traditional clothes (a type of shawl and a long skirt called “pollera”) and her mother tongue is Aymara (although she speaks Spanish when selling to tourists). She sells food made with fish. She uses stones and firewood to cook, which give her food a special taste. She prepares “Wallake” every day, which is a typical dish from Huarina. It has ingredients that are full of energy, and revitalize and nurture the human body.

Her dream is to improve her living conditions by increasing her income. For this, she needs to buy ingredients in bulk, such as potatoes, chuño [a freeze-dried potato product] and ispi (dried fish). This is why she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk to prepare food.

loans.name: Louie

texts.en:
Louie is a single man who earns a living by fishing. He lives with his parents and helps them in their fishing business.  He learned fishing from his father. It is their only way to earn an income and he has to sustain it for their living. 

He joined GDMPC and has borrowed a loan to buy fishing nets. In the future, he wants to own a fishing boat to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en:
Daphrose, 53, is married with 4 children between the ages of 12 and 27, all of whom go to school. She has been running a shop for 14 years. 

With this loan, she would like to buy more items such as biscuits, cakes, sugar, rice and salt. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more items such as biscuits, cakes, sugar, rice and salt.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
La socia Mary pertenece al banco comunal LOS ANGELES, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 49 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pescados y pollos, la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder  seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos y pescados.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidos.
texts.en:
Mary is a partner in the Los Angeles village bank, located in the department of Cusco. 
Mary is 49 years old, has three children and is married. She alternates her daily activities with her business, selling fish and chicken. Mary sells at one of the markets in the city of Cusco and she has ran this business successfully for a good amount of time thanks to the hard work that she puts in every day. Mary would like to continue working this way in order to continue supporting the family. 
She is requesting a loan to purchase chickens and fish. She is very thankful for the loan and she is committed to meeting the established payment installments.

loans.use: purchase chickens and fish.

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidel, 54, is married with 10 children between the ages of 6 and 33, 7 of whom go to school. He has been running a shop for 25 years. 

With this loan, he would like to buy items, such as soaps, rice, cooking oil, and books, to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy items such as soaps, rice, cooking oil, and books.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a hardworking woman. Mariam is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Mariam has been working hard to manage her farm, which grows mushrooms. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase mushroom seeds to plant, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and add capital to the business. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the business. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: purchase mushroom seeds to plant

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS ANGELES, este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Sebastián  continua con su negocio de venta de anticuchos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez continua con su negocio de venta de frutas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, aceite, carbón entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to Los Angeles Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco. Sebastiana is still running her business selling kebabs, which she has been doing for a long time. The business is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. At the same time, she still has her business selling fruit. She wants to continue working so that she can support her family. 
She is requesting a loan to buy meat, oil, charcoal, etc. 
Sebastiana is grateful for the the loan and agrees to make all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy meat, oil, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a hardworking woman. Esther is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 3 years, Esther has been working hard to manage her food stall business, which sells food items. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bananas, Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and improve on the business. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to boost the business. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy bananas, Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Ana Gina

texts.en:
Ana Gina lives  with her family and has run a general store  for six years.  Her  business does well and she  meets her daily needs with her earnings. 

She  successfully repaid her previous loan which was used to buy goods to sell. She wants to increase her inventory and increase sales. She will use a new loan recently to buy more groceries.

In the future, Ana Gina wants to live in a comfortable home with her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, tiene como actividad económica el transporte de personas en su vehículo, sus recorridos los realiza por varios caseríos para llevar a sus clientes a la cuidad, lo realiza todos los días, ya tiene varios clientes que prefieren sus servicios; don Francisco está acompañado, en su hogar a procreado tres hijos, de los cuales dos están estudiando.
Comprará llantas, pastillas para frenos, dará mantenimiento al motor, etc., tendrá todos los repuestos necesarios para tener en óptimas condiciones se vehículo y brindar un buen servicio, también le ayudara a atraer nuevos clientes y aumentar la rentabilidad de su negocio.
Sus aspiraciones son cancelar sus deudas, adquirir un bus para tener un negocio más competitivo y generar ingresos con los que su situación económica sea mucho más favorable.
texts.en:
Francisco's business activity is the transportation of people in his vehicle. His routes take him through several neighborhoods in order to take his clients into the city. He runs these routes daily and already has several clients who prefer his services.
Mr. Francisco is accompanied, he has three children, two of who are studying. 
He will purchase tires, brake pads, maintenance for his engine, etc. He will have the necessary spare parts to keep his vehicle in optimal condition and be able to provide a good service. This will also help him attract new clients and increase the profitability of his business.
He aspires to pay off his debts, acquire a bus to have a more competitive business and generate incomes that will make his economic situation much more favorable.

loans.use: purchase tires, brake pads, maintenance for his engine, etc. He will have all the necessary spare parts to keep his vehicle in optimal condition.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en: Penina is 62 years old. She is married with 3 children, ages between 18 and 30, and all of them go to school. Penina has been selling foodstuffs for 6 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and cabbages. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is 25 years old. She is married with one child, who is going to school. She has been selling from a shop. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, salt and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
He is married and a father of four children. They both live in a two bedroom house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many challenges in life; a few to mention are financial difficulties, sickness and death of family members and loved ones. 

With this new loan requested, he will buy and replace his old tools with new ones and will also buy materials like planks and nails for the production of his products such as chairs, tables, beds, and doors for construction. He believes so much in the success of his business because he has been doing it for the past three years, it is located at the center of the town, and lastly because he is a trained carpenter. The community will benefit from his moderate pricing, his goodwill and he will also provide furniture for their houses.

The profit made from this loan will ensure his children's education and medication and extend his house both for his family use and rental. He prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy planks, nails, working tools, and paint

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 22-year-old hard working single woman who lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has one child who attends school. For the past 3 years, Rose has worked hard to manage her food stall business. 

Rose requests 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to buy bananas, irish potatoes, and sweet potatoes. Rose will be able to generate greater profits and provide for the child. Rose hopes to expand her business. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy bananas, irish potatoes, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Mujiza

texts.ru: Мучиза родилась в 1976 году. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Мучиза всегда заботится об образовании своих детей. Ее муж тоже трудолюбивый человек. Он работает в заводе по разработки химических элементов. Мучиза работает бухгалтером в ИМОНе. Она является одной из активных работников. Ее дочь учится на 7 классе в платной школе. Она хочет, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование и всегда стремиться к этому. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своего ребенка и поэтому она запрашивает займ. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mujiza was born in 1976, is married, and has four children.  She works as an accountant with IMON, and is very energetic and enthusiastic at work.  Her husband is also hardworking, and works in a processing plant for chemical elements.  Mujiza worries a lot about her children's education, and hopes they'll strive to do well in school and eventually go to college.  She has a daughter in her 7th year at a private school, and needs to pay for her tuition.  She is seeking a loan to do so, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La socia Tomasa pertenece al banco comunal LOS ANGELES, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia  alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cevicheria,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder  seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pescado, limón entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidos.
texts.en:
Tomasa belongs to the Los Angeles communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco department.

She alternates her daily activities with the ceviche business.  She has been in the business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  She wishes to be able to continue working, and to continue supporting her family in this way.

She is requesting a loan to buy seafood and limes, among others.

She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her established payments.

loans.use: to buy seafood and limes, among others.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 24-year-old hard working single woman. She lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. 

Maria has worked hard to manage her restaurant for 3 years. 

Maria requests 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to purchase food items for the business.  This will help Maria to generate greater profits and improve  the business. Maria hopes to expand the restaurant's capacity. 

Maria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase food items for the business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 46 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 5 children. She has a retail shop in Tala town. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of goods to sell. This includes rice, cooking flour, sugar and detergents. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of her family.

This is Sabina's fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and become a successful business lady.

loans.use: To add stock of goods to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 31-year-old woman married to Gerald, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children. Janet has been operating a grocery stall business that has been in operation for eight years, earning her an income of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) at the end of every month.

Janet was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES. 50,000. She intends to buy additional bananas, avocados, watermelon and mangoes to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Janet plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and be able to further their education to higher levels. She hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of bananas, avocados and watermelon to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Joeralyn

texts.en:
Joeralyn is a businesswoman from Oroquieta. She is 37 years old and has the expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari (variety) store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. She continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 23-year-old hardworking single man who has operated a motorcycle transportation business for five years.  He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

Joseph was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and requests his first loan of 30,000 KES to repair his motorcycle which has mechanical problems.

Joseph plans to use the anticipated income to buy his own plot of land and build rental houses. He hopes to become a successful business man.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Nena works hard to support her family.

She has a passenger boat business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nena is borrowing 45,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy an additional passenger boat for her transportation business.

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional passenger boat.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en: Clarisse is aged 35 years. She is married with four children aged between 3 and 13; three of them go to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more tomatoes and other vegetables for selling. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for selling

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has one child who attends school. She owns a house without electricity and running water. 

She operates an open air food business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major business challenge of changing weather conditions.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

She will use 50,000 KES to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is a hard working woman. She is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 2 years, Teddy has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells soft drinks and spirits. 

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy soft drinks, beer and spirits for the bar, which will help Teddy to generate greater profits and provide for her siblings. Teddy hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a saloon business. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy soft drinks, beer and spirits for her bar.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Augusta; la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia continua vendiendo arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para sus clientes que le solictan, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, leche entre otros.
texts.en: The partner is Mrs. Augusta, she continues her grocery store business. She continues to sell rice, sugar and milk among other things that her clients request. She feels thankful for the loan granted and is committed to meeting the established payment installments. She wishes to keep working in order to keep supporting her family. She requests the loan to purchase sugar and milk among other things.

loans.use: purchase sugar and milk among other things.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Thou is a 27-year-old married man with a child.  He has been a farmer but has worked as a broom vendor since 2007. His 28-year-old wife is  a garment-factory worker. They live in Takeo Province, Cambodia and earn approximately $12 per day. 

Thou requests a loan to buy brooms to sell. This loan will help him earn more income. 

In the future, he wants his wife to sell groceries, vegetables, and meat from home.  He plans to build fences around the house and support his child's education through the university level.

loans.use: to buy brooms.

loans.name: Gjyste

texts.en:
A loan of 200,000 ALL will help Gjyste to pay her farmers’ pension contribution.

She is a widowed mother of three who lives with her daughter-in-law and grandson in a coastal village that is being developed.
 
Gjyste has two dairy cows that produce 18 kg/day raw milk each and she sells about 30 kg/day during the production time.   She also sells baby calves. In addition to the livestock, she owns 30 dynym (1 dynym is a thousand square meters) to plant and sell fodder and seasonal veggies. 

Her son works in Greece and helps her financially.

loans.use: to pay for the farmers' pension contribution.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman and owns a house that has piped water but not electricity.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Mary has operated a tailoring business for the past 4 years. She makes  suits for men and women.  She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

She will use 30,000 KES to purchase fabric and thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is a businessman from Tangub City. He is a married and has one child. He and his wife run a little sari-sari (variety) store and earn a meager income that sufficiently supports the family. 

Vicente is a one year and eight months member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. He maintains his membership in good standing without records of default. Now, he applied for a loan to purchase items for his sari-sari store business.  

Vicente continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that he has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for his family.

loans.use: to purchase items for his sari-sari store.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Patricia operates a vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como vendedora de refacciones en la escuela de su comunidad.  Era lo que ella esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. De 37 años de edad mujer emprendedora y decidida a enfrentar la realidad de la vida, ella cuenta con tres hijos por los cuales ella tiene realizar un esfuerzo enorme para poder mantener  a su familia. Los hijos de Magdalena son buenos estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de la comunidad.

La actividad productiva que Magdalena es realiza la venta de refacciones y comida, ella decidió realizar esta actividad porque es rentable y hay pocas personas que realizan esta actividad en su comunidad, ella viene realizando dicha actividad desde hace ocho años y le ha dejado muy buena ganancia para el sostenimiento de su familia.

El uso respectivo que ella dará al crédito gestionado es para la compra de insumos para la venta de refacciones tales como: Platos, vasos, pollo, panes y maíz, ya que para ella es de mucha importancia para poder desempeñar su actividad de cada día ya que es el medio en la que ella puede tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia. 
Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es ahorrar para un futuro construir casas para sus hijos  para que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada y dar estudio a sus hijos y que ellos se convierten en profesionales.
texts.en:
Life gave Magdalena a chance to work selling snacks in the community school. It was what she hoped for, not only the open door but what was behind the door. What she found was what defines what she wanted to be. At 37 years old this enterprising woman decided to face the realities of her life. She had three children which involved an enormous effort to be able support her family. Magdalena's children are good students at the school that is close to their community.

The business that Magdalena does is selling snacks and meals. She decided to do this as it was profitable and there were few people who did this in her community. She has been doing this for 8 years and it has provided her with very good revenues to support her family. She will use the loan to buy supplies to make snacks like plates, glasses, chicken, bread and corn.

It is very important for her to be able to carry out her business each day as through it she can have economic revenue for the benefit of her family. One of her dreams is to save for the future to build houses for her children so that they have adequate living conditions and to provide education for her children so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for snacks.

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Las Violetas” está constituida por 06 socios emprendedores y responsables. Teresa tiene 48 años, separada con 03 hijos 02 de ellos aún dependientes. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a la venta de golosinas, la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente. Gracias a su esfuerzo puede solventar los gastos del hogar. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, la cual comprará golosinas como chicles, caramelos, chupetines y gaseosas. Se siente feliz por darle educacion a sus menore hijos. El grupo “Las Violetas” está agradecido con el crédito brindado, pues hace posible su progreso. Teresa se encuentra sentada es la segunda del lado derecho, viste casaca marron.
texts.en: The “Las Violetas” communal bank is made up of 6 responsible and enterprising members.  Teresa is 48 years old, separated and has 3 children, two of whom are still dependent on her. For more than 12 years she has been selling sweets itinerantly. Thanks to her efforts she has been able to pay the household expenses. That is why she is requesting a loan to continue to invest in her business. She will buy sweets like Chiclets, caramels, lollypops and soft drinks. She feels content to provide education for her younger children. The “Las Violetas” group is grateful for the loan as it allows them to progress. Teresa is seated second to the right wearing the brown sweater.

loans.use: to buy sweets like Chiclets, caramels, lollipops and soft drinks.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is married and has two children. Natividad is 64 years old and lives in Colupan Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Natividad is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. 

She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her corn plantation.

Natividad has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Natividad hopes to expand her corn plantation and to sustain her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her corn plantation.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
El deseo de superación ha llevado a Cristobal de 40 años de edad soltero a aprender algunos actividades para el beneficio de su familia, el realiza una gran lucha por sus hijos para poder darles una condición de vida adecuada, el cuenta con tres hijos de 14, 10 y de 7 años y son estudiantes de la escuela de la comunidad donde ellos viven.
La actividad que el realiza con tanto empeño es de seguridad en una empresa privada en la comunidad donde el vive, Cristobal lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 8 años y es por medio de ello el puede tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, la segunda actividad que el realiza es la venta de papas fritas y la venta de granizadas para así tener un ingreso extra para el beneficio de su familia.
El uso respectivo que el dará al préstamo es para la compra de terreno ya que el tanto a soñado con comprar terreno para poder dejar un buen recuerdo para sus hijos en un futuro. Las aspiraciones de Cristobal es ver que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales en la vida y construir casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada y la compra de un local en el centro de su comunidad para así tener mejores ventas.
texts.en:
The desire for improvement has brought Cristobal, who is a single, 40-year-old man, to learn some activities for the benefit of his family. He has fought for his children to be able to give them a good life. He has three children who are 14, 10, and 7 years old and are students in the community where they live.

The work he does with a lot of determination is providing security services in a private business in the community where he lives. Cristobal has been doing this work for 8 years and because of it, he can have an income to improve the conditions of his family’s life. The second job he has is to sell fried potatoes and to sell iced drinks so that he has extra income for the well-being of his family.

The use of this loan is to buy land since he has always dreamed of buying land to be able to leave a good heirloom for his children in the future. Cristobal’s aspirations are to see his children become professionals, to build houses for his children so that they can have a good quality of life, and to buy a location in the center of his community so that he can have better sales.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn earns a living through her sari-sari store. She requested a loan from Paglaum MPC for 40,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase housing materials. Evelyn joined Paglaum MPC in 2007 and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. She dreams of having a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to pay for housing materials

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina, mantiene su negocio funcionando con ayuda de créditos, ha logrado tener surtido de pollo, lácteos y embutidos frescos su inventario, satisfaciendo así a sus clientes, con lo que ha generado los ingresos necesarios para progresar económicamente y cambiar las circunstancias familiares.
 Reina opta por un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de lácteos, pollo, salchichas, jamón, chorizo, etc., seguirá ofreciendo productos de calidad a sus clientes, de esta manera su negocio seguirá siendo uno de los más competitivos en el mercado.
texts.en: Reina keeps her business running with the help of loans. She has managed to stock chicken, dairy products and fresh cold cuts in her inventory to satisfy her customers. She has generated the necessary revenues with this to progress economically and change the circumstances of her family. Reina has decided to request another loan to invest in the purchase of dairy products, chicken, sausages, ham, chorizo etc. to continue to offer her customers quality products. In this way her business will continue to be one of the most competitive in the market.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, chickens, sausages, ham, chorizo, etc.

loans.name: Vecinos Unidos Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal  Vecinos Unidos está conformado por diez integrantes nueve mujeres y un hombre, son originarios de  Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemetente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar, en la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Juana tiene por actividad económica la elaboración y venta de tortillas. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. La rutina de esta mujer es levantarse todos los días muy temprano desde la 4: am para preparar las nixqueza y moler y elaborar las tortillas y posterior el producto final. El negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio  con la compra de materia prima como un quintal de maíz, leña, gas, bolsas, cal. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Vecinos Unidos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The group Vecinos Unidos (United Neighbors) is made up of 10 members, including nine women and one man. They are from Malpaisillo, a place located in the northern part of the region. They are hard working, responsible, and have desires for personal improvement. Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources, they weren’t able to study. Now, they fight day after day to offer a better future to their children.

Thanks to her desire to go forward, the coordinator Juana makes and sells tortillas. Her business is located in her home. Her routine includes waking up very early at 4:00am every morning to prepare the dough and to grind and prepare the tortillas and the final product. She works for 10 hours daily offering her products. The loan will be invested in capital for the business and to supply the business by buying raw materials such as 100 pounds of corn, firewood, gas, bags, and limes so that in the near future, she can earn more income. Vecinos Unidos is thankful for the help that Kiva lenders offers to people with limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can do dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in raw material to make tortillas, including 100 pounds of corn, firewood, gas, bags, and limes.

loans.name: Ma. Salud

texts.en:
Ma. Salud is 43 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband  is a welder. She operates a sari-sari store located in a populous neighborhood so she is able to make promising daily sales. Ma. Salud runs her store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. 

Ma. Salud requested a loan from Paglaum MPC for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to expand her store's inventory resulting in additional income. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store so she can provide her children with a good education. Ma. Salud believes that with PMPC's support she will be able to beat her competition.

loans.use: to purchase sari-sari store items

loans.name: Las Ovejas De Cristo Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal las ovejas de Cristo está conformada por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un hombre, personas con familia e hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de  Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar, pero q  necesitan sacar a sus hijos adelante y brindarles un futuro mejor.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Reyna y tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva variada como: pantalón jeans, faldas, shores, camisas, camisolas, blusas, ropa de niño, ropa interior, toallas.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias, actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante visitando clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio y aprovecha las ventas ya que se acercan las fiestas patricias y la demanda aumenta. Para que en un futuro no  muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Las Ovejas de Cristo agradecen la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Ovejas de Cristo" communal bank is made up of 8 members, seven woman and one man. They are people with families and children under their responsibilities. They are natives of Malpaisillo which is located in the north of the country. They are hard-working, responsible people who want to get ahead. Unfortunately they could not study but they need to get their children ahead and offer them a better future.

Thanks to her desire to progress Reyna is their coordinator. Her business is selling a variety of new clothing like jeans, skirts, shorts, shirts, jerseys, blouses, children's clothing, underwear and towels. She works at her business 8 hours each day which she does from her house and in the streets visiting regular clients and others. The objective for the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business and take advantage of the coming patriotic festivals with their heightened demand. In the near future she hopes to make more income.

The "Ovejas de Cristo" communal bank is grateful for the support that the lenders at Kiva provide for people of humble resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have dignified employment.

loans.use: to buy new clothing such as jeans, skirts, shorts, shirts, jerseys, blouses, children's clothing, underwear and towels.

loans.name: G.s Esfuerzo Para El Futuro Group

texts.es: Ana, tiene 23 años de edad, esta soltera, no tiene hijos, vive con su padre y dos hermanas en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá. Lleva 6 años de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz, frijoles y papas, esta actividad la realiza en un terreno agrícola de la zona y la producción que saca la vende en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicita en forma grupal es por 25,000 lempiras para darle asistencia y siembra de cinco áreas más de papas. Su idea es ampliar el cultivo y brindar buena asistencia para mejorar la producción y los ingresos.  El grupo se llama Esfuerzo para el futuro, integrado por cinco miembros, viven en la misma zona y se dedican al cultivo de granos básicos y papas. El  préstamo grupal es por 125,000 lempiras,  que lo invertirán en asistencia y siembra del cultivo de papas, para  ampliar el nivel de producción y mejorar los ingresos. en la foto están de pie Rigoberto y Juan a la derecha y sentados esta María Santos, María Cecilia y Ana a la derecha.
texts.en: Ana is 23 years old, is single, doesn’t have children, and lives with her father and two sisters in a village in the municipality of Intibucá. For 6 years, she has grown corn, beans, and potatoes. She does this work on the agricultural land in the area, and she takes the products to sell in the local market. The loan she requests through her group is for 25,000 lempiras to give her assistance and to sow five more areas with potatoes. Her idea is to grow her crop and to offer good assistance to improve the production and income. The group is called Esfuerzo Para El Future (Strength for the Future) and is made up of 5 members. They live in the same area and all grow basic grains and potatoes. The group loan is for 125,000 lempiras, which they will invest in assistance and sowing potatoes for their crops to produce more and improve their income. In the photo, the men standing are Rigoberto and Juan (at the right), and the women sitting are María Santos, María Cecilia, and Ana (at the right).

loans.use: to invest in assistance and sowing of five more areas with potatoes.

loans.name: Memia

texts.en:
Memia is 54 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 dependents who are now adults. 

For her living, Memia is engaged in managing a little food stall in one of the universities in the town of Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She’s been doing this business for 14 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan to be used in the financial support of her son’s wedding and the remaining amount for additional capital for her existing food vending business.

Memia has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, Memia hopes to expand her food stall business.

loans.use: to be used in the financial support of her son’s wedding.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa is widowed and has four children. She is 79 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin, Philippines.

Nicolasa is a farmer, and grows banana crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to buy farming tools and equipment used for cleaning the banana plantation.

Nicolasa has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Nicolasa hopes to save more and to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy farming tools and equipment.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hard-working woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso, in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Grace has been working hard to manage her shoe business, selling shoes.

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more pairs of shoes, and will help Grace to generate greater profits and add capital to the business. Grace hopes that in the future, she will be able to build a house.

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement. sand, gravel and bricks to construct steps at the entrance of her house.

loans.name: Sotero

texts.en:
Sotero is 66 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in Mialen Clarin, Philippines. Sotero is a farmer growing bananas, which he has been doing for 10 years. 

Sotero requested a loan from PMPC, which he will use to provide additional capital for his banana plantation business. In the future, he hopes to save more for consumption.

loans.use: to provide additional capital for his banana plantation business

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo  “Las Azucenas”  la cual está conformada por 07 mujeres responsables y dinamicas en el trabajo. Este es el caso de Vilma de 53 años de edad separada con 01 hijo independiente. Hace más de 02 meses que Vilma se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Asi mismo como actividad secundaria presta servicio de mototaxi lo cual le es un ingreso extra para su hogar. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio de prendas de vestir para niños. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de camisas, blusas, polos y pantalones. Los integrantes del grupo “Las Azucenas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Vilma se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste casaca negro.
texts.en:
This is the Laz Azucenas group, which is made up of seven dynamic and responsible working members. This is the story of Vilma, 53 years old. She's separated, with one independent son. 

For more than two months, Vilma has earned a living selling garments to wear. Currently, as a second activity, she offers mototaxi services, which is an extra income for her household.

Her gretest desire is to expand her business to clothing for children. She's seeking a loan to buy shirts, blouses, polos and pants. 

The members of the Laz Azucenas group thank Kiva lenders for their support. Vilma can be seen sitting - she's the first one on the left, wearing a black coat.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, polos and pants.

loans.name: Henrry Gustavo

texts.es:
Henrry es un hombre  de 41 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene una hija de 23 años y un hijo de 16 años, y su negocio es la confección de zapatos de cholita.
Él es emprendedor, decidido, constante, luchador, fuerte, aguerrido, amable, paciente, innovador, un poco artista, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona de villa Fátima un lugar caracterizado por la paradas de buses con dirección hacia los yungas de La Paz.
Henrry es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el aymara el cual utiliza muy poco, mayormente habla español para ocuparse del comercio. Su negocio es la confección de zapatos de cholita. La moda de estas mujeres no está marcada por las estaciones climáticas, pero imponen nuevos estilos en fiestas y festividades, como son las del Gran Poder o el 16 de Julio, entre otras. Si de variedad se habla, los calzados para chola ganan de lejos a cualquier otra prenda que usa la mujer paceña de pollera. La habilidad de Henrry hace que cualquier sueño se haga realidad, él tiene la habilidad de confeccionar con todo tipo de material (cuero, tela o gaza) en fin, lo que la mujer guste lucir en su calzado para combinar con cualquiera de sus prendas, pollera o manta, o el sombrero. La tendencia de los calados aún persiste, Las puntas con boca de pez y los calados en el talón todavía está en la preferencia. Una variante de este año son las argollas sobre la boca de pez, así como los trenzados, los calzados con terraplenes son confeccionados a pedido del cliente.
El sueña tener su tienda propia donde poder exponer sus zapatos a la venta y su negocio necesita realizar la compra de materiales de trabajo.
Es por esos motivos que Henrry solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de trabajo para la confección de zapatos de cholita.
texts.en:
Henrry is a 41 year old man who lives with his partner. He has a 23 year old daughter and a 16 year old son, and his business is making traditional women's shoes.

He is entrepreneurial, determined, constant, tenacious, strong, courageous, kind, patient, innovative, a little artistic, responsible and hardworking. His work is done in the area of Villa Fatima a place characterized by the bus stops heading towards the Yungas Road of La Paz.

Henrry is of dark complexion, medium hight, and has short black hair. His native language is Aymara, which he uses very little. Mostly, he speaks Spanish to engage in trade.

His business is making traditional women's shoes. These women's fashion is not dictated by the seasons, but they put on new styles for parties and festivals, such as the Great Power or the 16th of July, among others. If one speaks of variety, the shoes far outstrip any other garment the traditional skirt-wearing La Paz woman uses.

Henrry's ability makes any dream come true. He has the ability to make any type of material (leather, cloth or gauze) into a finished product - what the woman likes to wear to combine with any of her clothes, skirts or blankets, or hat. 

Still-popular styles of shoe are open-toed points and heels, which are still preferred. One style from this year are open-toed shoes with rings over the opening. Wedge heeled shoes are made by request of the customer.

He dreams of having his own store where he can make his shoes for sale. His business needs to buy work materials. Because of these goals, Henrry seeks a loan to buy work materials to make traditional women's shoes.

loans.use: to buy work material to make traditional women's shoes.

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.en:
Anne Marie is 51 years old, married, and has nine children, who attend school. She operates a general store, which she has been doing for five years. 

Anne Marie requested a loan, which she will use to buy more items such as books, cooking oil, biscuits, and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase items such as books, cooking oil, biscuits, and sugar

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 64 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has two children, who are now at their adult age. Lilia has been earning a living from her snack-vending business for more than 30 years, already. She earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month, doing this business activity.

She has requested a loan, which she will use for purchasing a greater variety of snacks and other food products, for retail sale. Lilia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of snacks and other foods

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agness is single with two children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a beauty salon. She has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy braids, weaves, hair relaxers and treatments. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include power shortages. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to the university level. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy braids, weaves, hair relaxers and treatments

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
Dila, who is a villager from rural northern Albania, is requesting a loan in the amount of 200,000 Albanian Lek to repair her home's windows and install tile flooring in one of the children’s rooms. The winter is coming soon and she must do these things beforehand.

Dila’s main activity from which she earns an income is agriculture/livestock; she’s got a milk cow, a milk goat and a baby goat at the moment; she sells raw milk and baby calves. As far as agriculture goes, she plants seasonal veggies and sells them at the local farmer’s market on Sundays every week. Her husband, who had a paid job up until recently, was laid off; one daughter is working as a journalist at a local TV station; and her son, who completed a public university and could not find a job in his field, works as a waiter in a city in southern Albania where he finished his studies  He helps  financially as well, just like his journalist sister.

loans.use: to repair damaged windows and install tile flooring in her home

loans.name: Grupo Las Recomendadas De Pacamache Group

texts.es:
De 31 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida, ella tiene cuatro hijos los primeros dos hijos ya tienen familias apartes y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad, (Catarina es la que se encuentra de 1ra de derecha a izquierda de la fotografía)	
El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de cortes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 10 años, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de verduras negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de cinco años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.
Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Catarina para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.
El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería de trajes típicas para luego venderlas por los alrededores de su comunidad. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Catarina is 31 years old and has great aspirations of showing the community and everyone who visits it about the work that she does with such effort and dedication. She is married and lives with her husband. She dreams of improving her life and achieving the goals that she has in life. She has four children and the oldest two now have their own families. The youngest two are excellent students at their school in the community.

Catarina is the first one on the right in the photograph.

The work that she does with such great effort involves purchasing and selling traditional clothing. She does this in her home and in areas near the community where she lives. She has been working in this business for 10 years. She also sells vegetables, which she has done with her sister for more than 5 years because it generates income for their families and helps them improve the financial conditions of their families and of the community.

She has been an example for her community and it is because of her than a group of women have joined together with Caterina to launch businesses so that each of them can improve themselves and have important income.

She will use the loan to purchase merchandise for traditional clothing to sell near her community. One of her goals is to have a store in the community market and to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for traditional clothing.

loans.name: Persis

texts.en:
Persis is a hard-working woman. She is 22 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 2 years, Persis has been working hard to manage her stationery shop, which sells stationery items. 

To help expand her business, Persis has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy books, pens, files, pencils, and papers, and will help Persis to generate greater profits and attain more capital. Persis hopes that in the future she will be able to earn more profits. 

Persis is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy books, pens, files, pencils, and papers

loans.name: Llapanchis Tticarisunchis Group

texts.es:
El grupo pertenece al banco comunal “LLapanchis TTicarisunchis” en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco.

La socia Pascuala tiene 46 años de edad tiene una 4 hijos y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de anticuchos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez vende fruta de forma ambultoria, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, carbón entre otros.

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 
La foto fue tomada en dos grupos por la cantidad de socios que conforman este banco comunal.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, farmacia, panadería venta de ropa.
texts.en:
The group belongs to the Llapanchis Tticarisunchis communal bank in the Cusco province of the Cusco department.

The member Pascuala is 46 years old. She has four children and is separates. The member alternates her daily activities with the business of selling kebabs. 

She has a good time with her business, which is going well thanks to the commitment she puts into her business every day. At the same time, the member travels selling fruit. The members wishes to be able to continue working so she can support her family.

The member seeks the loan to buy oil and coal, among others.

The members in general are grateful for the opportunity provided and promise to comply with the payment of their different quotas on the established deadlines. 

The photo was taken in two groups due to the number of members in this communal bank. The other members earn a living through a grocery store, pharmacy, a bread store, and the sale of clothing.

loans.use: to buy oil and coal, among others.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 69 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and raised five dependents, who are now at their adult age.

For her source of living, Merlita is engaged in managing a single-sitter motorcycle for hire. She’s been doing this business for 10 years, already. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month, doing this business activity. She has requested a loan, which she will use to purchase spare parts for motorcycle repair, like tubes, tires, chains, sprockets and paints.

Merlita has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, she hopes to purchase an additional, single-sitter motorcycle for hire.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle repair, like tubes, tires, and chains

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela de 54 años de edad es una mujer que vive con su esposo en vivienda humilde pero propia, por lo que se siente muy contenta. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que presta sus servicios domésticos de manera domiciliar desde hace 13 años, lo que le permite apoyar a su esposo en los gastos económicos del hogar, él se desempeña como comerciante de productos plásticos. Ángela desea construir 6 bases de cemento en su vivienda, ya que esta es de bajareque y se encuentra deteriorada como se observa en la fotografía, y es por ello que Ángela teme que siga deteriorándose y en cualquier momento pueda caer. Por lo anterior ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir 6 bases de cemento en su vivienda.
texts.en: Ángela is 54 years old and lives with her husband in a humble house. The couple owns the house, however, and Ángela is very happy. Ángela is an enterprising woman who has worked as a domestic servant for 13 years. This has allowed her to support her husband with household costs. Ángela's husband is a businessman who sells plastic goods. Ángela wants to build six cement walls in her home as the current walls are made with mud and are deteriorated, as can be seen in the photo. Ángela fears that the walls will continue to deteriorate and may fall. Ángela is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel and iron bars in order to build six cement walls at her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel and iron bars in order to build six cement walls at her home.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a restaurant business. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days a week. Justine sells her products from the market, by means of retail. She generates additional income by selling piped water.

Justine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use it to buy crates of soda, milk, donuts, and cakes. The main business challenges include thieves and seasonality. Her business goals and aspirations include building rental houses.

Justine lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, fees, and electricity.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda, milk, donuts, and cakes

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es: María de 57 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos de 35, 27 y 22 años de edad. Ella es una mujer humilde pero muy trabajadora que todos los días sale a ganarse la vida, vendiendo sus productos como: chocolate, tamales de gallina y elote, y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sostener su hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos que ya son mayores de edad y la apoyan con la economía del hogar. María utiliza su cocina para elaborar los productos que vende además la utiliza para el uso de su vivienda, es por ello que es tan importante para ella construir un cuarto para la cocina, ya que como se puede observar en la fotografía esta es de lamina y se encuentra bastante deteriorada, pero al no contar con el presupuesto necesario se ha acercado a FUSAI para solicitar un crédito para comprar: cemento, arena, grava y ladrillos para construir un cuarto para la cocina en su vivienda
texts.en:
Maria, 57 years old, lives in a home with her three children, ages 35, 27, and 22.  She is a humble but hard-working woman who goes out every day to earn a living, selling products such as chocolates and chicken and corn tamales.  Thanks to this work, Maria has been able to support her household and help her children get ahead now that they are older and support her with home finances.  

Maria uses her kitchen to make the items she sells, as well as for home use.  That is why it is so important to her to build a room for the kitchen.  As you can see in the photo it is of laminated metal sheets and is fairly worn-out.  Not being able to count on having enough in her budget for this, Maria has come to FUSAI to ask for a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel and bricks to build a room for the kitchen in her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and bricks to build a room for the kitchen in her home

loans.name: G.s Cedros Malguara Group

texts.es:
Helder, tiene 25 años de edad, está soltero, no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres y hermanos en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura ayudando a sus padres. Hace  10 años que cultiva  papas, maíz y frijoles. La producción de papa la vende en el mercado local de la zona. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras en forma grupal, el cual utilizara para comprar abonos, insecticidas e fungicidas para la siembra de papa. Su plan es darle buena asistencia al cultivo y aumentar el nivel de producción.
El grupo se llama Cedros de Malguara, esta integrado por 4 miembros que se dedican al cultivo de papas y residen en la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal es por 35,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá en sus cultivos dándoles buena asistencia. En la foto se identifican de la siguiente manera: Antonia, Maria, Noé y Helder a la derecha.
texts.en:
Helder, 25 years old, is single and does not have children. He lives with his parents and siblings in a village in the city of Intibucá. 

He has always earned a living through agriulture, helping his parents. For 10 years, he's grown potatoes, corn and beans. He sells the potatoes he grows in the area's local market. 

The loan he's seeking is for 10,000 lempiras for the group, which he will use to buy composts, insecticides and fungicides for the planting of potatoes. His plan is to give his crop good support and increase his production level.

The group is called Cedros de Malguara. It's made up of four members who earn a living growing potatoes and live in the same community. The group loan is for 35,000 lempiras. They will invest this money in their crops, giving them good support. 

In the photo, they are shown in the following order, Antoni, Maria, Noé and Helder on the right.

loans.use: to buy composts, insecticides and fungicides for planting potatoes.

loans.name: Alltane

texts.en:
Alltane wants to thank all of the lenders for the last loan she was given. She was able to work on their home, replacing the doors and windows and completing general repairs. 

She was very satisfied with the loan process and the results, and is once again asking for a loan so that she can continue with the renovations and repair her toilet, which needs immediate attention. She is very happy about the improvement to her family’s standard of living so far, and is sure that with these last renovations, her children and family will enjoy an even better standard of living and better overall health. 

She wants to thank all lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: To continue with the renovations and repair her toilet, which needs immediate attention

loans.name: Tamina

texts.en:
Tamina is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance repairs to his taxi because its current condition is not good; it requires maintenance on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore, Tamina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Tamina's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily and provide better transportation services to earn a profitable income. Tamina  also plans to make savings with the profits of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Tamina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to look after her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hard working woman. Ruth is 23 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom currently attends school. For the past two years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells household commodities. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more household commodities, and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and educate her children. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a clothing business. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more household commodities

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is a hardworking woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 2 years, Aidah has been working hard to manage her canteen business, where she sells snacks. 

To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy soft drinks and snacks, and will help Aidah to generate greater profits and educate her children. Aidah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Aidah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is thankful that she previously was given a PHP 8,000 loan, which she used to purchase more grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and the family's personal, household and business expenses.

She would like to apply for a new loan, in the amount of PHP 12,000. She will use it to purchase additional groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to sell. Having more varied items displayed at her store will result in increased sales, and thus, increased income. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She is thanking God, in advance, for the financial support that will be granted to her.

Remedios aims to expand her business and put up a grocery store, someday. She also dreams of having a house of their own. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.


*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week, to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries, toiletries, and other products to sell.

loans.name: M Claire

texts.en:
M Claire is 32 years old and married with 4 children aged between 5 and 14, all of whom go to school. 

She has been running a mini market for 2 years, and with the loan she would like to buy more items to sell in her mini market. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her mini market.

loans.name: Soline

texts.en: Soline, 54 years old, is married and has four children between the ages of 22 and 25. All of them go to school. She has been selling vegetables for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more tomatoes and cabbages for resale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and cabbages for resale

loans.name: Xhevrije

texts.en:
Xhevrije needs your financial help to pay for her daughter's surgical procedure. The surgery has been scheduled in the beginning of October month. Since her daughter is in the hospital at the moment, she did not have the opportunity to be photographed with Xhevrije. Thus, Xhevrije was photographed with her daughter's child.

With your previous loan, she bought a cow from a good breed. Her family's financial situation has changed for the better since, as she had expected.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's surgical procedure

loans.name: Hyra

texts.en: Hyra wants to thank all of the lenders for their support and the loan that she received in order to repair her bathroom. She was able to purchase the tiles and repair the toilet, making the bathroom more sanitary and usable. This is a basic necessity that many people take for granted and Hyra is exceptionally grateful for. Now, she is requesting a loan to further improve their living conditions and would like to complete general repairs to their home. She once again is very thankful for this opportunity to provide her family with better conditions and life.

loans.use: To complete general repairs to her home

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a 37-year-old, married woman, and the mother of five children. She is from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband, for more than 17 years. This is the source of their income. Several months ago, a super typhoon hit the country and ruined several houses and businesses, including Analiza's fishing venture. Their income was greatly affected by it.

Now, Analiza is asking for a loan to buy a boat engine and propeller, fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and gasoline. With these items, her husband will be able to go back to fishing, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Analiza hopes to expand their business, so that it will augment their income. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine and propeller, fishing tackle, and gasoline

loans.name: Hawraa

texts.en:
Hawraa is a 25-year-old, married mother of one child. She works from home, as a tutor. She has been doing this work for eight years, in an attempt to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Hawraa is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to support her husband’s business by buying an ATV. He will rent it out during weekends and holidays, providing their family with an additional income to cover their increasing living needs.

Hawraa hopes to improve her family’s living conditions by expanding both her business and her husband‘s. She wants to make sure they can cover their family’s education and living needs.

loans.use: to support her husband’s business by buying an ATV for hire

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is 55, married and a mother of four children living in Lahore. Her husband has a clothing sales business. He buys a variety of clothes from the local wholesaler and then resells them at his shop. He is polite to his customers and keeps his shop clean and tidy. He has displayed clothes beautifully at his shop to attract more customers. He has four years of experience in this business. He is hard-working and motivated and wants to give his family a comfortable and good quality life. They live humbly in a simple rented house. 

In order to earn more profits he wants to buy more mid-summer clothes for his customers. For this purpose, Khursheed has requested a loan to help her husband buy clothes to sell at his shop. They are hopeful for a quality life.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her husband's clothing sales business

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and takes care of additional family members. 

Harriet operates a retail shop at the market and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of UGX 200,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy rice, beans, flour, sugar, and cooking oil. 

Harriet works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and fluctuating prices of commodities. She aspires to buy a refrigerator and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Santos Emeli

texts.es: Santos de 35 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos de 18, 13, 5 y 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer sencilla pero muy trabajadora que se gana la vida elaborando prendas de vestir, pero además prepara pupusas en su vivienda los fines de semana, y es gracias a sus esfuerzos que logra apoyar  a su compañero de vida con los gastos económicos del hogar. Santos ha observado que en el techo de su vivienda se filtra la lluvia, lo que está deteriorando sus pocas pertenencias, pero al no contar con el financiamiento necesario para cambiarlo, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines, capotes y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Santos is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and their 4 children (18, 13, 5 and 3 years old). She is a simple woman, but very hardworking. She makes a living as a dressmaker and also makes pupusas (stuffed tortillas) on weekends. Thanks to her efforts, she can support her life partner with their household expenses. Santos has noticed that her home's roof has a water leakage, which is deteriorating their few belongings.
