As she does not have the financial resources to replace the roof, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheets, protective covers and pins to replace her home's roof.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheets, protective covers and pins to replace her home's roof.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a hard-working woman. She is 25 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso, in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past five years, Alice has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells maize and coffee.

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize and coffee, and will help Alice to add stock, generate greater profits, and accumulate capital. Alice hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business and build a house.

Alice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and coffee.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 45 years old. She is married and has six children, aged between 4 and 22. All of her children go to school. She has been selling wedding clothes for women, for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more wedding clothes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more wedding clothes to resell

loans.name: Abner

texts.en:
Abner is 32 years old and married. He and his spouse have been blessed with one child. He has a pharmacy business, from which he makes a monthly income of KES 30,000.

He will be using this loan to buy more stock of medicine, to sell at his pharmacy business. He will use the anticipated profits to open another pharmacy store.

This is Abner's fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he has repaid his previous loans successfully. In future, Abner hopes to grow his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to add stock of medicine.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hard-working woman. She is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso, in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past four months, Agnes has been working hard to manage her salon business, where she provides hair dressing services.

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase weaves, chemicals, braids, and dryers, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and personal development. Agnes hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the salon.

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase hair dryers and hair dressing supplies

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a 28-year-old merchant, from the town of Ajuy, Iloilo. He runs a sari-sari (or retail store) business, selling various goods to the people in his place. Ben's store was greatly affected when a super typhoon hit the country several months ago.

Ben is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda, coffee, sugar, bread and biscuits, snack foods, cooking oil, and seasonings, among others. With this loan, he will be able to augment his stock, thus attracting more buyers into his store. Ben hopes to expand his business, so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stock, including canned goods, noodles, and seasonings

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 47-year-old man married to Rose, who adds additional income to their family, and they are blessed with three children. Peter has been a farmer for ten years earning himself an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.
  
Peter was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 40,000 and intends to use this amount to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm plantation.

Peter plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees to his children and hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm plantation.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has a clothes-selling business in Nairobi town. She is 24 years old and married to Robert, who also provides additional income to support the family, and together they have been blessed with one child. She also supports two children in her family. She has been in this business for two years and her current monthly salary is KES 10,000.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell as this will enable her to make more profits which she will use to provide for the needs of her family.

This is Nancy's second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loan successfully. In future she hopes to grow her business and also be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a hard working woman. She is 21 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Sharon has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of charcoal, and will help her to generate greater profits and provide for her child. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a boutique of clothes and expand on business. 

Sharon is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is  widowed and  raises vegetables to sell, which he has been doing since he was very young. He earns good income from this and had repaid successfully his previous loan used for buying seedlings and fertilizer. It improved the farm and yet he still needs financial assistance for farm expansion. He cultivates a vacant lot. 

He took a new loan recently to buy organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients and a variety of vegetable seedlings.  In the future, he wants to have a greener farm to ensure a better source of income, which he is sure he can achieve with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is a hard working woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past four years, Jesca has been working hard to manage her food stall business, which sells bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes. 

To help expand her business, Jesca has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bunches of bananas, and will help her to generate greater profits and educate her child. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a saloon business. 

Jesca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: María de 48 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos de 22, 19, 15, 13 y 12 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que buscando ganarse la vida y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de refrescos y frutas en un lugar estratégico de su comunidad, lo que le permite apoyar a su esposo con la economía del hogar, y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. María desea construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y ladrillos para construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, age 48, lives in her own home, together with her husband and their five children, ages 22, 19, 15, 13, and 12.  She is an enterprising woman who, looking to earn a living and get her children ahead, works selling drinks and fruit from a strategic spot in her community.  This lets her support her husband with the household finances and give her kids a better quality of life. 

María wants to build a septic tank in her home, so she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, rebar, and bricks.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, rebar, and bricks to build a septic tank for her home.

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga is a married woman with five children. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Kanga has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Kanga dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, Kanga wants to purchase stocks of wheat, maize, beans, and rice. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat, maize, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 37 años de edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y decidido para poder superar en la vida, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino el alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, el tiene tres hijos que mantener el primero ya trabaja para ayudar en los recursos económicos de su familia y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. 	

El obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde el vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 10 años, el realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en: Manuel is 37 years old. He is an enterprising man who is set on moving forward in life. He does not let himself be hindered by the obstacles that life brings, but he strives for his goals and dreams. He has three children to support; the oldest one already works to help with the financial resources of the family. The other two are excellent students in their community's school. Manuel earns his income through the production of bananas in the community where he lives. His parents taught him this activity 10 years ago. He sells his product at the market and in the surrounding areas of his community, and with this he has an income to improve the life conditions of his family. He will use the loan to maintain his banana crops, since it is very important to have banana plants that produce high quality fruit, and in this way not lose his customers. One of his greatest goals is to grow more banana plants and to see his children have more education and become professionals in life.

loans.use: to maintain his banana crops.

loans.name: Jaime Manuel

texts.es: Jaime de 50 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 6 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que esforzándose por sacar adelante a su familia, sale todos los días a vender helados y paletas por las calles de su municipio, y es gracias a ello que logra sostener la economía familiar en conjunto con su compañera de vida, la cual presta sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, y es así como están sacando adelante a sus hijos. Jaime ha observado que el techo de su vivienda se encuentra en muy mal estado es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines, pines y capotes para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Jaime is 50 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their two children (14 and 6 years old). He is an entrepreneurial man that makes an effort to get his family ahead and goes out everyday to sell ice cream and popsicles in the streets of his town. Thanks to that, he is able to cover the household expenses with his life partner, who works as a cleaning lady in people's homes. This is how they are getting their children ahead in life. Jaime has noticed that his home's roof is in very bad shape and this is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheets, dimension lumber, pins and protective covers to replace his home's roof.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheets, dimension lumber, pins and protective covers to replace his home's roof.

loans.name: Bahaa Baysour Group

texts.en:
Oussaima is is the featured borrower for Bahaa Baysour group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Oussaima is a 43-year-old single Syrian refugee. After the war in Syria, she left her country for Lebanon with her mother searching for a safe living place. She is the sole earner and supporter of her mother. Oussaima is working hard to survive her low financial and social living conditions. A year ago she started to take care of an elder woman in return of a limited salary. Thus she started her own business beside this job as clothes saleswoman in attempt to increase her income and thus cover the expenses and needs of her mother. Today, Oussaima is acquiring a loan to increase her business merchandise with more fashionable clothes for the upcoming autumn season. 

With respect to the other group members, Houda is a 48-year-old married mother of two children, works in making handicrafts, and wants to renovate her house, while Wafa is a 22-year-old married mother of one child. She works as a Brazilian gold saleswoman and wants to fix her car to facilitate her business.

Oussaima is the first lady on the left, Houda is one in the middle, and Wafa is the first one on the right side of the photo.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with more fashionable clothes for the upcoming autumn season.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Rafael de 54 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 20 y 15 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia y darles lo mejor que puede, es por ello que todos los días sale a ganarse el pan de cada día gracias a su trabajo como albañil, además siembra granos básicos como: maíz y frijol tanto para el consumo como para su comercialización, Rafael ha iniciado con la construcción de un cuarto en su vivienda pero por no contar con suficiente dinero decidió hacerlo de lámina, aunque no le parece seguro, por lo que desea construirlo de ladrillo y cemento. Es por ello que Rafael solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y ladrillos para construir un cuarto de ladrillo y cemento en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rafael, age 54, lives in his own home, together with his partner and their two children, ages 15 and 20.  He is a hardworking man who makes an effort to get his family ahead.  He works to give them the best that he can.  It is because of this that he heads out each day to earn their daily bread thanks to his work as a construction worker.  Additionally, he raises basic staples such as corn and beans, as much for their own consumption as to sell them.  

Rafael has begun construction on a room in his house but, due to not having enough money, he decided to build it with metal sheeting.  This didn’t seem safe to him, so he wants to build it out of brick and cement.  Because of this, Rafael is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, rebar, and bricks in order to build a brick and cement room on his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, rebar, and bricks in order to build a room for his home.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans has a curio business in Nairobi town. He is 42 years old, married and has been blessed with one child. He also supports six people in his family. He has been in this business for 20 years and his current monthly income is KES 10,000.

He will be using this loan to buy more beads, threads, sisal strings and threads, sewing needles and ornaments for making bracelets, necklace and wristbands. He anticipates to make more profits which he will use to grow his business and repay the loan.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in the future he hopes to grow his business and also be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy more beads, threads and ornaments.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 42-year-old woman, married to Michael, who adds additional income to their family, and they are blessed with six children.  Nancy has been a farmer for ten years, earning her an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000 and intends to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her farm plantation.

Nancy plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings for her farm plantation.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 46 years old. She is married with five children aged between one and 25, three of them go to school. She has been selling vegetables for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes and cabbages to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Saphina

texts.en:
Saphina is a 50-year-old hard-working woman married to Bernard, who earns additional income to support their family. They are blessed with four children. Saphina has been a farmer for 10 years earning an income of KES 8,000 every month.

Saphina was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000 which she intends to use to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm plantation. 

Saphina plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and she hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm plantation.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 24-year-old single man who opened a car accessories selling business four years ago to help his family and cover his living needs and expenses.

Throughout these years, Rami gained a good reputation among his customers for his good services and special quality of accessories available. Today, he is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with new releases and to renovate his house and make it a healthier living place for him and his family.

Rami always hopes to expand his business in future and increase his income to save some profit for his upcoming future.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with new releases and to renovate his house and make it a healthier living place for him and his family.

loans.name: Martiniano

texts.en: Martiniano is 49 years old. He did not have the financial resources to finish school. He is married and his wife is earning income from selling rice in their village. He raises pigs to earn income for the family.  He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for buying feed. Recently, he took a new loan to buy feeding supplies for his pigs. In the future, he wants to have a better house than he has now and to give his family a better future. He is sure that he can achieve his goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies for his pigs.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es:
Gaspar tiene 37 años de edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y decidido para poder superar en la vida, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino el alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, el tiene siete hijos que mantener, los primeros  tres ya tienen familias apartes y los cuatros últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. 	

El obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de maxan en la comunidad donde el vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 15 años, el realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para la compra de terreno para poder cultivar mas maxan en su comunidad, ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de maxan produzcan hojas de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es la siembra de más plantas de maxan y ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Gaspar is 37 years old.  He is an enterprising man, determined to succeed in life.  He doesn’t allow the obstacles that life places before him to defeat him.  Instead he reaches all his goals and dreams.  He has seven children to provide for.  The oldest three already have their own families, and the last four are excellent students in the community school.

He gets his earnings by producing maxan (leaves used in traditional foods) in the community where he lives.  His parents taught him this line of work fifteen years ago.  He sells his produce in the market and in the outskirts of his community.  In this way, he has financial earnings in order to improve the living conditions of his family.

The respective use he has for the loan is to buy a plot of land in order to grow more maxan in his community.  It is really important to him that his maxan plants produce top-quality leaves so that he won’t lose customers he counts on.

One of his biggest aspirations is to sow more maxan plants and to see his children grow in their education, becoming professionals in their lifetimes.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Mwandia

texts.en:
Mwandia is married with six children who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open-air food business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 35-year-old mother of three children and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband owns a printing shop. He is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the need of all family members. Nazia has been running her own beauty salon for past five years. She also contributes her income to manage the household. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon. Due to financial constraints she is not capable of buying these items for her business. Therefore, Nazia has applied for a Kiva loan in a group with other two members. This loan will help her to buy the necessary items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. The loan will also help her to earn maximum profit to fulfill the needs of her business and family. For this financial assistance, Nazia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Shalom Self Hep Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Grace; a member of Shalom Self help Group. She is 30 years old and a single mother of four children. She practices maize, bean, and vegetable farming. She has been running these activities for over seven years. Most of the produce is for commercial purpose which she sells to the nearby markets. She gained a lot of knowledge on enterprise management from the training she received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. Grace feels that the demand for vegetables has grown. This makes her borrow a loan to expand her farming activities by buying fertilizer. She hopes her harvest will increase hence a rise in the level of income. This will enable her cater for her family needs such as food and clothing.

Grace is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial help. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Diego Alejandro

texts.es:
Diego cuenta con 3 años de experiencia trabajando en empresas elaborando pasteles, postres y todo lo relacionado con panadería pero veía que ser empleado no daba para mucho y con mucha dificultad y trabajando horas extras apenas podía llevar el sustento para su hogar y para su hijo. 

Buscando mejores oportunidades de vida Diego quiso superarse y lanzarse a la aventura como independiente, alquilo un negocio e inicio su propia panadería la cual lleva operando hace casi dos años. 

Como todo negocio que inicia tiene muchas dificultades y la más marcada es la económica, esa falta de capital para invertir y ser una mejor empresa  competente en el mercado.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en latas nuevas que son donde pone a hornear sus panes pues las que tiene están en muy mal estado, comprara sillas, mesas y materia prima para realizar sus panes y tener acompañantes para estos como bebidas.

Su negocio será muy beneficiado pues tendrá una mejor atención al cliente y quiere mejorar sus ingresos pues sueña con comprar el local ya que el arrendamiento es muy caro y frena su progresa.
texts.en:
Diego has three years' experience working in businesses making cakes, desserts, and just about everything related to a bakery.  He saw that being an employee didn’t give him much.  With a lot of difficulty and extra hours of work, he could barely maintain his household and his child.

Looking for better opportunities in life, Diego wanted to improve himself and set out on an adventure on his own.  He rented a business and began his own bakery, which he has been operating for almost two years.

As with any business, he has a lot of difficulties, the most noteworthy being the economy, a lack of capital to invest, and being a relevant business in the market.

He wants to ask for a loan to invest in new baking pans for his bread, because the ones he has now are in bad condition.  He will buy chairs, tables, and ingredients for his bread, as well as accompaniments such as drinks for his baked goods.

His business will really benefit because he will have better customer service.  He wants to improve his income because he dreams of buying his stall; the rent is very expensive and is halting his progress.

loans.use: to buy new bread pans, chairs, tables, drinks, and ingredients in order to improve his customer service.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 49-year-old widowed woman with five children living in Takeo province of Cambodia. She fattens ducks and chickens at home and she has been in this fattening since 1999. Three of her children are garment-factory workers and others are students. Together, they can earn approximately $13 per day. 

Now Phuong would like to request a loan to buy duck and chicken feed. This loan will help her have enough feed for her chickens and ducks and earn more income. In the future, she would like to expand her fattening, build a new house, and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy duck and chicken feed

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is from Lahore. She is 39, married, and a mother of seven children. One of her daughters runs a beauty salon in her community. Zakia is proud of her daughter and always supports and encourages her. The daughter started her salon many years ago to support her father in generating income and now she has gained good experience and has manage to retain many customers. Her customers are satisfied and happy with her services. She provides facials, haircut, make up, blow dry etc services. She is polite and talented.

Now that her business is growing she wants to buy additional items for the salon and enhance her salon by replacing some worn out items like a chair, a dryer, etc. But due to shortage of funds, her mother Zakia has requested a loan to help her daughter in her business. Her daughter plans to earn more profits, become self-sufficient, and be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To enhance her daughter's beauty salon with new equipment

loans.name: Greda Group

texts.en:
The group is located in Teshie and it is composed of four members. They are in the sale of plastic products, charcoal, maize, sachet water, cassava, palm fruits, plantain, shirts, underwear and secondhand clothing. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

Awo is a widow and all her children are grown up. She is 64 years old and deals in the charcoal, maize and sachet water business. She started her business in 2008 to improve her standard of living, and also to be self-employed.

She is taking out the loan to buy charcoal, maize and sachet water for the business. Her clients are people from the same area. Her hope for the future is to build a firm business so that she can serve her customers better. She describes herself as a hardworking woman who appreciates the services that lenders offer.

loans.use: To buy charcoal, maize and sachet water for the business.

loans.name: Jahel

texts.es: Jahel de 52 años de edad es una mujer que vive con sus 3 hijos ya mayores de edad en vivienda propia. Ella es emprendedora y gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos que ya son mayores de edad y le apoyan con la economía del hogar, además Jahel sigue ganándose la vida como vendedora de joyería y productos naturales por catalogo, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años, por lo que su cartera de clientes es muy buena y gracias a su buena actitud cada día son más los clientes que solicitan sus productos. En la vivienda de Jahel hay muchas reparaciones que hacer ya que como se observa en la fotografía el pasamanos de su vivienda se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que necesita repararlo además la pila y las puertas de su vivienda se encuentran deterioradas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tubos y ángulos de hierro, cemento, arena y grava para reparar el pasamano, las puertas y la pila de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jahen is 52 years old and is a mother who lives with her three adult children in her own home. She is entrepreneurial and hardworking and thanks to her efforts has been able to support her adult children who help her with the household work and expenses. Aside from this Jahel continues to earn a living as a jewelry salesperson and selling natural products through a catalog. She has been doing this for ten years and has a substantial client base and thanks to her good attitude each day more clients seek and request her products. 

Jahel’s home is in need of numerous repairs. As one can observe from the photograph; the handrail, stair walkway and the doors are in a deteriorated state. For this she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in: metal tubes and angles, cement, sand, and gravel to repair the handrail, the doors, and the stair walkway to her home.

loans.use: To invest in: metal tubes and angles, cement, sand, and gravel to repair the handrail, the doors, and the stair walkway to her home.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine has a beauty salon in Nairobi town and has been running it for two years now. She is 35 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with two children, aged six and two years old. Her spouse also provides additional income to support the family.

Christine will be using this loan to buy hair weaves, hair oil, hair clippers, and combs, for use in her business. This will enable her to serve her customers well. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and also to service the loan. 

This is Christine's third loan from VisionFund Kenya. In the future, Christine hopes to grow her business and be able to support her family.

loans.use: to buy hair products and salon equipment.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 51 years old and he is a farmer. He grows cash crops to sell and also engages in poultry farming. Additionally, he owns rental houses. He is married, and he and his spouse have been blessed with three children who are all over 18 years old.

David will be using this loan to buy more chickens for rearing. This will also enable him to get more eggs for his supply. He will use the generated profits to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer and also to repay the loan. 

This is his sixth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he has paid his previous loans successfully. In the future, David hopes to grow his farming business and live a successful life with his family.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for rearing.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Binti dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 40,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and soap for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and soap for sale.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Pascual tiene 43 años de edad soltero, el es una hombre emprendedor y decidido para poder superar en la vida, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino el alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, el tiene cinco hijos que mantener el primero ya trabaja para ayudar en los recursos económicos de su familia y los  últimos cuatros  son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. 	

El obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde el vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 35 años, el realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida y construir casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
Pascual is 43 years old and single.  He is an enterprising man, determined to succeed in life.  He doesn’t allow the obstacles that life sends him to defeat him, but rather achieves all his goals and dreams.  He has five children to provide for.  The oldest is working to help with the family finances, and the last four are excellent students in the community school.

He gets his income from banana production, working in the community where he lives.  His parents taught him this line of work 35 years ago.  He makes his sales in the market and in the outskirts of the community.  In this way he gets an income in order to improve his family’s living conditions.

His plan for the loan is to provide maintenance to his banana trees, because it is really important to him that his banana trees produce top-quality fruit so he doesn’t lose any customers that he is counting on.

One of his biggest aspirations is to plant more banana trees and to see his children grow in their education, becoming professionals in their lifetimes.  He also wants to build a house for his children so that they have adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to keep up his banana trees

loans.name: Nelliah

texts.en:
Nelliah is a 21-year-old businesswoman from Gokwe North District of Zimbabwe. She lives with her two brothers. To earn a living, Nelliah buys and sells melamine (recycled plastics) products. Her business has been running for over a year now, and she hopes to grow her business into a large retail shop. When Nelliah is not working, she is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide who teaches young students how to overcome life obstacles. 

With a loan from Kiva, Nelliah will be able to increase her inventory. Her sales will increase, and she will make more money that can go toward supporting her brothers through school.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in balconies and doors to put up in her house.

loans.name: Esnath

texts.en: Esnath is a 21-year-old businesswoman who lives in the rural district of Gokwe North, Zimbabwe. Esnath operates a grocery shop, and she has been doing so for five months. She dreams of expanding into general dealership because most of her income comes from the grocery shop. Esnath also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in her spare time; she helps make learning fun for local students. Esnath is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she can increase the amount of products in her shop. She will be able to then sell more items, and earn more profits. This will enable her to improve her life.

loans.use: To increase the amount of products in her shop.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is 45, married and blessed with two children. They belong to a poor family. They live in a small rented house in Lahore. Her husband has been a rickshaw driver for the past eight years. He has to work really hard to make sure that all their family expenses are fulfilled. 

Now his rickshaw needs some repair, but he is short of cash. Its timely repair is important as it is their only source of income. Therefore, Jameela has requested a loan to help her husband repair his rickshaw in a timely manner so that her husband can bring home some income to pay for the regular expenses. 

They are thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their timely assistance.

loans.use: To pay the repair cost of the rickshaw

loans.name: Dismus

texts.en:
Dismus is 33 years old and married to Miriam. together they have been blessed with one child who is 6 years old. He also supports four members of his family. He has a printing and stationery supplies business which he has been running for five years. Right now his current monthly income is KES 50,000.

Dismus will be using this loan to buy printing paper both for supply and for use in his business. He will also buy more stock of printing toner. He will use the anticipated profits to construct rental houses. 

This is his sixth loan term with Visionfund Kenya, and he has paid his previous loans successfully. In the future, he hopes to open other businesses and be a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy printing paper and printing toner.

loans.name: Hamed

texts.en:
Hamed is a 19-year-old married Syrian citizen, who started eight years ago working as a blacksmith to cover his family’s living expenses and needs.

Throughout the years he succeeded in attracting customers and gaining a good reputation in his region for the good quality of work provided and his services.

Today, Hamed is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to cover the expenses of his wife’s expected baby delivery.

This loan will help Hamed welcome his new child with better living conditions as he always hopes to expand his business and save some profit for his child’s future.

loans.use: To cover the expenses of his wife’s expected baby delivery.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a single mother of one child and her child and goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister). She has a retail shop business and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, and a bag of rice. She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to become a wholesaler. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of timely loans. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and a bag of rice.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Luvuno operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal sellers.
 
With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam appreciates the support of her previous loan, which helped her to buy goats for sale. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of 15,000 KES to add four more goats to her business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva at large.

loans.use: to add four more goats for her business

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Zawadi operates a stall where she sells grocery vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha, age 26, is a married woman. She has been making shoes for the past five years. She is an energetic person and eager to support her family. She has three children. She is responsible for meeting the basic necessities of her children, including food, health and education. Through her business she earns a good income. 

This is Aisha's fourth year with Kashf Foundation. With the support of Kashf Foundation she is fulfilling her dreams and is able to manage her children’s education. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy additional raw materials, including thread, needles, leather, artificial leather and plastic soles. In this way she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and hence can better support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her shoe-making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get working capital to be able to buy the materials that are offered to him daily to carry out his work.  He is also looking to finish his house for his children.

loans.name: Sibani Maa Shg Group

texts.en:
Jema is a 30-year-old lady living with her husband and her three children, who are studying in school. She has two cows and sells milk in her village. Her husband is a farmer who helps Jema in her business. Jema's monthly income is very low. That is why she is unable to give more money to her son to get admitted to a good college. 

Jema has formed a group that is called Sibani Maa Self Help group (SHG). All the members of this group are women engaged in different kinds of activities, like milk selling, vegetable selling, flower selling, etc. All the members of this group are very cooperative with each other. 

Jema, along with her group, has requested a loan amount of 165,000 INR, and she will use her portion for purchasing a cow and fodder. She has a dream to educate her children and give a better standard of life to her family. She is very thankful to Kiva for this help and support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder.

loans.name: Saraswiti Group

texts.en:
Sasmita is the leader of a group and lives in M.Rampur in the district of Kalahandi, Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 26 years. She has a small family comprised of four members: herself, her husband, one son, and one daughter, aged 2 & 5 respectively. The member standing first from left wearing a white sari in the first row is Sasmita.  

Like many families in the locality, she and her husband are running a betel and tea shop in her town. In the morning and evening, her husband looks after the shop while his wife does her household duties. In the afternoon, she herself looks after the shop.  She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts.

Sasmita’s husband helps her in purchasing sugar, tea, milk, and betel ingredients from the local market to run her shop smoothly. At present her family income is INR 6,000 per month from her shop which is not sufficient to maintain her family. 

To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail a loan from Mahashakti.  From the loan amount, she will purchase bulk quantity of tea items like sugar, tea, and betel ingredients to avail a cash discount and also save time which she incurs frequently. She has a dream to add some extra items like cold drinks, Ice cream, etc., to her shop and to educate her child in a better playschool.

The other 10 members of her group are Anu, Basanti, Manjulata, Purnima, Surekha, Kumari, Bhabani, Urbasi, Damayanti, and Sukanti, doing individual businesses in the town.

loans.use: to purchase tea materials and betel ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies in order to take care of her tomato plants.

loans.name: Sheedan

texts.en: Sheedan is a 53-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of cattle purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of eight children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She is in her second loan cycle and has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She intends to utilize the loan amount to purchase more cattle. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is a 47-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past 10 years, she has been running a cloth purchase-and-resale business. Tahira buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells it to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Now, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena is a 36-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase two more calves. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing basic necessities to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom, age 25, is a married woman.  She has four children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  Five years ago she started up a business selling animals with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. 

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her second loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of sorts of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Jameela requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy new varieties of cloth, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. She is hopeful to get an increase in her sales and profits at the same time. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy new varieties of cloth

loans.name: Tanveer

texts.en: Tanveer has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a  good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase a stock of rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, juices and flour.  This will enable her to increase her sales to earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, juices and flour.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en: Ola is a 27-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children who are attending school. In 2012, she established a business selling accessories such as bags, women's charm accessories, etc. Her husband has a computer shop and he joins forces with her to provide the family with a satisfying income. Today, with her youth loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will expand her store’s inventory to increase her sales and hence her revenue. In the future, Ola plans to enlarge her trade by adding more items to sell in her shop.

loans.use: expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is a 56-year-old married woman from the village of Dighomi. She lives with her husband and daughter, who works as a cashier at the local store. Lali's husband is a daily worker, who earns approximately 160 GEL per month. Lali is a nurse and has a fixed salary. However, in spite of their employment, the family lives in poverty and finds it hard to cover even their basic needs. 

Lali has a great desire to be involved in an agricultural activity and start dairy farming. She has requested a loan from MFO Credo, which approved her loan request within its start-up program, which gives rural people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Lali plans to purchase a dairy cow with the requested amount and then to produce milk products and start selling them. She will sell products at good prices and will have her own customers. 

Lali and her family rely on the goodwill of Kiva lenders and will be thankful to them for giving them a chance to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and produce milk products to sell

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en: Uzma is a 22-year-old vigorous married lady. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers

loans.name: Pmr Group

texts.en:
Rosalina is the featured borrower for PMR Group. She and her fellow group members came from Philippines to Lebanon to work as a housekeepers in order to improve the poor living conditions of their beloved families in Philippines. They got together to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have been friends since they arrived to Lebanon, as they are working hard to develop their living.

Rosalina is 54-year-old married mother of two children. She left her hometown in the Philippines in an attempt to improve the poor living conditions of her family there and satisfy her beloved children with a better life. Her acquired loan will be invested in paying her children's school fees. She is working hard to make sure they get the best education. 

The same case applies to the other group members. Pia Mae is 28-year-old married mother of two children, and Arjay is a 34-year-old married mother of one child. They both want to pay their children school fees.

Rosalina is the first one on the left side of the picture. Pia Mae is the lady in the middle, and Arjay is the one on the right.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees to make sure they get the best education

loans.name: Radhe Shyam Shg Group

texts.en:
For five years, Basanti worked alongside her husband running a medium-sized restaurant, or as the locals say, a “hotel business,” in their town in Odisha, a state in Eastern India. Together, they were well-known and respected members of the community. Last December, however, her husband got ill by a serious disease and now he is not very well to do some work, leaving her with the business to manage and two children to support on her own. She was devastated. 

Basanti is a strong woman, but it is a lot of pressure to run a business with six employees and support her children, especially in a community where most of the businesses are run by men. Nevertheless, she is determined to fulfill the dream of her husband to renovate and improve the hotel. They used to envision turning it into a full-service air-conditioned establishment. Through hard work, she has saved 70,000 INR for this project and is taking out this loan. With this, she will have enough to build new counters and buy an air conditioner. 

Basanti, along with her group has requested this loan and she will use her portion  pay for an air conditioner and to build new counters for her restaurant. She is so grateful for Kiva and People’s Forum to reaching out to the group like Radhe Shyam Shg and helping them improve their livelihoods.

loans.use: To pay for an air conditioner and to build new counters for her restaurant.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 56-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She has two cows and two calves; she sells their milk to many of her neighbors. She looks after the buffaloes, performs the task of collecting milk from them, and her husband sells to different places on daily basis. In this way they obtain decent profits. She uses the income to support her family. In order to make more profit, she has requested for a loan of 55,000 PKR to buy one more cow to cater to more customers. She hopes that this loan will help in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy one more cow

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en: Shamshad is 43 years old and a married woman and mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Shamshad’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Shamshad has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shamshad is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some auto spare parts

loans.name: Ekomefeemo 3 Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Ekomefeemo 3. It consists of five women from Teshie-Accra, Ghana. They applied for a loan of GHS 2,900 from ID-Ghana. They are selling kenkey (cooked corn paste), fish, charcoal, plastic bowls, basket, buckets, African wax-prints and loaves of bread. 

Helena is a 60-year-old single woman with only one dependent child (19 years old), living with her family in their family house in Teshie. Helena covers the  expenses and therefore she has to work so that she can fulfill her responsibilities. 

Helena will use her share of the loan to purchase corn dough, prepare kenkey, and sell it to her customers. She will also buy fish to sell as well. Helena is requesting a loan of GHS 900 from ID-Ghana in order to purchase enough and respond to her current customers' needs. The members will use group pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase corn dough, prepare kenkey (cooked corn paste), and sell it to customers.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline, aged 22 years, is married with 2 children aged between 2 and 5, and all of them go to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more tomatoes and pineapples for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and pineapples for sale.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Algo muy común de escuchar de los campesinos es cuando el pregunta su deseo y la respuesta por lo general de todos es “salir adelante”, para una persona que no habite en el sector no tiene mucho significado pero para esa persona salir adelante significa depositar todos sus deseos y esfuerzos en un negocio que les permite llevar el sustento a su familia, que les permite tomar una merecida cerveza con sus amigos, que gracias a este pueden tener a sus hijos estudiando, seguir adelante no es solo es una palabra para ellos es sinónimo de gloria, de sed de triunfo de progreso. 

Los invitamos a apoyar al señor Sebastián un hombre habitante de la vereda el patonal, el cual tiene un negocio de venta de productos de uso personal, como lo es desodorante, talco para pies, crema de manos, curas, cremas calientes parta tratar heridas, toallas, toallas de mujer que son tan necesarias y que estas personas no pueden tener acceso a ellas. 

El sueño de Sebastián es seguir adelante y tener salud para buscar siempre lo mejor para él y su familia. 
La importancia de este crédito no es solo pro Sebastián es por las diferentes personas que habitan en la vereda y que pueden acceder a estos productos sin tener que desplazarse a la cabecera municipal que puede quedar a una, dos, tres horas de sus hogares.
texts.en:
Something that is commonly heard among country folk is when they are asked their desires, and everyone's response is generally "to get ahead." For a person who doesn't live in the area, it doesn't have much meaning, but for this person, getting head means putting all his desires and efforts into a business that allows him to support his family, that allows him to drink a well-deserved beer with his friends, that thanks to this, allows him to send his children to school. Getting ahead is not just a word for them, it is synonymous with glory, with the thirst for triumph and progress.

We invite you to support Sebastián, a man who lives in the neighborhood of El Patonal. He has a business selling personal use products like deodorant, foot talc, hand cream, band aids, hot creams to treat wounds, towels, and feminine napkins which are so necessary and to which these people do not have access.

Sebastián's dream is to get ahead and to be healthy enough to always look for the best for himself and his family. The importance of this loan is not just for Sebastián, it's for the various people who live in the neighborhood and who can access these products without having to travel to the municipal seat that can be one, two, or three hours from their homes.

loans.use: to buy deodorants, feminine products, cotton, and hand cream, products that are very scarce in the neighborhood.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Sidi operates a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreaks causing losses as a challenge in the business. Sidi dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past five years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zips, buttons, etc. to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zips, buttons, etc

loans.name: Zewa

texts.en:
Zewa is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Zewa operates a vegetable-selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.



With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hard-working woman. Gloria is 17 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kamapala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Gloria has been working hard to manage her restaurant where she sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Gloria has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food items for the restaurant, and will help Gloria to generate greater profits and further her personal development. Gloria hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a clothing shop. 

Gloria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy food items for the restaurant

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
Aisha's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Aisha is 23 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, where she rears chickens. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy chicken feed, and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and educate her children. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 25-year-old Lebanese married woman, living with her husband. In 2012, she started to work as a private teacher at her home. Zeinab states that she really loves her occupation especially when she feels pleased while teaching students. Her husband is a baker and they work in collaboration with each other to meet the household needs. 

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase a laptop with the aim of smoothing her work preparations.  In the future, Zeinab looks forward to borrowing more Kiva loans to improve her business and earn a higher income as she wants to have a baby and must be ready financially to handle the total expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop

loans.name: Helene

texts.en: Helene is a 59-year-old Lebanese married woman. She is a talented tailor, working in this type of business for the past 14 years. She produces different clothing designs and makes repairs as well. Today, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase new machinery and other tailoring products. Helene tends to achieve more improvements and enhancements in her life to reach her goals, particularly financial-wise.

loans.use: to purchase new machinery and other tailoring products

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma operates a tailoring business. She makes suits for women and men. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business. She appreciates the support of the previous loan. With this KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is earning a good amount of income by doing the work of hand-embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she was able to purchase required raw material. Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment. The loan will allow her to meet the orders of her customers on-time. She is in her fourth loan cycle, with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Zinat

texts.en:
Zinat is a 48-year-old married mother of one child. Twenty-one years ago she decided to start her own business from her house and started to work as a tailor, to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. 

Zinat worked hard throughout the years to provide her family with better living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house in order to make it a healthier living place for her beloved family. She will use this loan to put a sink in her kitchen to clean her kitchenware.

She hopes to stay in good health to remain capable of financially supporting her family.

loans.use: To renovate her house in order to make it a healthier living place for her beloved family.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a hard-working woman. She is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Veronica has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells juice, bread, sugar, and salt. 

To help expand her business, Veronica has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more juice, bread, sugar, and salt and will help Veronica to generate greater profits and provide for her child. Veronica hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Veronica is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: purchase more juice, bread, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 35 years old and married.  She and her spouse have been blessed with 2 children. She also supports 4 people in her family and her spouse does provide additional income. She has a retail shop and has been in the business for 6 years. Right now her monthly income is KES 15,000.

She will be using this loan to add to her stock of sugar, rice and flour for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock to her shop. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in the future she hopes to open a big wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and flour.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 72 años de edad, estudió poco en la escuela, está casado y su esposa se dedica a oficios domésticos y por las tardes vende pupusas y han procreado 4 hijos.


Eduardo es empleado de una institución del gobierno, ya tiene 10 años laborando en el lugar y su horario de 
trabajo es de 8:AM a 3:30 PM.

 
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar uniformes y zapatos especiales, para sus 2 hijos que están estudiando agronomía en la universidad. 

Él sueña con que sus hijos culminen con éxito su carrera de agronomía y encuentren un buen trabajo para que puedan mantenerse.
texts.en:
72-year old Eduardo didn't attend school for very long. He is married; his wife looks after the household and then in the afternoons sells stuffed tortillas. They have four children. Eduardo has been a government employee for ten years, and his hours of work are 8am to 3:30pm.

He needs a loan to buy uniforms and special shoes for his two children who are studying agriculture at university. 

Eduardo's dream is to see his children complete their agricultural qualifications and get good jobs so they can support themselves.

loans.use: to purchase uniforms and special shoes for his two children that study agriculture at their university
